detail: The Bettendorf system is located close to the Hoff and Sakhara V systems. Bettendorf was invaded during the first half of the major invasion into the Federated Suns launched by the Draconis Combine in May 2787.

name: Bex
detail: Bex was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bhaktapur
detail: Bhaktapur was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bharat
detail: Bharat was originally settled by colonists from Terra's Indian subcontinent. They brought with them many Terran tree species. The world's only military manufacturer is Killosh Industries, notable for producing the Magi tank.

name: Bhykov
detail: Bhykov was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bicester
detail: The Bicester system is located in the Xinyang Prefecture of the Benjamin Military District within the Draconis March. The system is located close to the Omagh and Yumesta systems, and has terrain suitable for MechWarrior training.

name: Biegga
detail: Biegga was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Biham
detail: Prior to human habitation Biham had an extremely fragile ecosystem; this ecosystem was brutalised during the human occupation of the world. The corporate headquarters of Yoshimatsu Chemicals and a major plastics and polymers plant are located here.

name: Bilma
detail: Bilma was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Biloela
detail: The Biloela system is located close to the Bobruisk and Maisons systems. The Biloela system was colonized at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Binyang
detail: Binyang was one of a number of worlds conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth as part of a two-pronged invasion of the Free Worlds League that threatened to capture the important industrial world of Acrux.

name: Biota
detail: The Biota system was located near the Cusset and Rastaban systems. Biota was settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Birmensdorf
detail: The Birmensdorf system is home to at least one habitable world and is located in the June Operational Area of the Periphery March within the Federated Suns. Birmensdorf was settled during the Age of War by the United Hindu Collective.

name: Birqash
detail: The Birqash system is the location of at least one habitable world or construct and is located in the Sirdar Operational Area of the Capellan March within the Federated Suns. The Birqash system is located close to the El Kerak and Kiserian systems.

name: Bismarck
detail: The Bismarck system is home to a tropical world that is known for it's lush forests and lumber exports. The Bismarck system was located near the Lengkong and Mankova systems. Bismarck was settled during or shortly before the Age of War

name: Bithinia
detail: Bithinia is best known for it's tourist resorts which cater to the richest citizens of both the Capellan Confederation and foreigners. There is also significant iron mining on the planet, making Bithinia an important steel supplier.

name: Biuque
detail: The Biuque system is home to at least one habitable world and is located near the Krievci and Wrociaw systems. Biuque was settled during or shortly before the Age of War.

name: Bjarred
detail: The Bjarred system was located near the New Sarum and Sawyer systems and consists of a class F4V primary orbited by at least five planets. A recharge station was in place at the nadir jump point during the thirty-first century.

name: Bjornlunda
detail: The Bjornlunda system is located in the Donegal Province of the Lyran Commonwealth. The Bjornlunda system was located near the Jaumegarde and Turinge systems. Bjornlunda was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Blackbone (Nyserta 3025+)
detail: The Elysian worlds (Elissa, Mangringaine, and Nyserta) are temperate planets maintained in their pristine wilderness state. The people supported themselves mainly as hunters and gatherers.

name: Black Earth
detail: Black Earth was intended to be a "hedgehog", a giant fortified firebase that the Rim Worlds Republic  forces could use to slow the advance of any invading force. Black Earth was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Blackjack
detail: The Blackjack system was located near the Goat Path and Hot Springs systems and consists of a class G3V primary orbited by at least three planets. Blackjack became infamously known to being the home of the Blackjack School of Conflict.

name: Blackstone
detail: Sharp jagged black rocks coat the landscape of this world, known for it's stoneworks. Blackstone has been home to many pirate bands over the years.

name: Blair Atholl
detail: Blair Atholl was settled during the Star League era, and is damp rainy world where the most prosperous life forms are the various types of fungus. Malthus Gambling Unlimited is rumoured to use the planet as a tax haven.

name: Blandinsville
detail: A once beautiful world that is now scarred with dead zones from attacks centuries ago during the First Succession War, Blandinsville now relies on a skilled workforce to produce consumer electronics.

name: Blandou
detail: Blandou was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Blida
detail: Blida was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Blommestein
detail: Blommestein was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Blue Diamond
detail: The world of Blue Diamond was struck by a plague in 2766 that swept through the crops grown on the planet and killed over a third of the population. It is now the site of several medical research facilities dedicated to disease control.

name: Blue Hole
detail: The preponderance of fresh water on Blue Hole immediately made colonists wealthy as they exported fresh water to any number of worlds in the Lyran Commonwealth. Tourism also forms a large part of the economy.

name: Blue Sava
detail: Blue Sava was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Blueys
detail: Blueys was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bluford
detail: Settled around 500 years ago, Bluford is a small agricultural planet known for it's unusual native flora, most of which causes altered mental states in humans.

name: Blumenort
detail: Originally settled by Canadians from Terra, Blumenort is a non-descript temperate planet with minimal mineral wealth.  Recently ruins from a previous possibly spacefaring race have been discovered, leading to a tourism boom.

name: Boara
detail: Boara was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Boardwalk
detail: Boardwalk is just the right distance from it's huge class O star to make life habitable, barely, on the few islands of this tiny water world.  Only it's distance from the jump point makes the planet non-viable as a souce of transportable water.

name: Bobruisk
detail: A pleasant temperate world, filled with lush purple forests and generally peaceful reptillian life.  Home to SeraVideo Entertainments Incorporated.

name: Bodnath
detail: Bodnath was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Boeotia
detail: Boeotia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bogard
detail: Bogard is a self-sufficient planet who's native alpha-carnivore is a large 4 meter long lizard with an amazing ability to blend into the environment due to it's chamelian-like ability to change colours.

name: Bogerth
detail: Bogerth was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bogrib
detail: Bogrib was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bolan
detail: A dry mountainous world, Bolan was originally settled by people from the Indian subcontinent on Terra. Bolan has served as a regional capital for the Free Worlds League and the Lyrans. Bolan is home to the Melissa Steiner Martial Academy of Bolan.

name: Bonaire
detail: Bonaire was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bonavista
detail: The original colonists of this frozen world died out soon after the colony's founding, but the planet has found new life as a base for pirates that prey on traffic between Liao and the Magistracy.

name: Bondurant
detail: Bondurant is a non-descript arid world, home to the Bondurant Tank Academy, arguably one of the best schools for tank operations in the Inner Sphere.

name: Bone-Norman
detail: Bone-Norman was originally settled by the Rim Worlds Republic and was a part of the Apollo Province. It was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Bonneau
detail: Bonneau is a small agricultural world deep in Federation space, known for it's humid climate and the fact that the entire planet is overrun by a particularly hardy (and tasty) form of mushroom.

name: Booker
detail: The Booker system was settled by the Magistracy of Canopus during the Star League era. It is home to Bermuda Combat Systems, a manufacturer of VTOLs and primitive versions of BattleMechs.

name: Boondock
detail: The planet Boondock is almost completely covered with ice and snow and only near the equator does the temperature allow human habitation. Boondock supplies a major portion of the Federated Commonwealth's gold.

name: Bora
detail: Recently aquired from the Capellans during the 4th Succession War, Bora sits near the borders of the FWL.  The main equatorial continent, Bora Bora, is known for it's tourism industry.

name: Borden
detail: Once Borden had vast lakes but now those lakes are dry, with salt beaches. But the land, when watered, is still fertile and the planet supports a specialized black market and a sizable mining community that harvests salt, diamond and corundum.

name: Bordon
detail: As a system originally colonized in the initial exodus from Terra, this rough backwater is easily forgotten.  Small and rocky, the majority of the population is comprised of a single large spaceport and a one-way prison for political dissidents.

name: Borgan's Rift
detail: Borgan's Rift suffers from the crippling of interstellar economies and dramatic technological decline and was regularly pillaged by pirates. Borgan's Rift was sold to Shanti Magliss who built warehouses and distribution centers all over the planet.

name: Borghese
detail: The population of Borghese was self-sustaining, providing its own food crops and famed for its exotic fish export known as the "mermaid" fish. The planet's capital was named Houston, which was also its largest city.

name: Borka
detail: As with so many marginal mining colonies, Borka's value dropped off significantly during the Succession Wars; importing food to the cold and barren planet soon became prohibitively expensive, and the League abandoned the world.

name: Bossangoa
detail: Bossangoa was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Botany Bay
detail: The obsidian sand from Botany Bay enabled them to establish a trade route whereby industrial sand was delivered to Sigurd and Sigurdian dross extractors shipped to Botany Bay for water purification.

name: Bothwell
detail: Bothwell was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bougie
detail: Bougie was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Boulsi
detail: Boulsi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bountiful Harvest
detail: The largest agricultural planet within the Lyran Commonwealth, Bountiful Harvest has huge tracts of flat and arable lands and two large oceans, the entire word an agricultural haven able to support its own needs as well as neighboring systems.

name: Bowang
detail: Bowang was a major trading hub within the Free Worlds League during the Succession Wars. The planetary leaders, recognizing their ideal position, encouraged a stance of neutrality in all business and political dealings.

name: Braben's Frontier
detail: Braben's Frontier was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Brabent
detail: Brabent was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Brailsford
detail: Once described as "Not Hell, but you can see it from here", the large Martian like planet Brailsford would never have been colonised if it were not for it's masive mineral reserves.  It also now contains one of the Combine's largest jails.

name: Branzoll
detail: Branzoll was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Brasha
detail: Arriving in the early twenty-sixth century, the first settlers established the city of Alaikum, which would survive both the Reunification War and the decline of the Star League, becoming a center of Shi'ite scholarship and learning.

name: Braum
detail: Braum was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Braunschweig
detail: Braunschweig is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Braunton
detail: One of the Combine's most productive breadbasket planets, Braunton acts as a trade hub for the local area as well.

name: Breed
detail: Breed was invaded by the Eleventh Benjamin Regulars. Defending Breed were the Second Robinson Rangers. The campaign was still ongoing, with the Eleventh in control of the cities on Breed while the Rangers dominated the wilderness.

name: Bremen (HL)
detail: Bremen is the capital world of the Hanseatic League, and contains the main houses of the large trading families aswell as the Council of Merchants.

name: Bremen (RW)
detail: Bremen (RW) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bremond
detail: Bremond was liberated by the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns in 2798-9, in one of a wave of uncoordinated retaliatory attacks launched in response to the news about the Kentares Massacre, having been occupied by the Combine at some point in 2797.

name: Brest
detail: Brest was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Breukelen
detail: Described as "The happiest place in Lyran space", Breukelen's native flaura release pollens that are mildly euphoric to humans.  This has resulted in a significant tourism industry, and a "hippy" culture on the planet.

name: Brighton
detail: Brighton was originally settled by miners looking to exploit the copper and silver ores on the world. Brighton's other claim to fame is that it was the site of the only official Capellan political prison.

name: Brihuega
detail: An otherwise unremarkable planet on the spinward edge of the Combine, Brihuega has become known as "The planet of spies" due to it's "use" as a training ground for Commonwealth agents operating out of Farstar.

name: Bringdam
detail: A lush, high-gravity world, Bringdam's atmosphere is so dense as to be almost unbreathable. The humidity makes it a poor location for mining, but it is an excellent agricultural world, supplying itself and a number of nearby systems.

name: Brinton
detail: Brinton is an infamous world due to the plague that bears its name. Centuries ago the Capellans released a bio-weapon on the surface, which continues to be deadly even now. The target of numerous raids, Brinton is now heavily guarded by the Concordat.

name: Brisbane
detail: Brisbane is a beautiful ocean world with pristine white-sand beaches that conceal a deadly secret: a viral degenerative nerve disease with no cure. Those unlucky enough to contract it gradually lose the use of their limbs and muscles.

name: Bristol
detail: Colonised during the First Exodus from Terra, Bristol has always been a planet heavily geared towards manufacturing, although the ravages of the Succession Wars has reduced this to one significant arms maker - Jolassa-Kumbold Armored Weapons.

name: Brixtana
detail: Brixtana is a cold world with windswept tundra and boreal forests. Once the site of an SLDF garrison, it was conquered early in the Reunification War despite dogged resistance by Magistracy-aligned mercenaries.

name: Broaddus
detail: Broaddus is a temperate world, with large areas of grasslands ideal for the farming of cattle and other herbivores.  Coastal areas of this almost hillless planet form large areas of marshland, which should be avoided by heavy vehicles (and 'Mechs).

name: Brocchi's Cluster
detail: Brocchi's Cluster contains what appears to be the remnants of a large planet in the "green zone" of this Class M star, which at some point has exploded into a large asteroid belt.  Over 40 inhabited planetoids and constructs exist in the area.

name: Brockton
detail: Brockton is a planet of small settlements and vast untouched wilderness.  The local flora has adapted to cope with the underground fungus that exists across the planet, however this fungal growth makes traditional farming almost impossible.

name: Brockway
detail: A rugged, harsh world, Brockway was colonized only due to its rich mineral resources. Originally held by the Concordat, the planet was seized by the Federated Suns after the Reunification War and has been a Davion holding ever since.

name: Broken Wheel
detail: Broken Wheel is a Fed planet on the edge of the Inner Sphere, unremarkable save for the extensive repair and refit facilities that dot the planet.

name: Bromhead
detail: The arid world of Bromhead was settled in the first wave of colonization, and was a Taurian holding until the Reunification War. It is now a Davion possession, with a large population in sprawling river-bank cities that nestle in the vast deserts.

name: Brookeland
detail: A major mining and refining planet for the Feds, Brookeland also has a bright Type O star which makes it favoured as a recharge point for jump routes.

name: Brooloo
detail: Another "Breadbasket" world deep in Lyran territory, Brooloo is a laid back world of large farms untouched by conflict.

name: Brownsville
detail: Brownsville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Bruben
detail: A former Combine planet recently annexed by the FRR, Bruben is notable only in the fact that it is (more-or-less) self sufficient, with a balanced mix of agriculture and manufacturing.

name: Bruges
detail: Bruges is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Brundage
detail: Brundage is a desert world with vast mountain ranges, that can barely support it's own population.  Recent rumours of a lost Star League cache has brought treasure seekers to the world, who have so far found nothing.

name: Brundams
detail: No data exists for this planet.  Orbital scans show no significant settlement, or life for that matter.

name: Brusett
detail: Brusett is a typical backwater farming planet, near the border with the Taurean Concordant.  Rural, and boring.

name: Bryant
detail: Bryant was the subject of an early terraforming project which succeeded. Unfortunately the satelites which stabilized Bryant's changed climate were destroyed during the Amaris Civil War and the climate has now returned to its original hostile state.

name: Bryceland
detail: Originally settled by the Outworlds Alliance, Bryceland was ceded to the Combine in 2585, before being lost to the Feds during the Second Succession War.  Bryceland remains home to several Battlemech plants.

name: Buchlau
detail: Buchlau was settled for its fish. The planet only has a single continent, Vienna, which is surrounded by a massive ocean. This ocean is teeming with life.

name: Buckalew
detail: Buckalew is famous throughout the Sanctuary Worlds as being the home of the Mallard family. House Mallard transformed Buckalew over the centuries into a rich, prosperous manufacturing and research center. Buckalew's factories and labs are a major factor in the Mallard Republic's continued relevance on Sanctuary battlefields.

name: Bucklands
detail: Bucklands - the planet that should have been called Farmlands.  Almost every inch of landmass on this planet is farmed to take advantage of it's hightly arible soil.

name: Buckminster
detail: Buckminster is a regional capital in the Combine, and remains one of it's most important agriculture and production planets.  Only recently has the Second Sword of Light moved off-planet, leaving it's defence to the 7th and 8th Alshain Regulars.

name: Budingen
detail: Budingen is a minor mining and manufacturing planet, plagues by brutal storms and frigid winters.  It's importance is more for it's proximity to the Outworld Alliance than it's actual worth.

name: Buena
detail: In 3020 the Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces opened the War College of Buena, a military academy that specialized in training MechWarriors and teaching Maintenance Sciences.  Beyond that, the planet is basically mediteranian style farms.

name: Buenos Aires
detail: This agricultural world has been the target of repeated Marik attempts to conquer it. To protect its food production, most farms were moved underground or to hydroponic offshore platforms. The planet's capital, also called Buenos Aires, is a teeming metropolis of millions.

name: Burnt Rock
detail: Burnt Rock was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Burton
detail: Burton is a company world, the home of one of the largest Taurian electronics manufacturers. Most of the world's small population consists of employees, staff, and support services for O-P Computer Electronics.

name: Bushmill
detail: Bushmill was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Butler
detail: Butler is a peaceful earth-like planet, with a diverse manufacturing base.  Plans are in place to build an orbital ship yard, which will no doubt boost Butler's economy.

name: Butte Hold
detail: Butte Hold is a minor planet in the newly formed Greater Valkyrate.  Barely self-sufficient agriculturally, and totally dependent on importation of manufactured goods, it is of little importance.

name: Butzfleth
detail: Butzfleth (AKA "Butt Flesh"), is a minor FWL planet only important because it contains one of the largest prisons in FWL space.  The inhospitable planet is otherwise only inhabited by miners and local support businesses.

name: Bye's Ship
detail: Bye's Ship was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Byesville
detail: A minor planet on the Combine/FRR border, Byesville is only inhabitable at the poles, with the rest of the planet too hot to support human life.

name: Cabanatuan
detail: A desolate system that is devoid of colonists, initially settled during the Star League era, but now lays abandoned in the outskirts of the Draconis Combine

name: Cadela
detail: A system on the edge of human explored space, formally settled by the Taurians during the Star League era, it now lays empty, possibly due to one of the many orbiting astroids crashing down on the settlers.

name: Cadiz (DC)
detail: Cadiz is a small, tropical planet, known for it's endless swamps, and swarms of insects.  Not a nice place to live, unless you are a frog.

name: Cadiz (TC)
detail: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Cadiz is a small agricultural world.

name: Caerlaverock
detail: A system initally settled by Davions in the Draconis March. It was immediately found that the local flora was very hostile, with extremely large Venus Fly Traps eating serveral explorers. It was finally abadoned due to increasing raids by the DCMS.

name: Caesaera
detail: After the end of the Reunification War, some Kuritans were ashamed of their soldiers' role in the massacres, and sought to get away from the actions of the DCMS. Sadly, the colony failed as the settlers were not used to the harshness periphery.

name: Caesar's Crown
detail: Caesar's Crown is a young star cluster in the anti-spinward Deep Periphery.

name: Cahokia
detail: Cahokia IV - more commonly known simply as Cahokia - is the fourth planet in the Cahokia system and has a single moon named Sequoia. Cahokia has been home to a manufacturing plant operated by Achernar BattleMechs.

name: Caillinius
detail: Caillinius was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cajamarca
detail: Cajamarca is an anomoly - A smallish planet with a high gravity, thanks to it's abundant reserves of heavy metals.  As a result mining operations are plentiful, in spite of it's hostile environment.

name: Calafell
detail: Calafell is typical of a central Lyran planet - heavily industrialised, but also self-sufficient.  Trade opportunities abound, particularly if you know where to look.

name: Calchedon
detail: Calchedon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Caldarium
detail: A typical Periphery world, Caldarium has just enough resources to be more-or-less self sufficient, but not enough to cause the Lyran Commonwealth to be interested enough to remove the substantial pirate presence to take it over.

name: Caldrea
detail: Caldrea was captured by the Draconis Combine in 2812, using fast-moving BattleMech forces that were able to defeat the defending forces despite the defenders using nuclear weapons in an effort to try and resist the invasion.

name: Caldwell
detail: Caldwell has been a Fed planet for most of the last 450 years.  In spite of being the home to the Fighting Urukhai (under contract to the Feds), rumours abound of a hidden pirate base, if not on-planet, then at least in-system.

name: Caledea
detail: Caledea was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Caledonia
detail: Caledon suffered heavy damage when House Kurita conquered the planet in 2849 and effectively scorched the planet. The world was slow to recover, and was subsequently ruled from offworld for over a century, first from Hesperus II and then Tharkad.

name: Calingasta
detail: Calingasta was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Calish
detail: Calish is an anomoly - the system has 2 planets in the habitable zone.  The primary planet, Calish III, is an arctic world with a broad band of arible land around the equator, while Calish II is an arid hotbox with large mineral deposits.

name: Callison
detail: Callison supports a large, relatively prosperous population but lacks in mineral wealth or strategically important heavy industry. Traditionally a part of the FWL, Callison was only incorporated in to the Lyran Commonwealth in 3029.

name: Callisto
detail: Callisto's claim to fame is tourism and retirement.  Rich folks with nothing better to do come and spend 18+ hours a day in one fantasy neural-link game or another.  I bet none of them ever entered data into a spreadsheet either...

name: Calloway
detail: The Calloway system was settled during or shortly before the Age of War. 3 moons at Calloway VI reflect so much sunlight that no city on the world has had to install street lamps. Trading is a bedrock of the planetary economy.

name: Calpaca
detail: Sitting right on the Capellan/FWL border for as long as anyone can remember, Calpaca has remarkably remained a peaceful place of rolling purple hills, where strangely attractive alien sheep roam, herded by macho looking agromechs.

name: Calseraigne
detail: A mining and industrial world of more strategic than economic value, Calseraigne was seized from the Capellans during the Third Succession War by the Free Worlds League. The inhabitants chafe under Marik rule, and unrest and minor sabotage is common.

name: Calvados
detail: Calvados was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Camadeierre
detail: The Camadeierre system is choked with asteroids and dominated by three Jovian gas giants; inhabitants live on a terraformed moon. A raid by the SLDF on Camadeierre is commonly thought to have been the spark that started the New Vandenberg Uprising.

name: Cambiano
detail: A rugged world with many ruins, Cambiano is home to one the Federations key archaelogical sites, the Mighty Nein.

name: Cambridge Perimeter Defense Station
detail: Located relatively close to the Deep Periphery systems known as Rondane and Wark, the Cambridge system primary is a type F3V star. Although the system is currently garrisoned by forces from Clan Jade Falcon, it is unclear which Clan(s) established the garrison or when the system was first garrisoned.

name: Cameron (FWL)
detail: The Cameron system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra, and was a member of the Principality of Regulus prior to the formation of the Free Worlds League in the late twenty-third century.

name: Cameron (LC)
detail: An otherwise non-descript planet deep in Lyran space, Cameron is known for it's agriculture, and it's production of a particularly nice single malt scotch.

name: Camlann (FWL)
detail: Camlann was one of many worlds to be colonized after the widespread adoption of the Laranth water-purification process in the 2630s, technology that made the terraforming easier by removing the requirement for the importing of pure water by ice ship.

name: Camlann (LC)
detail: Originally settled by fanatical Muslims around 2400, Camlann has recently passed from Lyran to Combine hands a few times.  Now "safely" in Draconis hands again, Camlann is typical of a border world full of militant religious fanatics... Interesting.

name: Cammal
detail: Typical of a border world, Cammal has seen frequent raids from the Confederation ever since the system was taken over by the Federation during the Second Succession War.  Such raids have always had "Plausable Deniability", as such raids always do...

name: Campbelton
detail: Campbelton III is the third planet in the Campbelton system and has a single moon named Atholville. Campbelton has been host to at facilities operated by at least one significant defense manufacturing company.

name: Campertown
detail: The general rule is that border worlds don't contain significant manufacturing facilities.  Campertown is an exception to the rule, with Sacrada Industries having some important facilities here, manufacturing communications and guidance systems.

name: Campoleone
detail: A stop-over point for those heading into the Periphery and Deep Periphery. A large population of retired spacers, combined with the trading and exploration route, made Campoleone a storehouse of knowledge in the Free Worlds League.

name: Canal
detail: The Canal system is located near the Moriguchi and Sweet Water systems. During the final years of the Star League, Canal was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Candiear
detail: Candiear is a very "liberal" planet, who's fertile farmlands are just as likely to be producing plants for "recreational purposes" as they are food.  The net result is a distinct "hippy" feel to the planet, and a small tourist trade.

name: Canonbie
detail: The ruins of a Star League-Era manufacturing facility lay seemingly dorment and neglected.  A careful eye might notice the occasional heat signature, but no inhabitants ever intentionally make themselves known.

name: Canopus IV
detail: Canopus IV has served as the planetary capital of the Magistracy of Canopus since the founding of the nation, and was heavily-industrialized for a Periphery planet

name: Capac
detail: Being deep in Fed space has allowed Capac a "more or less peaceful" existance over the years, which is one of the reasons it was chosen to house a large prison complex.

name: Capella
detail: The former capital of the Capellan Confederation, Capella remains an important industrial planet with orbital shipyards.  Additionally, the Capellan War College remains one of the premier centres of learning in the Confederation.

name: Caph
detail: Caph has large swath of tropical rainforests, fertile lands and large amounts of mineral wealth. Sections of the planet were rendered uninhabitable during the First and Second Succession Wars, but Caph maintains many other Star League era facilities.

name: Capolla
detail: Capolla's thick surface jungle hides significant mineral wealth. The residents have long-standing political ties with their neighbours on Terra Firma, and the two planets tend to wield their economic and politcal power together. Capolla joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Capone
detail: Capone is the capital world of the Jacobson Haven, as much as it can be said to have a capital anyway. Capone is run by the Haven Families, a collection of crime families that functionally serve as the Haven's government. While wealthy, Capone is a dangerous place and visitors should be wary while on-planet.

name: Capra
detail: Capra was the headquarters world of the XXIII Corps (Star League) of the Star League Defense Force during the final years of the Star League.  As a result, there are the usual rumours of a "hidden cache" that always surround former SLDF bases.

name: Capricorn
detail: Capricorn was once a significant manufacturing planet for Wu Industries, however they discontinued operations in 2612 due to depleted mineral reserves increasing the cost of production.

name: Cap Rouge
detail: Cap Rouge has three continents named beauport, Sainte-Foy and Sillery.  Hero Training Institute, a military academy specialising in training MechWarriors and Aerospace personnel, is located on Sillery.

name: Caracol
detail: Caracol was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Carbonis
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Carbonis' was the home of an insurgent movement that targeted both Confederation and SLDF troops. Carbonis was the site of Fort Dunedin, a Star League era base.

name: Carcassonne
detail: Carcassonne was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Carcri
detail: The Carcri system was colonized at some point between the end of the Jihad and the Dark Age.

name: Cardff
detail: Cardff was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Caria
detail: Caria was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Caripare
detail: Caripare is a garden planet, who's lush vegitation and highly arible soil have made it almost vital to the survival of surrounding planets.  Further, it's warm waters support a wide variety of aquatic life, most of which is edible.

name: Carlisle
detail: A largely peaceful and well-industrialized planet with a terrestrial climate, Carlisle was home to a large planetary militia as well as supplemental defense forces controlled by the owners of the factories located on the planet.

name: Carmacks
detail: During the Star League era, Carmacks was considered a major commercial and transport hub. This concentration of wealth and its location attracted numerous bandit raids which kept its SLDF defenders active.

name: Carmelita
detail: Carmelita was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Carmen
detail: Carmen is a small Capellan planet of little apparent importance.  Ruins of a pre-human civilisation still dot the planet, which scientists believe was wiped out over 200000 years ago by an unknown event.

name: Carmichael
detail: Storms and befouled air make Carmichael a miserable place. The Taurian inhabitants fought a long, brutal guerilla war against the SLDF during the Reunification War, but ultimately lost; since then, the world has been a Davion holding.

name: Carnac
detail: Carnac was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Carnwath
detail: Carnwath is a relatively unimportant world with a hot, humid climate. The world is known primarily for two things; its tropical fruit exports and its infamous swarms of stinging insects.

name: Carse
detail: A double sun and Carse's unusual orbit provided four cycles of seasons. During a Cold Cycle, the temperature plummeted, oceans froze, and only DropShips and the largest air vehicles could survive the heavy winds.

name: Carsphairn
detail: Carsphairn has very fertile soil but it wracked by dangerous storms. Over the centuries large weatherproofing domes have been built over the best farmland, ensuring a good harvest each year.

name: Carstairs
detail: The fourth planet in the Carstairs system is named New Tucson. It is site of a major copper mining operation by FrictionTechInc, who often hire small mercenary outfits for protection.

name: Cartago
detail: The Cartago system was colonized at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was the subject of the Cartago Conflict in the early 2400s. It had been incorporated into the Federated Suns by the end of the Age of War.

name: Carthage
detail: Carthage is so far out in the distant Periphery, and so isolated, that despite its pleasant climate it remains only lightly settled by eccentrics, adventurers, and criminals. Its single spaceport is little more than a concrete pad with a few service buildings.

name: Carvajal
detail: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Carvajal is a small agricultural colony set up amongst a fertile volcanic plain.

name: Liberty
detail: Located in a central area between several factions, the Liberty system has been in the hands of many different rulers. As such, its populace has little allegiance to any faction, and generally try to do the best for themselves. Liberty joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Cascade
detail: Cascade was always a FWL planet, and given it's limited resources it has remained peaceful in spite of it's border position with the Lyrans.  Several strange ruins have been found on the planet, hinting of a (now dead) former civilisation.

name: Caselton
detail: Despite being similar to Terra, Caselton is too dry and too cold to easily grow crops. Similarly it has enough minerals to support its population, but not enough to export.  It has an asteriod belt (the Cassini Belt) that is mined for minerals.

name: Casere
detail: The Casere system was colonised at some point prior to the end of the Reunification War and by the Star League era was a part of the Draconis Combine, where it remained until the formation of the Free Rasalhauge Republic.

name: Cassias
detail: Cassias is a tropical world located on the Draconis Combine/Federated Suns border. It also acted as the border between the "Outback" and the more densely populated inner systems of the Federated Suns.

name: Cassilda
detail: This aquatic world is famed for its bountiful, deadly oceans. The population is clustered on volcanic island chains along the equator, while the oceans are ruled by a vast array of native predatory life forms.

name: Castile
detail: Castile is the fourth planet in the system and is home to the only BattleMech manufacturing at King Dumount Defense Facility in the Nueva Castile region. Interestingly, it did not serve as the capital world of Nueva Castile, that honor going to Asturias.

name: Castor
detail: Castor has been the site of regular raids and battles between the Lyran and Free Worlds Armed Forces for the last two centuries. Famously, a raid from the Kell Hounds in 3011 destroyed a stockpile of ancient nuclear warheads on Castor.

name: Castrovia
detail: Castrovia was a member of the Sian Commonwealth prior to the formation of the Capellan Combine in the mid-twenty-fourth century. Many educational institutes offer extensive archaelogical courses surveying the planets many ruins.

name: Cate's Hold
detail: Cate's Hold was settled as a gambling and resort world, but soon became a critical logistical center for the Magistracy in the Reunification War. Recent prospectors have discovered caches of SLDF technology and radioactive ores, once more drawing interest to the planet.

name: Catroxx
detail: Catroxx was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cavalor
detail: Cavalor was settled after the Reunification War, as the Capellans sought to reinforce their borders with the Magistracy and the Free Worlds League. Since that time, fertile soil and plentiful resources have caused the population of the world to explode.

name: Cavanaugh
detail: Naming conventions on Cavanaugh appear to have been strongly influenced by the tales and legends of King Arthur.  Steer clear of Camellot though - it is a silly place.

name: Cayuga
detail: Cayuga was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ceará
detail: Ceará was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cebalrai
detail: Cebalrai is a border world, and it's surface has the scars of numerous battles between the Combine and the Commonwealth to show for it.  The atmosphere is thin, but breathable.

name: Ceiba
detail: Ceiba was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Celano
detail: Celano is a warm temperate planet with ample water sources apparently settled at some point in the early 3000s. Despite the plentiful water, the vicious storm systems that occur frequently on the world have made survival a challenge.

name: Celebes
detail: Celebes was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Celentaro
detail: Celentaro is one of the core Taurean planets first colonised around 2700.  Like most Taurean planets, it is mostly self-sufficient, and not particularly notable for anything.

name: Centavido
detail: Centavido was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cephei
detail: Cephi is a currently uninhabited planet, with little known about it.

name: Ceram
detail: Ceram was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cerberus
detail: "Cerberus Lives!". System was colonized prior to the end of the Age of War. A regional capital and the most heavily industrialized planet within the Outworlds Alliance. See the "Treaty of Cerberus", year 2585

name: Cerignola
detail: Cerignola was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cerillos
detail: Cerillos is one of the so-called "Southwestern Worlds", an association of three worlds in the Free Worlds League. These agrarian worlds have a unique culture descended from North American Indian and Hispanic peoples.

name: Cerulean
detail: During the Star League era, the planet Cerulean was the site of a research facility dedicated to finding new water purification technologies.  While much of this research has been abandoned over the years, it continues on a smaller scale to this day.

name: Ceuta
detail: Ceuta was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chaffee (DP)
detail: The Chaffee system is the location of at least one habitable world and as at 3095 was an independent system located in the Deep Periphery.  Little is known about it.

name: Chaffee (LC)
detail: The thin atmosphere and vivid sunsets here inspired artists from all the Terran colonies... before being utterly forgotten and abandoned.  With no atmosphere to speak of, some of the ruins still show signs of habitation.

name: Chagos
detail: Chagos is a fairly self-sufficient planet, with a relatively peaceful history.  The planet is primarily water, however it is dotted with numerous small islands with quite fertile soil, formed by the planets extensive vulcanic action.

name: Chahar
detail: Chahar worked hard to bring corporations to the planet, and by 3025 it had succeeded. Not only is it the home of Dobless Information Services, but Trellshire Heavy Industries built a weapons plant near its capital city.

name: Chaine Cluster
detail: The Chaine Cluster is a collection of 7 stars in a very close proximity - Turpin, Corell, Aeryn, Alnabog, Hillburg, Brekke, and Dark Mist.  While it has had several colonisation attempts, the area is mostly inhabited by pirates.

name: Chakachamna
detail: A somewhat anomolous little planet in the middle of Federation space, Chakachamma is actually a moon orbiting a gas giant which is in the outer edge of the habitable zone of it's class A star.  The result is a icy planet with widely varying temps.

name: Chalouba
detail: A tropical world, Chalouba is known for it's large generally hostile insects, and constant roumers of a Lostech cache hidden during the days of the Star League by the 9th Army and the XVIII Corps.

name: Chamdo
detail: A recent Federated acquisition from the 4th Succession War, Chamdo has a cool temperate climate suitable for agriculture, and high mountains filled with menerals.

name: Champadanga
detail: Champadanga is an icy world, where temperatures reach up to 150°C. Whilst it is rich with raw materials under the ice, the only settlements are those in sheltered chasms powered and heated by enormous Star League era steam generators.

name: Chandan
detail: This cold and rocky world is choked by silt and ash in the air from the constant volcanic activity. Inhabitants live in hab-spheres, emerging only to work in the extensive mines or research the local silicon-based life forms.

name: Chandler
detail: Chandler and it's orbital moon Bing are home to a thriving financial sector, once a major part of the Combine. Financial transpondsters are often dispatched from here to nearby worlds to ensure regulatory compliance.

name: Chanute
detail: Chanute has a strange past. Once settled by religious pilgrims during the Exodus, it became a God Cult when one of the self proclaimed leaders thought he could order the tides back. He could not.

name: Chapineria
detail: Not many people have heard of Chapineria, but almost everyone in the Combine wears one of their reknown trillion unit export rugged shoes and boots.

name: Chapultepec
detail: Massive planetwide forests cover this oxygen rich tropical world, a veritable breadbasket if ever there was one.

name: Charity
detail: An almost uninhabitable dustball that was gifted to Tibetan pilgrims during the age of Exodus, Charity remains barely habitable to this day. The Combine operate a large prison complex here for undesirables.

name: Charleston
detail: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Charleston is a small mining colony set up amongst a large mountain range.

name: Charleywood
detail: Charleywood was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chateau
detail: An arable world with bands of temperate climate across the planet. Bottles of Chateau are exported across the Lyran Commonwealth, and include some of the finest wines in the Inner Sphere.

name: Chatham
detail: Chatham is home to a number of major manufacturing concerns both on the surface of the world and in orbit. Centuries of manufacturing have tainted the atmosphere, causing it to have some of the worst air in the entire Inner Sphere.

name: Chaumont
detail: Chaumont was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chaville
detail: Chaville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chebanse
detail: The Chebanse system was colonized at some point during the First Exodus from Terra, and is a dangerous and icy world. The dangers mean nothing to the brave Chebanse, who often free climb glaciers or swim in the sub arctic waters with fanged wildlife.

name: Chengdu
detail: Chengdu was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chenier
detail: Colonized shortly before the Age of War, Chenier is a nondescript planet notable only for some truly ancient ruins, and a large research complex devoted to studying them.

name: Chennai
detail: Chennai was little more than a communications outpost and refueling point for the Capellans, and as the Succession Wars ground on, even that role stopped being worthwhile, and the world was abandoned to pirates and other criminals.

name: Cheriton
detail: Overrun by Yakuza and otherwise unremarkable is probably the best way to describe Cheriton.  Then again that could be said for most Combine planets.

name: Chertan
detail: Chertan is water-poor but mineral rich. It was a significant manufacturing center during the Star League Era but has declined over the last few centuries due to both a decline in interstellar trade and frequent raids from the Lyran Alliance.

name: Chesterton
detail: Chesterton was the capital of one of the earliest interstellar states to form in the Inner Sphere, the Chesterton Trade League and remains an important adminstrative world even to this day.

name: Chhaprauli
detail: Chhaprauli was colonized during the Star League era by mining concerns looking to cash in on the planet's easily accessible germanium and iridium. The mining boom ended along with the Star League and the planet has been marginal ever since.

name: Chiavenna
detail: Elements of the 211th Jump Infantry Division were stranded here for awhile after their JumpShip sprung a helium leak centuries ago, leaving valuable Star League technology on the icy surface.

name: Chichibu
detail: Chichibu's first settlers were wiped out by a virulent strain of smallpox. Since HPG communication hadn't been invented at the time, the rescuers and medical aid for these settlers arrived too late. Since then, nothing exciting has happened here.

name: Chillon
detail: Chillon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chilung
detail: The Chilung system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra and was an independent system prior to being incorporated into the Free Worlds League at some point during the Age of War.

name: Chimpaw
detail: Chimpaw was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chinmen Tao
detail: Colonised at some point prior to the Reunification War, the aging structures of Chinmen Tao reflect the lack of support the world receives from the rest of the Draconis Combine. Many citizens resort to joining the DCMS in order to escape their world.

name: Chirala
detail: An otherwise bleak world, Chirala still bears the marks of warfare from half a millenia ago when the Star League marshalled their forces upon the world before their strike against the Outworlds Alliance.

name: Chirikof
detail: Originally settled as a mining colony, Chirikof IV exported germanium to Galax well into the thirty-first century. As expansion efforts along the Taurian border grew, Chirikof became more and more important as a travel stop. Ships and crews use Chirikof as a base station during their explorations, which stimulated the Federated Suns' leadership to build space stations and permanently station military forces there.

name: Elgin
detail: Settled originally as Chisholm, the planet was renamed as Elgin in honour of Captain Edward Elgin who defended the world against the Free Worlds League in 2878. Most recently it became the capital of the short lived Tikonov Free Republic, whose mark many buildings still bear. Elgin joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Chita
detail: Chita was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chitwan
detail: Chitwan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Choate
detail: Some worlds in the Sanctuary have seen nothing but war and conflict. Choate is one such planet, having been fought over for centuries thanks to its immense natural resources. Currently, Choate rests in the hands of the Mallard Republic, who won the planet after an extended campaign against the Jacobson Haven.

name: Choex
detail: Choex was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cholame
detail: A minor and unimportant system deep in Davion space, the Cholame system was colonized at some point during the First Exodus from Terra. A Battle of Cholame, six week fight between AFSS and DCMS fleets with more than 200 warships destroyed in total on both sides, took place in 2790 at this otherwise unremarkable system.

name: Chorley
detail: The infamous world of Chorley, known mainly for it's production of ration packs amongst Combine troops, is a bleak world that harvests fungi to fill it's nutritional needs.

name: Chota
detail: Chota was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Choudrant
detail: The Choudrant system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra and by the end of the Age of War had been incorporated into the Federated Suns.

name: Chouli
detail: Chouli was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Christiania
detail: Christiania was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Chukchi
detail: The aerospace weaponry produced on Chukchi by Maxell Metals are considered be essential to the defense of the Commonwealth, though the citizens of Chukchi III are far from pleased to be the ones supplying it. Heavy pollution from the industrial activities on the surface ensure there is a low level of discontent amongst the population at all times.

name: Chupadero
detail: Chupadero in the modern day is highly loyal to the Combine, seemingly to make up for its origins as an Age of War prison colony. The locals pride themselves on being able to repair and use equipment many would have scrapped decades ago.

name: Ciampino
detail: The Ciampino system was colonized during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War. Relatively unpopulated, it's chief exports are rare fungi and spores used within the pharmaceutical industry.

name: Cilvituk
detail: Cilvituk was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cimeron
detail: The Cimeron system was colonized during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Ciotat
detail: The second settlement of Ciotat, built upon the ruins of the first settlement that was destroyed in the age of war, is home to many deep boreholes built to harvest the raw materials contained within the icy permafrost. Seismic activity on the planet makes mining dangerous but also ensures a ready supply of new rich deposits.

name: Circinus
detail: The capital world of the eponymous named Circinus Federation, Circinus is a world with a criminal past. As the Federation attempts to gain legitimacy as a nation-state, the history of piracy lingers, leading their neighbors to often dismiss Circinus as a pirate haven.

name: Cirebon
detail: Cirebon is home to a large chemical industry that imports rare earths from Alula Australis, which feeds it's nascent aerospace and computer industries.

name: Claxton
detail: Claxton's industry consists of heavy industrial mines throughout it's rich crystalline fields. Smaller settlements subsist of the mining and export industries that have arisen here.

name: Claybrooke
detail: Claybrooke is a wealthy industrial and agricultural world. Ruled by a military dictatorship installed by Marik intelligence operatives, the world has become increasingly aligned with the Duchy of Andurien.

name: Clearfield
detail: Named after the great praeries located upon the world, Clearfield offers mostly flat terrain ideal for pastoral farming.

name: Clermont
detail: Colonised by the Rim Worlds Republic during the Star League era, Clermont produces substantial electronics used in heavy machinery across the Commonwealth.

name: Clinton
detail: Settled during the early days of human colonization, Clinton is probably best known for being the home of Snord's Irregulars, and the impressive museum of historical artifacts they have amassed over the past several decades.

name: Clipperton
detail: Clipperton has one of the few active manufacturing centers of Dropships and Jumpships remaining in the Inner Sphere. The colony itself largely exists to support this industry.

name: Clovis
detail: The Clovis system was colonized during or shortly before the Age of War and by the end of the era had been incorporated into the Federated Suns. After that planet was conquered twice during First and Third Succession Wars by Draconis Combine but was liberated by AFFS after a short period of occupation.

name: Cluff's Stand
detail: Cluff's Stand is named for the revolutionary leader who seized power when the Capellans abandoned the world. It is dominated by a single, sprawling megacity, New Durban, and fed by massive coastal algae farms.

name: Cogdell
detail: Cogdell is a world possessed of considerable quantities of potable water, flourishing forests and rich farmland was settlet by a group of convicts who were extorted to the world by a Periphery world. Colonists were able to survive and were absorbed by Federated Suns before Third Succession War. Capital city: Hangman's Death.

name: Cohagen
detail: The largest industry on Cohagen during the Star League era was salt mining. The huge salt plains that cover the world were so large that they were recognizable from space. The salt plains were also incredibly flat leaving vast swathes of unbroken terrain covering the planet.

name: Cohay
detail: The northern continent of Cohay was heavily wooded and prone to raging forest fires during dry seasons. During the Star League era it was common for the Ninth Avalon Hussars, as the local garrison, to deploy to help fight the forest fires.

name: Colchester
detail: Once a shining jewel of the Federated Suns, Colchester was devastated during the First Succession War leaving lasting ecological damage.

name: Colchis
detail: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Colchis is a small agricultural colony set up amongst a water world.

name: Coldbrook
detail: Settled as part of the Rim Worlds Republic, the world was seized by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2775. Coldbrook mainly exports machinery adapted for low temperatures to nearby worlds thanks to it's industrial base.

name: Cole Harbour
detail: Cole Harbour became famous during the Reunification War as the location of the Star League Defense Force headquarters of the task force assigned to conquer the Magistry of Canopus, and was one of the locations where massive vaults of Star League equipment were found, contributing to the richness of the planet.

name: Colfax
detail: One of the major trading ports between the Lyran Commonwealth and the Free Worlds League, Colfax is a cosmopolitan metropolis.

name: Colia
detail: Colia is a breadbasket world that has been settled since the time of the First Exodus. Although invaded during the First Succession War, it avoided the devastation that came with most conquests at that time.

name: Colinas
detail: Colinas is a praerie like world that has been settled since the time of the First Exodus. Agricultural exports are it's main source of economy.

name: Colmar
detail: A, hot, dry world which is nearly uninhabitable near the equator, Colmar's only reason for existing as a colony is its impressive quantities of mineral and chemical resources, buried under its silicate crust.

name: Coloma
detail: Coloma is a dry world that has been settled since the time of the First Exodus. Although invaded during the First Succession War by the Draconic Combine, it's civilian populace rose up against the invaders and assisted in the liberation of their world.

name: Colorado
detail: Colorado was historically the world with the richest germanium deposits in the entire of the Federated Suns. This led to extensive strip mining that slowly transformed the planet into an ecological disaster. Novadays deposits are becoming more and more sarce.

name: Columbine
detail: Columbine is a desert mining world, dominated by equatorial rocky deserts and dry-weather grasslands in the temperate zone. Valuable deposits of rare earth elements and fissile materials make the inhospitable world a viable colony.

name: Commonwealth Mining Outpost 26 (Gulf Breeze 3057+)
detail: Mining operations in this unimaginatively-named system are coordinated from Gulf Breeze Station in the asteroid belt, but a ground colony does exist on the fifth planet. LosTech prospectors can sometimes be found here, excavating centuries-old ruins.

name: Conakry
detail: Conakry's colonization in 2614 was made possible by advances in terraforming technology, the effects of which have mostly stuck despite the Star League's fall. The locals claim to have the best jollof rice in the Inner Sphere.

name: Concord
detail: Despite initial Lyran influence during the First Succession War, Concord has been a staple of the Free Worlds League for centuries, supplying nearby worlds with much needed medical and agricultural supplies.

name: Conley's Patch
detail: Conley's Patch was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Connaught
detail: Previously the home of the 17th Star League Defense Fleet, the orbital drydocks and shipyard remain... but in a state of disrepair.  While a prime candidate for a refurbished Star League shipyard, the ruins remain untouched and thick with rust.

name: Conquista
detail: Initially colonised and part of the Capellan Confederation for centuries whilst maintaining good trade links with nearby worlds, during the Third Succession War the planet overthrew it's government and joined the Free Worlds League.

name: Conroe
detail: Most of Conroe is covered by glaciers and ice flats, with civilization existing in the taigas near the equator or pockets of geothermal warmth. It hosts frequent military training maneuvers.

name: Constance
detail: Constance was colonised towards the end of the Reunification War, and maintained a Star League garrison until the final days of the Star League. It's industrial base mainly consists of automotive and mining equipment manufacturers.

name: Conwy
detail: Conwy was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cooperland
detail: Cooperland was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Coopertown
detail: Coopertown was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Coraines
detail: The Coraines system was either colonised by the Outworlds Alliance during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Corbeanca
detail: Corbeanca is often described as a tax haven, due to it's lax administrative control and rumours of knock backs. Tourism remains high though, with vast resorts located on it's many shores.

name: Cor Caroli
detail: Cor Caroli is a mineral rich world featuring an even more mineral rich asteroid belt in close orbit. Despite the constant presence of a Lyran 'Mech Regiment on the planet, constant raids have degraded the planets mining capability significantly.

name: Cordiagr
detail: Founded and named after the Corwin Diverse Agricultural Group, a 22nd-century corporation (now long defunct), Cordiagr has been a bountiful breadbasket for Capella and other nearby worlds for eight centuries.

name: Córdoba
detail: An often contested world by the Umayyad Caliphate over the centuries, Nueva Castile has fought for control of Córdoba for centuries. As of the 3060s, the world is disputed between the Caliphate and the Castilians.

name: Corella
detail: The Corella system was colonized during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the St. Ives Mercantile League prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation in the mid-twenty-fourth century becoming a breadbasket world and a trading hub for the region.

name: Corey
detail: Home to defense contractor Hollis Industries, Corey is a heavily industrialised world which has been the target of substantial attacks in previous Succession Wars. An industrial recovery is underway, whilst the threat of warfare ensures that the world is heavily defended.

name: Corfu
detail: Corfu was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Coriscana
detail: The gem caves of Coriscana are a wonder that brings rich tourism to the world, which is otherwise unremarkable. A black market in rare crystals has emerged in recent years.

name: Cork
detail: The Star League's plan to terraform Cork to fully habitable status was meant to take about 300 years. The destruction of the Succession Wars ensured Cork would revert to its desolate state. Only dusty artifacts remain.

name: Corodiz
detail: Initially settled by the Taurian Concordat, Corodiz was conquered centuries ago by the Capellans in a particularly brutal campaign which included civilian massacres and torture. Its position as a crossroads between three powerful states makes it politically unstable.

name: Coromodir
detail: Coromodir is the center of power of the Aurigan government. Two habitable worlds house nearly three billion people, and at the heart of Coromodir 6 is the vast Taurian fortress that serves as both capital and last bastion of defense. Both House Arano and House Espinosa consider Coromodir their ancestral home.

name: Corridan
detail: Corridan IV was a keenly-sought colony world, with an ecosystem that was perfect for humans and their crops, with one small exception - The water supply was filled with lethal levels of heavy metals and a bacteria that would make every living plant or animal on the world toxic to humans. Eventually new water filtration technology was discovered that turned Corridan into a rich world. It's main exports are still from Water Pure Industries.

name: Corsica Nueva
detail: Corsica Nueva is unremarkable, except that it is home to a vast asteroid belt, with a Star League era asteroid base named Mizutoshi which is under the control of the Seimeiyoshi-rengo, the Draconis Combine's federation of gangs which operates a thriving black market.

name: Corydon
detail: The Corydon system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra and had been incorporated into the Federated Suns by the end of the Age of War. Captured by DCMS in 2789, it was liberated again by AFFS in 2806 during first major counter-offensive against the Draconis Combine in First Succession War.

name: Cosenza
detail: Cosenza is known mainly for it's beautiful planetary rings, that are visible at all times during the day on it's otherwise inhospitable surface.

name: Cotocallao
detail: The Cotocallao system was settled at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was an independent system within the Capellan Zone prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation in the mid-twenty-fourth century and conquered by AFFS in 2864.

name: Coudoux
detail: Coudoux was home to a Star League Defence Garrison during the last days of the Star League, which makes the world a prime target for treasure hunters.

name: Courcellete
detail: The Cosenza system was at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was an independent system within the Capellan Zone prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation in the mid-twenty-fourth century. Was conquered by Federated Suns during Second Succession war.

name: Courchevel
detail: Courchevel is a heavily mined planet, with large plains broken up by massive rifts. One such plain is the Graveyard, a vast arid plain with rock formations shaped like gravestones.

name: Courtney
detail: Courtney was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Coventry
detail: Coventry is a major industrial world and has served as the administrative capital of a province within the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Covington
detail: The Covington system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra and was a founding member of the Crucis Pact.

name: Coyle
detail: Coyle was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cranston
detail: Cranston was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Crawford
detail: Crawford was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Crawford's Delight
detail: Originally an independent periphery state, the Magistracy absorbed Crawford's Delight during the era of relative peace under the Star League following the Reunification War. Its name comes from the abundant alien sea-life that fills the oceans, much of it mildly hallucinogenic but otherwise safe and pleasant to eat.

name: Cree
detail: Cree was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Crellacor
detail: The vast jungles of Crellacor are home to savage alien hunters and other primitive beings. It's great jungles are also known as "Fortress Green" thanks to the defensive possibilities they offer.

name: Cresson
detail: Cresson was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Crestoblus
detail: Crestoblus was founded during the age of war, and was one of the worlds conquered by the Federated Suns during the War of Reunification. It escaped damage for the most part and has remained a solid member of the Outworlds Alliance for centuries.

name: Crevedia
detail: The Vaj system, better known by it's main planets name of Crevedia, is located within the Donegal province.

name: Crichton
detail: Crichton was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Crimond
detail: Crimond was discovered as the result of a misjump by the Gak's Revenge, a JumpShip. The team found a world filled with rare gemstones, minerals and ores but with a toxic soil. Never the less, over centuries the population of Crimond has become wealthy and rival any within the Commonwealth.

name: Crofton
detail: Home to major manufacturers and a Star League era megaplant owned by StarCorps Industries, Crofton supplies the AFFS with a large portion of their materiel.

name: Cronulla
detail: Cronulla was colonised during the first exodus from Terra, and joined the short lived Sian Commonwealth prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation.

name: Crossing
detail: The Crossing system was colonized during or shortly before the Age of War and was a planet suitable for agriculture but poor on minerals. Planet border position in Draconis March is a cause of heavy military traffic in the system.

name: Cruz Alta
detail: The colony on Cruz Alta became self sufficient after the Reunification War, and has grown into a thriving community of landowners.

name: Cryfder
detail: Cryfder was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Csesztreg
detail: Csesztreg was settled for its vast expanses of heavy metals. These metals were a key component of industry, but it wasn't until the Jamerson-Ulikov water purification technique was perfected that this world could be safely inhabited.

name: Csomad
detail: Csomad was colonised after the Age of War, and was briefly a member of the Taurian Concordat prior to the reunification war. Mostly self sufficient, the world spends most of it's resources on imported food.

name: Culmia
detail: Culmia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but was abandoned by the Outworlds Alliance in the wake of the First Succession War. Still, a small population lingered on Culmia, keeping the planet at subsistence levels for centuries.

name: Cumberland
detail: Settled after the Reunification War by the widows of those lost during said war, Cumberland still maintains it's matriarchal traditions. The societal tenets of Cumberland are designed in a way that children inherit their mother's surname.

name: Cumbres
detail: The Cumbres system was colonized during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Protectorate of Donegal, prior to the formation of the Lyran Commonwealth in the mid-twenty-fourth century.

name: Curaumilla
detail: Curaumilla is home to numerous ice wine vineyards, which are exported across the Free Worlds League.

name: Cursa
detail: Cursa had long been abandoned as too marginal a colony to sustain, but played a role in the war between ComStar and the Free Worlds League. The world was used as bait for a trap, chosen because of its lack of strategic value.

name: Cussar (Barlow's Folly 2864+)
detail: Once named Cussar, the world was renamed Barlow's Folly after a band of insurgents sabotaged DCMS forces for decades during the First Succession War and was then lampooned when finally defeated.

name: Cusset
detail: Alien bacteria and vegetation on Cusset has made settlement difficult here, but pharmaceutical companies continue to pour money into research and development here.

name: Custozza
detail: Custozza was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Cygnus
detail: Cygnus has a distinctive feature: a flower dubbed the 'tundra witch', whose pollen has hallucinogenic properties. As a consequence the local megafauna - a kind of native caribou - is prone to massive stampedes in springtime.

name: Cylene
detail: Colonised centuries ago for it's rich mineral deposits, the planet was devastated during the Succession Wars which has caused severe climate changes. The population has diminished rapidly as the ice age advances.

name: Cynthiana (Liao 2202+)
detail: Liao, named after the Capellan namesake, has served as a capital for many years until it's devastation during the Succession Wars reduced it to a backwater. It still maintains it's importance to the Capellan Confederation however.

name: Cyrenaica
detail: Cyrenaica is home to numerous native truffle farms, which are exported across the Draconis Combine.

name: Cyrton
detail: Cyrton is known for being lawless, and a thriving pharmaceutical trade.

name: Czarvowo
