detail: Czarvowo is known for it's kilometers of mudflats and it's mudskiff racing.

name: Dabih
detail: Dabih was originally settled sometime during the twenty-fifth century by Muslim colonists. After ekeing out a hard existence, technological progress allowed resource extraction of the petroleum under the surface, which increased quality of life for all.

name: Dagda (LC)
detail: Dagda (LC) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dahar
detail: Despite the harsh climate on Dahar IV, the plentiful deposits of ores and minerals attracted colonists to the planet. Local engineers create some of the most advanced mining equipment found anywhere in the Inner Sphere, equipment which is then licensed to other worlds.

name: Dainmar Majoris
detail: This frozen world is made habitable by the constant geothermal activity that convulses its surface. This also makes it a source of highly valuable radioactive ores, and the Magistracy keeps a garrison on the planet to protect its interests there.

name: Dalcour
detail: Settled after the Reunification War, Dalcour served as the headquarters of the XII Corps until the final days of the Star League. Caches are rumoured to be hidden amongst the icy hills.

name: Dalian
detail: Dalian was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dalkeith
detail: During the Star League era, Dalkeith was home to billions. The First Succession war devastated the planet, killing billions and leaving the atmosphere still polluted today.

name: Dalmantia
detail: Dalmantia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dalton
detail: Dalton is a water rich planet with stormy weather, and a merit based government allowing excellence in every craft.

name: Damevang
detail: Damevang was the site of numerous battles during the First Succession War, though only limited nuclear weapons were deployed.

name: Damian
detail: Damian was one host to a Star League Defence Garrison, which has led numerous historians and treasure seekers to the planet to search for caches. None have been found however.

name: Danais
detail: The thick forests of Danais allow for a thriving lumber industry upon the world.

name: Daneshmand
detail: Deneshmand is home to numerous agricompounds that utilise Inner Sphere technology to boost their yields.

name: Dania
detail: Ninety percent of the population of Dania lives an agricultural lifestyle maintained by technology of an equivalent to that found on Terra in the late eighteenth  century, a consequence of the heavy influence of the Omniss philosophy within the New Delphi Compact.

name: Daniels
detail: Daniels is home to numerous pharmaceutical companies that harvest the psycadelic hallucinagenic fauna found on the surface.

name: Danli
detail: Danli was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dansur
detail: Dansur was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dante
detail: Dante is the center of the Omniss movement that rejects all non-essential technologies. Communications are sporadic with the system however, and ship traffic suggests more population than what is officially reported.

name: Danxian
detail: Danxian is a relatively unimportant industrial base, though it's lax trading laws means certain goods may be easier to acquire.

name: Danzig
detail: Danzig is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Daol
detail: Orbital bombardment of Daol during the First Succession War destroyed its climate in a planet-wide firestorm. The ejecta from the mass driver strikes formed a dangerous field of debris in orbit.

name: Dar-es-Salaam
detail: Dar-es-Salaam is the center of the Muslim faith within the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Darius
detail: Darius produces mid tech boats and yachts for export to nearby worlds.

name: Darwendale
detail: Darwendale is known for it's thriving psuedo-synthethic clothing ranges, which it exports to nearby worlds.

name: Davetal
detail: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Davetal is a small trading post colony set up upon a lunar outpost.

name: David
detail: The water on David is infected with a microbe that causes severe allergic reactions. Due to this, David does not export any goods but is self sufficient with light industry.

name: Davisville
detail: Davisville was founded by a deserting Varnayist regimental commander 500 years ago. The locals export lumber and eke out a subsistence existence here, as the mineral-poor world supports little else.

name: Dawn
detail: Filled with dangerous sinkholes, Dawn is a lightly populated center known for it's administration and bureaucracy.

name: Dayr Khuna
detail: Home to Metamorphosis Inc, Dayr Khuna is known for it's biomedical industries and biotechnology.

name: Ddraig
detail: Ddraig was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Death's Gaze Cluster
detail: The Death's Gaze Cluster is a star cluster in the Deep Periphery, which gets it's name from it's appearance as a 4 lightyear spanning 'eye' that floats in the void.

name: De Berry
detail: De Berry uses the heavy silicon found within it's soils to produce solar technology for export to nearby worlds.

name: Decatur
detail: This fog-shrouded water planet is the site of one of the Capellan Confederation's Regional Training Centers, where new CCAF recruits are trained in amphibious assaults and combined-arms tactics.

name: Declan
detail: Declan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Decus
detail: They say it always rains on Decus. The mudflats turn into vast mudpits which cause tracked vehicles to become bogged down or even lost within their muddy depths.

name: Defiance
detail: Defiance was originally settled as a mining colony. Defiance has four major continents named Auglaize, Cuyahoga, Maumee and Sandusky. Jerseyville: the planetary capital city, located on Maumee. Tainted atmosphere, please use masks.

name: Dehgolan
detail: Those who have heard of Dehgolan will often only know it for it's fever-ridden swamps, though it's therapeutic mud baths are meant to be some of the best in the Inner Sphere.

name: Deia
detail: Settled by Deists, the colonists intentially keep their birthrates low as not to spoil the beauty of their world.

name: Delacambre
detail: Delacambre is a rich agricultural world that supports several near planets with it's vast exports.

name: Delacruz
detail: Devastated during the First Succession War, Delacruz has never quite recovered the full glory of it's Star League days.

name: Delagoa
detail: Delagoa was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Delavan
detail: Delevan is home to numerous manufacturing concerns such as Federated Boeing Interstellar and EHKodiak Industries which feed the Universal Ship Yards in orbit.

name: Delitzsch
detail: Delacambre is a world filled with rich petroleum and ore deposits that supports several near planets with it's vast exports.

name: Dell
detail: Only a small portion of the land on Dell is above water, limiting agriculture but ensuring that vast fishing industries exist.

name: Delos
detail: The gem of Delos is Blue City, the administrative hub filled with rich sapphire encrusted statues and buildings.

name: Delphos
detail: Settled during the First Exodus from Terra, Delphos's original governmental building is now an historic monument of a time long past.

name: Demeter
detail: Demeter was one of the first worlds to become self sufficient after the Exodus, and was invested in heavily during the Star League. Lycom-Davion IntroTech have a large aerotech manufacturing complex here.

name: Denbar
detail: Denbar is unique in that it lacked a permanent settlement for most of its history. Though claimed by the Capellan Confederation, no effort was made to colonize it until recently after the remains of a Star League expedition were found on the planet.

name: Deneb Algedi
detail: An arid world filled with dangerous wildlife such as the Nayaraptor. Tourism for those aristocrats with the money to hunt the beasts is a growing trend.

name: Deneb Kaitos
detail: Deneb Kaitos was once populated by billions, until the Amaris Civil War where the world was devastated by nuclear weapons. Even now the world still imports food to counteract the ecological devastation.

name: Denebola
detail: Denebola is a cold world and dependent on trade with other worlds for food. Due to its location, Denebola has traded hands many times over the Succession Wars, including a brief occupation by FWL mercenaries only a decade ago.

name: Denizli
detail: Only a small portion of the land on Denizli is suitable for agriculture, limiting farming but ensuring that vast fishing industries exist.

name: Derby
detail: Derby was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Derf
detail: Vickers Mining own most of the mines of Derf, extracting vital rare materials for export to other worlds.

name: Dersidatz (Blantleff 3025+)
detail: Recently colonised by settlers from the Lothian League and Circinus Federation, the world is filled with praeries ideal for pastoral farming.

name: Des Arc
detail: Settled just before the Age of War, Des Arc's main economic base consists of numerous offices and administration buildings supported by a light industrial base.

name: Deschenes
detail: Deschenes is home to numerous geneticists and biomedical companies which perform experiments on the local fauna. Many research and development laboratories exist here.

name: Deshler
detail: Deshler is famous for its giant blooms of red algae. Its location on the Davion-Kurita border has not done the population or industry any favors, given the near-constant raids and battles that play out on its scattered landmasses.

name: Desolate Plains
detail: Desolate Plains has had the misfortune of being caught between Davion, Liao, and the Taurians, and has suffered as a consequence: space battles led to the complete destruction of the planet's single small moon, leaving a dangerous ring system in orbit.

name: Detroit
detail: Formerly a Magistracy holding, Detroit is a modest mining and agricultural world. During the abortive Taurian-Canopian War, the Taurians unsuccessfully attempted an invasion of the planet.

name: Devil's Breath
detail: Devil's Breath was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but was abandoned by the Outworlds Alliance in the wake of the First Succession War. Still, a small population lingered on Devil's Breath, keeping the planet at subsistence levels for centuries. Additionally, Devil's Breath was known as the ancestral home of the Cerberus Watch, a branch of the Outworlds Alliance's Ground Defense Arm.

name: Devil's Rock
detail: Devil's Rock is a more habitable place than its name implies; it was a bustling trade hub during the peak of the Star League. While it's prosperity has declined somewhat since, it still features bustling ports and a thriving black market.

name: Devin
detail: Devin was host to a massive Star League era battle where upon numerous warships crashed into the surface of the world, littering it with wreckage. Now known as the 'Boneyard', this salvage site is home to numerous salvagers.

name: Deweidewd
detail: Deweidewd was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: DeWitt
detail: DeWitt is a heavily guarded system, with a large training academy for Commonwealth personnel.

name: Dhaulgiri
detail: Dhaulgiri was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dì-fang
detail: Dì-fang was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Diamantina
detail: Named for the massive diamond reserves found near the surface, Diamantia is ran by what equates to a Cartel.

name: Diass
detail: The hot surface of Diass requires all colonists to wear environmental suits when outside the colony enclosure, however it does allow easy access to rare chemicals.

name: Diboll
detail: The Federated Suns took Diboll as a protectorate to protect them from the SLDF in the Reunification War. Rich with valuable water, Diboll's economy relies on the purification and shipping of many billions of litres every year.

name: Dicallus
detail: Dicallus is home to a branch of Bowie Industries, the premium manufacturer of the Gabriel hovercraft. Almost every industry on Dicallus exists thanks to Bowie.

name: Dichell
detail: Dichell was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dickinson
detail: Dickinson is known amongst many pilots for it's dangerous approach - Wind speeds can reach 1,800 km/h in the upper atmosphere

name: Dicon
detail: Once a pleasant Terran world, Dicon's climate was disastrously ruined by strip-mining of metals from its crust. Mining operations still continue, though there is little of value left to extract from the impoverished planet.

name: Diefenbaker
detail: Originally an independent world, Diefenbaker was one of the planets offered membership in the Taurian Concordat, which they accepted. The world has since been conquered by Davion, but the people still have a streak of fierce independence.

name: Die Moot
detail: Die Moot is home to the Federated Judicial Academy, one of the premium academies for lawyers in the Inner Sphere.

name: Dieron
detail: Dieron is a mountainous planet with significant mining and manufacturing industries. It was been an important world for centuries; serving as an administrative center for the Star League before serving the same role in the Draconis Combine.

name: Dieudonné
detail: Dieudonne was colonised due to extensive mineral wealth and readily available native lifeforms that were tasty and nutritious. It was devastated in the Amaris Civil War however, which killed most of the native wildlife.

name: Diik
detail: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Diik is a small black market colony set up amongst a large irrigated desert.

name: Dijonne (Pain 3050+)
detail: Dijonne (Pain 3050+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dili
detail: Dili was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dindatari
detail: Distrustful of the Inner Sphere ever since their cities were massacred in the Reunification War, Dindatari maintains good relations with nearby Outworlds Alliance members.

name: Diosd
detail: A barren world with a breathable nitrogen/oxygen atmosphere. There are no continents, but there are several small seas and lakes.

name: Dirkel
detail: Dirkel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dirk's Gulf
detail: Dirk's Gulf was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dixie
detail: A warm world filled with wildlife, Dixie is home to numerous abandoned Castle Brian's and emptied SLDF caches.

name: Dneiper
detail: Dneiper is home to a large academy for the AMC, where trainees from nearby worlds can train with the latest Periphery equipment.

name: Dnepropetrovsk
detail: The Dnepropetrovsk system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra, was co-opted into the Alliance of Galedon, and then the Draconis Combine prior to the Age of War.

name: Dobson
detail: Dobson is home to a vast rainforest covering much of the planets surface. Historic records show Star League training facilities somewhere on the planet, but they appear lost to the undergrowth.

name: Doggerbank
detail: Doggerbank is a jump point located in the anti-spinward region of the Deep Periphery. The closest inhabitable system is over 110 light years away.

name: Dol
detail: Dol was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Domain
detail: Domain is a world of rolling plains and steppes, filled with large ranches containing vast herds of animals.

name: Domeyko
detail: Domeyko was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dompaire
detail: Dompaire has a few Star League boreholes that are still in operation that brings rare materials to the surface.

name: Donegal
detail: Orbiting above Donegal IV there are 2 space settlements known as "The Tin Cans", which as well developed as the planet below. 3 continents: Dunellan, Hinterlands and Lockenar. Capital: Marsdenville. Twenty-fourth Lyran Guards are living there.

name: Donenac
detail: Donenac is home to numerous biomedical companies that located to the surface after a massive outbreak of the Chelosian virus last century.

name: Doneval
detail: A small industrialised colony, it is however home to the Meistmorn Academy, a premium MechWarrior training centre.

name: Dorian's Tears
detail: Dorian's Tears is a significant astronomical feature in the anti-spinward Deep Periphery, though the system itself is unremarkable.

name: Dormandaine
detail: Recently colonised thanks to it's vast agricultural lands, Dormandaine is quickly establishing itself as a premium exporter of meat products.

name: Dorpat
detail: Dorpat is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Dortmund
detail: Dortmund is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds. Dortmund is known in the Hanseatic League for sporting Deep Periphery 'Mech combat games, with gladiators from the Inner Sphere often drawn to Dortmund for the lavish rewards in Dortmund's games.

name: Dothan
detail: Vast underground caverns are where the majority of the population of Dothan live, as the surface is inhospitable.

name: Dove
detail: Dove was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dover
detail: The surface of Dover has been host to a number of institutes of higher learning as well as a number of significant industrial concerns, while the Dover Shipyards operates in low orbit above the surface of the planet.

name: Dowles
detail: Dowles was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Drachenfeld
detail: Drachenfeld is located in the spinward region of the Deep Periphery, with the closest inhabited system over a hundred light years away.

name: Dralkig
detail: Dralkig was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Drask's Den
detail: Settled by a band of pirates and their families during the Third Succession War, this small world offers treasures and other delights not for sale on civilized worlds.

name: Dreadlord
detail: Dreadlord was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dresden
detail: Dresden was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Drienfontein
detail: Whilst the surface of Dienfontein is inhospitable, underground caves and rifts allow a large population to eke out a living.

name: Dromini
detail: Dromini VI's location on the Lyran/Kuritan border has made it a frequent base for and target of units launching raids across the border. Ownership changed 3 times in 3029-3030 alone, though House Kurita has retained control since.

name: Drosendorf
detail: Drosendorf supports nearby such as Zvolen thanks to it's rich and fertile soils.

name: Drozan
detail: A teeming agricultural world, Drozan is critical to Capellan food supply, and features massive urban centers, research facilities and food laboratories. The vast automated fields and fisheries are protected by elite Capellan Warrior House troops.

name: Drucci
detail: One of the earliest worlds settled by the colonists that would form the Jacobson Haven, Drucci somehow remained a quiet agricultural backwater world. Little of note takes place here, at least that the Haven will admit to, and its populace is known for their privacy and solitude.

name: Drusibacken
detail: Drusibacken is a self sufficient colony with a light industrial base, mining petroleum products from deep within the rainforests.

name: Duantia
detail: Duantia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dubhe
detail: Located in a binary system, Dubhe is famous for its periodic 'super summers' when the normal hot season lines up with a relatively close approach to the systems secondary star.

name: Dukambia
detail: The high gravity on Dukambia restricted plant growth until local scientists uncovered inverted farming methods, utilising the gravity to improve yields.

name: Du Lac
detail: Du Lac was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dumaring
detail: The vast amounts of sunlight available on Dumaring allow for large amounts of photosynthesis amongst the vegetation, which has adapted to the high temperatures.

name: Dumassas
detail: Dumassas was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dunianshire
detail: The industrial world of Dunianshire, home to the Majesty Metals corporation, is choked by pollution and the sulfurous by-products of heavy industry. The majority of the population lives in the city of Londinium, where breathing filters are required to go outdoors.

name: Dunkerque
detail: Dunkerque was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dunklewälderdunklerflüssenschattenwelt (Bob 2789+)
detail: Dunklewälderdunklerflüssenschattenwelt the original name, made up when the first settlers tried some plants, was unpronouncable for everyone outside the Lyran Commonwealth. So the Planet was renamed in something everyone could pronounce... Bob....

name: Durabon
detail: Durabon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Duran
detail: Duran is a dry world, filled with dangerous sandstorms. It's rich mineral base allows it to import the food it needs from nearby worlds.

name: Dustball
detail: "Where the elite meet, greet, and satisfy their most wicked desires" is the slogan of Dustball, an inhospitable world that is vastly wealthy thanks to it's pleasure palaces.

name: Duxford
detail: Duxford was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Duxfort
detail: Duxfort was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Dyev
detail: Though water is scarce on Dyev's surface, settlers uncovered an underground freshwater sea early in the planet's history. This supply of freshwater allows the planet to feed itself, while the productive mines on the planet drive its economy.

name: Dyfed
detail: A mountainous world with heavy rainfall and fertile soils, Dyfed was home to a Castle Brian during the Star League era - the location of which has been lost to time.

name: Eagle Rest
detail: Eagle Rest was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Eaglesham
detail: Eaglesham is known for it's large oasis spread throughout the deserts, which are surrounded by fertile land.

name: Early Dawn
detail: Early Dawn was conquered by the SLDF during the Reunification War. It returned to Magistracy control after the war ended, and is now dedicated to fishing and farming. The home office of Magliss Spirits, the leading producer of wine and brandy in the Periphery, is located here.

name: Eaton
detail: The Eaton system was colonised during the early twenty-fourth century and was an independent system prior to being incorporated into the Lyran Commonwealth at some point during or shortly before the Age of War. Pro-Skye Separatists' second home.

name: Ebensburg
detail: All lakes and seas on Ebensburg are covered with a thick layer of algae. Some simple animal species feed on the algae, and their habitat is limited to within a few miles of the coast.

name: Ebon's End
detail: This world has no listed information as to ownership or even that it existed until appearing suddenly on star maps in 3062. Named Ebon's End implies someone named Ebon died here, but as Ebon is quite a rare surname, that doesn't explain much. Still, there's some good deals to be found here, if you can stand the taciturn locals.

name: Ebro
detail: A very rural world with little resources, the population of Ebro has little contact with the rest of the galaxy.

name: EC821-387D
detail: EC821-387D was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Echo
detail: Echo is a barren, tundra-covered planet, whose icy cyclones scourge the surface of the world. It is home to a large Zen monastery.

name: Edasich
detail: Home to Edasich Motors, the vast manufacturing base supports a highly industrialised populace.

name: Edirne (Brank 3130+)
detail: Edirne (Brank 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Edmondson
detail: Edmondson is home to numerous borehole mining facilities that extract minerals from deep under the burning deserts.

name: Edwards
detail: Home to Journey Aerospace, Edwards has numerous landing sites situated across the planet.

name: Egress
detail: This critical military and logistical world features a Duchy Regional Training Center, where volunteers for the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces are sent for training. The RTC on Egress specializes in infantry and vehicle training.

name: Eguilles
detail: The low gravity on Eguilles allows for vast megaflora to be grown amongst the fertile soils.

name: Eidsfoss
detail: Abandoned during the Age of War, it was subsequently repopulated during the War of Reunification as a military depot.

name: Eigerland
detail: Eigerland was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Eilenburg
detail: The inhospitable temperatures on the surface of Eilenburg force most of the population to stay within their habitation domes.

name: Eion
detail: Eion was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ejeda
detail: Ejeda was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Elba
detail: Elba was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Elbar
detail: Elbar once served as a resupply depot for the Star League, but now most facilities sit ruined under vegetation.

name: Elbing (FWL)
detail: Elbing (FWL) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Elbing (HL)
detail: Elbing is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: El Dorado
detail: El Dorado was vital to the commercial empire being built by Adam Davion and which laid much of the groundwork for the future Federated Suns. Has a number of "Super Lakes"

name: Electra
detail: One of the three inhabited worlds of the Pleiades, Electra is a highly populated and industrialized planet with extensively irrigated farmlands in the major river valleys, and deep mines in the desert highlands.

name: Elektrougli
detail: Elektrougli is mostly a sandy desert lit by a bright blue sun, with deep canyons cut into the planet's crust.

name: Eleusis
detail: The vast cities on Eleusis are filled with glass windows and fantastic views due to the tainted atmosphere which can only be breathed for a few hours every day.

name: El Giza
detail: El Giza is a world of purple fronds instead of conventional trees or grasses. The Heather - as its known to locals - grows up to between three and four meters tall.

name: Elidere
detail: Elidere is a rather small and drab world. It possesses several modest deposits of oil and metals that provide the resources for the planet's metals industry.

name: Elissa
detail: Originally settled by people looking to escape from technology, Elissa was conquered by the Oberon Confederation during the Succession Wars who strip mined the world for the few resources it offered and brutalized the population.

name: Elix
detail: Elix was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: El Kerak
detail: El Kerak was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ellengurg
detail: Ellengurg is a small mining colony on a high gravity world. The raw materials are painstakingly drawn from the surface, though mine collapses are common.

name: Ellijay
detail: Ellijay is unremarkable, except for a long, narrow continent that follows the line of the equator, stretching half way around the planet.

name: Ellsworth
detail: Home to a small aerospace manufacturer, Gutierrez Aerospace, Ellsworth provides raw material and expertise to the aerotech industry.

name: Elnath
detail: There are scattered forests of dark green fungal towers that cross Elnath, and multicoloured solar flares occur annually, rendering electronics useless for a time.

name: Eltanin
detail: Eltanin is home to the virulent 'Eltanin Brain Fever', as well as a sun that may go nova at a moment's notice. Their disaster planning is therefore second to none.

name: Elume
detail: Elume is a small self sufficient colony which exports dry wines and meats to nearby worlds.

name: Emar
detail: Emar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Emerson
detail: Emerson is a harsh and marginally habitable world but rich in resources, and was founded by prisoners from a nearby system.

name: Emporia
detail: Home to Ritza MechWarrior Academy, Emporia is also known for it's numerous rare art collections and museums from eras past.

name: Emris
detail: A heavily industrialised world, Emris is home to Hollis Industries and StarCorps Industries which produce munitions for use across the Free Worlds League.

name: Enchi
detail: Settled as an agricultural world, the initial settlers had to deal with the planet's axial tilt resulting in extremely long-lasting seasons.

name: Enders Cluster
detail: Ender's Cluster is one of a number of multi-star clusters found within the Inner Sphere, though no notable worlds are inhabited within the cluster - mostly pirate bases and rogue settlements for those who do not wish to be found.

name: Engadin
detail: Ancient ruins of the early Succession Wars can be found across the surface of Engadin.

name: Engadine
detail: Settled by prisoners from the Rim Worlds Republic, Engadine has many areas that are covered with light snow and heavy ice. These harsh conditions forced the early involuntary settlers to become hardy survivalists.

name: Enif
detail: Enif's circular orbit means temperature variations are caused by the day/night cycle only.

name: Enkoping
detail: The plant-like organisms on Enkoping are dominated by various types of grass, but they only reach short heights due to the high gravity.

name: Enkra
detail: Enkra was once a mining world, shipping raw materials to nearby Brinton. Over-mining and the Succession Wars made it no longer a viable industry, but the planet has seen a rebirth as an agricultural world outside of the badly-polluted industrial zones.

name: Entalun
detail: Entalun was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Enzesfled
detail: Enzesfled was colonised just before the Age of War, and has so far avoided any devastation in the Succession Wars.

name: Eom
detail: An extremely hot planet. The equatorial regions are too hot for most species, and so the only settlements are situated in the extreme polar regions.

name: Epsilon
detail: Epsilon is a damp, boggy world, prone to excessive rain and wide-scale flooding.

name: Epsilon Eridani
detail: Epsilon Eridani is a pleasant but damp world, prone to frequent mild rainstorms. It primarily exports food, though it also has significant chemical and heavy industrial manufacturing.

name: Epsilon Indi
detail: Epsilon Indi is a hot, dry world rich in heavy metals. It once boasted a Star League SDS of military drone sattelites capable of destroying incoming drop ships, but the SDS has been lost as pieces were destroyed and repair parts could not be sourced. Epsilon Indi joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Epsilon Pegasus (Columbus)
detail: Used as a base by both the Terran Hegemony and the SLDF, Columbus was abandoned until it was rediscovered by the Explorer Corps.

name: Erdvynn
detail: Erdvynn was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Erewhon
detail: Known primarily for sheep farming and wool, Erewhon is home to a small colony and light industrial base mainly used for light vehicles for agriculture.

name: Erin (Von Strang's World 2830+)
detail: Controlled by the lawless Von Strang family, this world is made up of a wealthy aristocracy and vast numbers of feudal workers. If you've got the money, you can buy many things here.

name: Erod's Escape
detail: Recently settled after the Fourth Succession War, Erod's Escape is a small colony set up by a mercenary band who fled their employer.

name: Eromanga
detail: Settled during the First Exodus from Terra, Eromanga is filled with strange native wildlife called weebs that the local farmers harvest.

name: Errai
detail: Errai is home to a large number of casinos and clubs, making it a popular recreation destination.

name: Eschenberg
detail: Eschenberg was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Escobas
detail: Settled during the First Exodus from Terra, Escobas is filled with strange native fauna called Harels that the local farmers crossbreed and harvest.

name: Espakeh
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Espakeh was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison. Rumours of hidden caches on the surface still exist to this day.

name: Espia
detail: An inhospitable muddy rock, Espia was colonized only for its use as a jump route. The population lives on rocky outcroppings amid the endless, deadly mud-flats, which are capable of swallowing an entire 'Mech whole.

name: Esteros
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Esteros was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison. Rumours of hidden caches on the surface still exist to this day.

name: Estuan
detail: The icy world of Estuan is home to vast mining facilities which pump rare material from deep within the permafrost.

name: Esztergom
detail: Esztergom was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Etiler
detail: Dense jungles of stone towers cover Etiler, which formed due to massive planetary damage.

name: Euclid
detail: Filled with unique forms of native life, Euclid has been home to many research teams from bioscience departments across the Inner Sphere.

name: Euschelus
detail: Euschelus is an icy desert, with large water-filled caves that are present just beneath the surface.

name: Eustatius
detail: Apart from a few frozen lakes and rivers, Eustatius is dry. Basins of red dust exist where oceans should be.

name: Eutin
detail: Eutin is a poor system with a growing manufacturing base, which has found a niche in being able to produce goods for a lower price than many competitors. Investors believe TharHes Industries may be interested in the growing system.

name: Evansville
detail: The once thriving Star League Defence Force industrial facilities on Evansville were destroyed by the Draconic Combine during the First Succession War, and centuries later the effects are still being felt.

name: Evciler
detail: Evciler is home to numerous high tech medical centres due to recurring outbreaks of Edison White Flu.

name: Everett
detail: Everett was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ewanrigg
detail: This system was originally named for Ewan Rigg, a noted entrepreneur and adventurer. During the Star League era Ewanrigg had a reputation as a vacation spot.

name: Exedor
detail: Exedor was originally home to military industry, but was devastated during the First Succession War. Now it is the storage facility for the Liao family's treasures, kept in underground bunkers and guarded by members of the Chesterton Reserves.

name: Exeter
detail: Home to the Galtor Blue Water Naval Yards, Exeter is wealthy planet that is the primary exporter of militarised seafaring vessels in this part of the Inner Sphere.

name: Fable
detail: Fable was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Fadiffolu
detail: A FWL system that was settled during the Age of War by refugees fleeing the conflict with the CCAF. As such, it always wasn't entirely behind the martial laws of the "Free" Worlds League.

name: Fager
detail: The Fager system is an uninhabited system located in the Rimward sector of the Deep Periphery past the Perseus-Cepherus Cloud Complex, a vast molecular cloud or stellar nursery.

name: Fagerholm
detail: Fagerholm is a dry world with large canyon systems that are the result of millions of years of erosion from the rivers that once crossed its surface. Originally a Capellan colony, it was lost to the Free Worlds League in the aftermath of the First Succession War.

name: Fairfax
detail: A wealthy world, with vast mineral wealth, Fairfax has been the administrative capital of the Fairfax Combat region.

name: Fairfield
detail: Named due the great amounts of farmland available to settlers, it was soon discovered that bacteria within the soils of the planet rendered all crops sterile. The same bacteria can be used within medical supplies, which has created a large soil mining operation on the planet.

name: Falacer
detail: One of the founding worlds of the Sacellum, Falacer's history runs back to the original settlement of the Sanctuary Worlds. Since then, its been a part of the Sacellum's history and several major battles have been fought on its elysian fields. Today, Falacer is a quiet world with just a memory of greatness.

name: Faleolo
detail: Faleolo is nothing more than a rocky desert lit by a dim blue sun. Deep canyons cut into the planet's crust, where small mining operations eke out a living.

name: Fallen Stars
detail: Fallen Stars was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Fallon
detail: Although terraformed partially during the Star League era, Fallon still has a tainted atmosphere which limits outdoor pursuits.

name: Fallry
detail: Fallry was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: False Dawn
detail: False Dawn was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Falsterbo (DC)
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Falsterbo was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison, which led to the discovery of numerous small Star League caches across the surface.

name: Falsterbo (HL)
detail: Falsterbo is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Famdo
detail: Famdo was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Fanardir
detail: Settled during the Age of War, Fanardir became a target for the SLDF invasion of the Magistracy of Canopus as it sought to reunify humanity. It has a cool wintry climate, with the population mostly limited to Jakarta City, the capital.

name: Farcry
detail: Farcry was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Farhome
detail: Farhome is little more than a scientific outpost gathering data on an alien world.

name: Farnsworth
detail: Farnsworth is home to strange moss like flora - the ground is covered in thick purple slime. The large flora takes the shape of giant purple geodesic domes.

name: Far Reach
detail: Originally the corporate center for the Rim Worlds Republic, Far Reach fell into disarray when the RWR was destroyed. It survived only by the grace and hard work of its abandoned corporations and their workers. Today, it forms the basis of the Far Reach Collective, one of the many minor powers of the Chainelane Isles.

name: Farstar
detail: Farstar is a recent colony world situated spinward of the Draconis Combine. It's large asteroid field can obscure fleets of vessels.

name: Farwell
detail: Farwell is a harsh, cold world. The high oxygen and low temperatures force the population to exist indoors. Large Star League era greenhouses still exist, filled with Terran flora as one of the only morale boosters to the miners.

name: Fathepur
detail: Fathepur was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Fatima
detail: Infamous for being the site of the assassination of Alistair Steiner over half a millenia earlier, Fatima is an otherwise peaceful planet with a large industrial base.

name: Fefferfer
detail: Fefferfer was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Feijo
detail: Feijo was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Fellanin
detail: Fellanin was hit by a city sized asteroid over a millenia ago, rendering much of the world uninhabitable. Mining settlements and farms are connected by subterranean railways to easily exploit the mineral deposits.

name: Feltre
detail: Numerous settlements around the planet make up the industrialised world of Feltre. It's large trading centre is home to numerous interstellar corporations.

name: Ferihegy
detail: Sealed complexes make up the main settlement on Ferihegy, due to the toxic atmosphere on this extremely mineral rich planet.

name: Ferleiten
detail: Dense jungles of large purple flora cover Ferleiten, which has large fertile soils due to radiation from the planetary rings.

name: Ferranil
detail: Ferranil was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ferrara
detail: Ferrara was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ferris (OA)
detail: Ferris is the location of an AGDA training facility for militia MechWarriors for the Outworlds Alliance. Mercenary and Pirate groups also recruit here.

name: Ferris (OC)
detail: Settled by a group of rebels from the Draconis Combine during the Third Succession War, Ferris is now home to many hordes of disreputables. Good ale though.

name: Fetsund
detail: Fetsund is made up of a rocky desert lit by a wan yellow sun. There are extensive fossilized forests throughout the planet.

name: Fianna
detail: The Fianna Massacre occurred here in 3017, where the clashes between the inexperienced Oberon Guards and rioting populace inadvertedly released massive amounts of chemical weapons into the atmosphere, killing half the population and rendered the colony crippled.

name: Fieferana
detail: Fieferana welcomed Star League forces onto the planet, until the end of the Star League. Caches are believed to be hidden across the world.

name: Fiery Plains
detail: Fiery Plains was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Filtvelt
detail: One of the more notable worlds in the Davion 'Outback', Filtvelt is a naturally verdant planet and an agricultural breadbasket, despite the painful decline of its industrial base and constant pirate raids.

name: Fincastle
detail: A sandy desert lit by a dull red sun. The local wildlife builds their shells out of rare metals, which are hunted by settlers.

name: Findal
detail: Findal was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Finmark
detail: Finmark was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Finse
detail: Finse was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Finsterwalde
detail: The Finsterwalde system was colonized by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but then captured by the Lyran Commonwealth in the Second Succession war.

name: Firenze
detail: As key suppliers of salted fruits to the Commonwealth, Firenze has evolved into an economic powerhouse.

name: Firgrove
detail: Firgrove is a large industrial hub, with the orbital Clyde Shipyards requiring large amounts of material for the construction of vessels.

name: Fjaldr
detail: The original colony was largely underground, built in the sides of deep kilometer-wide shafts that breach the ice that envelops this world. Fjaldr survives on its rich mineral resources and its position as a well-connected hub world near the Inner Sphere.

name: Fjernet
detail: Fjernet was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Flannagan's Nebulea
detail: This frozen world in the heart of Taurian space is the moon of a large ice giant. Tidal stresses from the planet have created an ocean of liquid water below the ice, and in that ocean, submarine dome cities cluster around warm volcanic vents to exploit the rich minerals found there.

name: Flatspin
detail: Flatspin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Flaum
detail: Most of the few inhabitants of this arid world live in the extremely fertile floodplains of the planet's only major river system, where they operate and maintain the automated farms. A smaller number of people live in the mining plants of Flaum's north polar region.

name: Fletcher
detail: Once home to numerous weapons manufacturers during the Star League which were destroyed during the Succession Wars, Fletcher is now the base of Fusigon Heavy Weaponry. Fletcher joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Fletcher (FWL)
detail: Home to Flame Tech manufacturing facilities, Fletcher is a large manufacturing hub for nearby systems.

name: Fletcher's Feast
detail: Settled by pirates from Tortuga, Fletcher's Feast is a veritable hive of scum and villainy.

name: Flintoft
detail: The site of a major naval battle during the Reunification War, Flintoft's orbit is still dangerously littered with debris. The industrial world has a bustling secondary market in salvaged technology from orbit as well as the many battlefields on the surface.

name: Florarda
detail: Florarda was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Florida
detail: Florida was originally a part of the Timbuktu Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Flushing
detail: The original settlements on Flushing were destroyed in the First Succession War, but some homesteads still remain.

name: Flychenia
detail: Flychenia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Flynn
detail: Flynn was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Fomalhaut
detail: Fomalhaut is a tropical world whose population mostly live on island chains. It serves primarily as a resort world, and despite its presence along the Kurita/Davion border has been largely spared from the destruction of the Succession Wars.

name: Foochow
detail: The settlements on Foochow are carved out of the planet wide jungles, filled with dangerous predators and fauna.

name: Foot Fall
detail: Foot Fall is known for it's rapidly changing weather cycles. Both continents feature expansive mountain ranges and relatively little arable land, although the arable land that exists is prolifically fertile.

name: Ford
detail: Home to an office of Skye Traders, as well as a manufacturing plant of Ford Military Limited, Ford is a stable manufacturing hub within the Inner Sphere.

name: Forkas
detail: The Forkas system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Fort Loudon
detail: An important world for much of the Lyran Commonwealth's history, Fort Loudon is home to an operational Fort Brian.

name: Fortymile
detail: The Fortymile system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the Reunification War, and is an unimportant agricultural world.

name: Franklin
detail: The Franklin system was colonised during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. Devastated in both the First and Second Succession Wars, little remains of the vast mineral boreholes that were created here.

name: Frankson
detail: Frankson was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Franmalin
detail: Interstellar Expeditions has marked this world as suitable for colonisation, however little more is known about it.

name: Frazer
detail: Frazer is a major petroleum exporter, which provided the motivation for colonists to clear a broad swath of the native rainforest for agricultural production, allowing the world to be self-sufficient. The heavy rainfall is well-suited to Terran rice crops.

name: Fredotto
detail: Known through the Rim Worlds Republic for their firearm manufacturing, Fredotto fell to anarchy like most worlds of the RWR did when that state fell. It managed to scrape by though, eventually forming a rotating government of three major nation-states. Fredotto is known throughout the Isles for its famed rifle platoon soldiers-for-hire.

name: Freedom
detail: Freedom VI is a hospitable world with a single moon named Vigil's Light. Famous for its part in the Outer Reaches Rebellion. Was directly involved in the events that led to collapse of the Terran Alliance. Home of Twentieth Avalon Hussars.

name: Freisland
detail: The Freisland system was colonized during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra, and was one of the founding members of the Federated Suns via the Crucis Pact.

name: Frobisher
detail: Once the site of an Interstellar Expeditions genetic engineering research post, it has since been abandoned.

name: Fröislandis
detail: The Fröislandis system is located in the Anti-Spinward sector of the Deep Periphery past the Cygnus Loop, and is an icy world inhabited by a small outpost of researchers.

name: Fronc
detail: Fronc was simultaneously colonized by both the Magistracy and the Concordat, and the fragile peace between the two colonial nations has been periodically broken by terrorism, local brush wars, and heated rhetoric.

name: Frondas
detail: Frondas is a small mining colony built to lay claim to the system during the First Exodus from Earth, but unlike most other planets of that era it has not grown substantially over the past few centuries.

name: Fronde
detail: Fronde was colonised after the Age of War, due to scans of rare rich platinum deposits under the surface.

name: Fuentes
detail: Fuentes was colonised during the First Exodus from Earth, and exports most of it's foodstuffs to nearby worlds.

name: Fugeres
detail: Fugeres was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Fujidera
detail: The Fujidera system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Federation of Oriente prior to the formation of the Free Worlds League.

name: Fukuroi
detail: The Fukuroi system was the site of Riots during the Star League era, which were brutally quashed. Memorials to the futility of standing against the Combine still exist to this day.

name: Furillo
detail: Blessed with abundant resources and a rich biosphere, Furillo was rapidly colonized during the First Exodus and has been crucial to the Lyran industrial base for centuries. It houses a set of major production facilities, including a Mech factory.

name: Furud
detail: The Furud system was colonised at some point in the late twenty-third or early twenty-fourth century and was a member of the Sian Commonwealth prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation.

name: Futuna
detail: The Futuna system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra and by the end of the Age of War had been incorporated into the Free Worlds League.

name: Fuveau
detail: The Fuveau system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War

name: Fylovar
detail: Interstellar Expeditions has marked Fylover as suitable for colonisation, however little more is known about it.

name: Gabenstad
detail: Gabenstad was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gacrux
detail: Gacrux possesses vast mineral wealth but the star it orbits is slowly dying. As solar output wanes, the planet's average temperature drops by about a degree every century.

name: Gaeri
detail: Gaeri was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gagliano
detail: A frozen iceball, Gagliano has developed a reputation for being a bit of a smuggler's paradise. The planet is poorly developed and has vast swathes of uncharted mountains and crevasses for smugglers to hide in. If you want it, you can get it on Gagliano.

name: Gahral
detail: Gahral was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Galatea
detail: Galatea began to prosper when a clever treaty was negotiated with ComStar, via which the planetary government managed to establish Galatea as the center of the mercenary trade. The influx of trade led to a boom in the economy. Galatea, in addition to serving as a mercenary hub, also developed a reputation as a home for BattleMech dueling games much like Solaris VII, though less civilized than that world's sport.

name: Galatia
detail: Galatia lacks strategic value or resources, which has left it largely unscathed by the Succession Wars.

name: Galax
detail: Galax's large moon causes turmoil on the surface and in the atmosphere, but allows a constantly replenishing amount of new raw materials and petroleum.

name: Galedon
detail: Originally settled in 2282, the fifth planet in the Galedon system was attractive to early settlers due to it's diamond deposits and abundant fresh water.  Galedon remains both a key agricultural centre, and an important industrial planet.

name: Galicia
detail: Galicia is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery region known as Nueva Castile and is wholy unremarkable.

name: Galisteo
detail: The Galisteo system was settled at some point during or prior to the Age of War, and avoided devastation during the Succession Wars

name: Gallatin
detail: Settled during the second wave of the First Exodus from Sol, Gallatin provides materials to nearby worlds.

name: Gallery
detail: Gallery presents a barren surface to observers. The system's weak sun cannot penetrate the perpetual heavy cloud cover, and the planet is constantly swept by violent storms. Tax laws make it a haven for less reputable companies such as Quikscell.

name: Gallis
detail: Gallis' capital of Myopia City is the home of the Canopian Highlanders, a mercenary unit founded shortly after the Reunification War, when the Star League invaded the Magistracy. There's little else of note about the world, beyond the fact that it once played host to a SLDF base.

name: Gallitzin
detail: The Gallitzin system was colonized during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Galtor
detail: Galtor was a populous garden world until the Succession Wars, which devastated the world and it's population due to it's location on the border between the Federated Suns and Draconis Combine.

name: Galuzzo
detail: Adverts for the tropical world of Galuzzo often talk about the "Exotic wines and the best pizza in known space" which supports a thriving tourist industry.

name: Gambarare
detail: The Gambarare system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the United Hindu Collective prior to the Collective joining the Federated Suns.

name: Gambier
detail: From the 2200s to the 2400s, the Gambier system was a stopover point for colony ships moving to other systems spinward from Terra. Now it is little more than an entertainment hub, including a small BattleMech arena combat circuit.

name: Gambilon
detail: Little is known of this remote system, save that it was was settled relatively late, during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War. Its most notable feature is the Olympus-class space station at its jump point, serving as a travel hub for this remote part of the Magistracy.

name: Gamlestolen
detail: Gamlestolen was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gandy's Luck
detail: Originally found due to a misjump, the Gandy's Luck system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra prior to joining the Draconis Combine.

name: Gangtok
detail: As a recently-colonized world, Gangtok is bustling with boom-town energy; temporary cities have sprung up all over the unremarkable Terran world, as eager prospectors, colonists, and merchants crowd in, all looking to strike it rich.

name: Gannett
detail: The Gannett system was colonised at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Ganshoren
detail: The Ganshoren system was colonized at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra, and by the end of the Age of War had been incorporated into the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Gan Singh
detail: During the Star League era, Gan Singh served as the headquarters for the XXIV Corps (Star League) of the Star League Defense Force, supporting by a nascent mining industry which still exists to this day.

name: Gant
detail: Recently settled, the colonists on Gant eke out a limited living on the hard scrabble like soils.

name: Gardnaus
detail: The original colony on Gardnaus has been almost completely reclaimed by the scouring sandstorms that constantly sweep the planet's surface. A few research teams still pick through the battlefield remnants from Star League era conflicts.

name: Garrison
detail: Garrison is so named for it's military training center and post. Pockmarked by weapon testing sites, it still churns out thousands of new recruits every year.

name: Garstedt
detail: A water rich world, much of it's wealth comes from the 'Underdepth Oceans', a mineral rich subterranean cavern system filled with water.

name: Gatchina
detail: The steppes and praeries of Gatchina provide ample farming ground for the population.

name: Gateway
detail: Gateway is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Gatineau
detail: The Gatineau system was colonized at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Gaucin
detail: This agricultural world supplies food to nearby systems and the Taurian Concordat. Much of this industry is based on factory farming of the genetically-engineered Gaucin Hog, a native life-form that some activists believe is sapient.

name: Gaul
detail: Recently settled, the colonists on Gaul eke out a limited living from the toxic waters and tough soils.

name: Gei-Fu
detail: Gei-Fu III - more commonly known simply as Gei-Fu - is the third planet in the Gei-Fu system and has a single moon named Yè xīng. While still a Capellan world, the population is known to have a large number of St. Ives sympathists in it.

name: Geifer
detail: Geifer is home to the Capellan Institute of Linguistics; one of the few major universities that survived the Succession Wars. Many members of the Capellan diplomatic and intelligence services are trained here.

name: Genf
detail: Genf was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Genoa
detail: Settled in 2175, the harsh desert has forced the settlers to vast rich underground caverns with great river networks.

name: Gettorf
detail: Gettorf was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ghaziabad
detail: Settled as late as 2750, Ghaziabad is a dry world with limited resources.

name: Giausar
detail: Giausar is home to numerous chemical agricompound plants that utilise cutting edge technology to boost their yields.

name: Gibbs
detail: Ioto Galactic Enterprises maintains a massive manufacturing hub at the LaGrange Point between Gibbs and it's moon.

name: Gibraltar
detail: Gibraltar is home to an operational Star League facility, Fort Calpe.

name: Gibson
detail: Gibson is the home of Gibson Federated Battlemechs and Brigadier Corporations. Together these are the two largest producers of Battlemechs and Warships in the Free Worlds League. Ownership over the Gibson system was given to the Word of Blake in the 3060s as a gift from the Captain-General of the FWL.

name: Gienah
detail: Gienah is a heavily industrialised world that is home to Gienah Automotive, which also manufactures parts for military vehicles.

name: Gillfillan's Gold
detail: The capital world of the fledgling Rim Collection, Gillfillan's Gold has been settled for centuries and only recently led the push to unify the Rim Collection under one banner of mutual interest.

name: Gillingham
detail: Gillingham is a terrestrial planet with an extremely slow axial rotation. Days and nights here can last as long as an Earth-week

name: Ginestra
detail: A small Earth-like planet with dangerous levels of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere. Seasonal grasslands cover the entire surface.

name: Gingeria
detail: Gingeria was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Girondas
detail: The majority of Girondas's surface area is covered by shallow oceans. Of the 20% of the planet's surface that is land, most is a vast marshland, hot and foul-smelling, but excellent for both agriculture and fish farming.

name: Gitarama
detail: Gitarama was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Giverny
detail: Giverny was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Givrodat
detail: Givrodat was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Glabach
detail: Glabach was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gladius
detail: Gladius' surface is 94% covered by water and is famous for its jade green seas. The planet possesses relatively little mineral wealth so its economy is mostly based around being a tourist and retirement destination for the upper classes.

name: Glagwa
detail: Glagwa is a barely colonized hellscape world, notable only for the heavy metal mining that takes place here. Glagwa has tremendous metallic wealth and serves the Sanctuary Alliance well in this regard. Most of the mining is done by robotic drones, with only enough human presence to oversee the robots and ensure nothing goes too wrong with their processing.

name: Glasgow
detail: Glasgow is a terrestrial planet famous for its carnivorous trees and stormy weather. The sap from the trees is known to be a powerful intoxicant.

name: Glengarry
detail: Glengarry had been a prosperous world focused on trade and light industry during the Star League era, but has been in steep decline ever since. It is now a minor world consisting mostly of small agricultural communities.

name: Glenlivet
detail: Glenlivet was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Glenmora
detail: Glenmora's central continent, named Hades, is so named for the ring of volcanoes that surround it.

name: Glentworth
detail: This industrial world's economy was shattered by the Second Succession War, in which Davion captured it from Liao. The atmospheric dust from orbital bombardment led to a precipitous drop in global temperatures.

name: Glevakha
detail: Teaming with life, Glevakha's islands drift on the planets ocean, a phenomena caused by helium and other gases trapped in porous rock - spewed out from subaqueous volcanoes.

name: Glitnir
detail: Glitnir was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gniezno
detail: Gniezno was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Goat Path
detail: Goat Path is so named due to the rocky terrain of the world that renders conventional vehicles useless. Combat on this world must be conducted using aircraft or bipedal transport.

name: Goderich
detail: A small rocky planet in the Lagrange point of a gas giant. The planet has no atmosphere, but incredibly there is life here, living in large underground reservoirs of water

name: Goetville
detail: Goetville is a world consisting mostly of carbon, with a dense diamond core. Several mines on the surface extract diamonds from beneath the surface, making the planet a major source of wealth.

name: Goito
detail: Goito has five continents, Mantovana where the capital city Gonzaga is located, Rodigo, Volta, Roverbella and Marmirolo.

name: Golandrinas
detail: Golandrinas is what is called an Eyeball or 'tidally locked' planet. As such Golandrinas does not have a day/night cycle but a fixed day side and night side.

name: Goldlure
detail: Goldlure was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gomeisa
detail: Gomeisa was a heavily contested world centuries ago during the Age of War, and still bears the pockmarks of war to this day.

name: Goodna
detail: Goodna's vast forests filled with wildlife make this known as a planet filled with rare edible delicacies.

name: Gorfynt
detail: Gorfynt was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gorgon
detail: Gorgon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gorki
detail: Gorki was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Goshen
detail: Goshen has been a hotly contested world during the Succession Wars thanks to it's raw materials and arable land.

name: Goslar
detail: Goslar is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Goth Khakar
detail: Goth Khakar is a world consisting mostly of harsh jagged plateaus, with a dense mineral core that heats up the surface. Several mines on the surface extract material from beneath the surface, providing the planet with a major source of wealth.

name: Gotterdammerung
detail: Once a glorious world in the Rim Worlds Republic, the colony was devastated during the Amaris Civil War and remains stuck in a nuclear winter. Now the scant population remaining either herds local reindeer or supports nearby pirate activities.

name: Goubellat
detail: The Goubellat system colonized during the First Exodus from Terra. Then it became a border world between the Draconis Combine and the Outworlds Alliance. In 26th century The SLDF marshalled the Forty-second Brigade on Goubellat prior to the invasion.

name: Gouderak
detail: Gouderak has a very arid and oppressively hot climate, and has at least two major continents, named Ayles and Halton. Water problems continue to plague settlements here.

name: Graceland
detail: Malthus Gambling Unlimited is rumoured to control the local government on the planet, which is known for it's lax tax measures and black market supplies.

name: Graham
detail: Graham once supported significant military manufacturing capabilities. Unfortunately, this made the planet a target for WMD attacks during the 1st Succession War. With the atmosphere tainted, most inhabitants have left over the centuries.

name: Gram
detail: The gojo harvest attracts traders every year, as it is known for it's usage in high end recipes and potent alcoholic spirit.

name: Gran
detail: Gran was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Granada
detail: Granada is notable as the capital world for the Umayyad Caliphate, invaders from beyond the stars who have bedeviled the native Nueva Castilians for centuries. Granada is their capital and serves as the base of operations for Umayyad operations in the area. It is also home to some light industry for the Umayyads.

name: Grand Base
detail: Grand Base is home to an Earthwerks Ltd. 'Mech production facility; the 2nd largest such factory in the Capellan Confederation. Warrior House Fujita defends this critical facility which produces Shadow Hawks, Stingers, and Cataphracts for the CCAF.

name: Granera
detail: Granera has not been strategically important since the Reunification War, when it was a supply depot for SLDF forces deployed against the Magistracy. It is a minor Marik colony world now, with a small but growing population.

name: Grankum
detail: Grankum was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Graus
detail: Graus is the innermost planet of the system, and has a notable dust ring. During the 2980s, the local government banned all heavy military equipment from the surface.

name: Gravenhage
detail: The failure of its Star League terraforming technology has caused much of its water to evaporate. Nonetheless, Gravenhage still hosts a sizable military presence and training facility. It is also a popular destination for LosTech prospectors.

name: Gravensteen
detail: Gravensteen was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Graz
detail: Graz was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Great Gorge
detail: Named originally after a massive canyon that spans the southern hemisphere, Great Gorge has flourished over the centuries as the ecology has adapted to Terran vegetation.

name: Great X
detail: Great X has two moons, Y and Z. It has spent most of it's history being a waypoint on the way to the front lines.

name: Greeley
detail: Most of Greeley is covered by arctic tundras. The planet's extreme axial tilt and small star ensure that it will always be cold.

name: Greenlaw
detail: The Greenlaw system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Protectorate of Donegal prior to the formation of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Green Stone (Clayborne 3025+)
detail: Until the Third Succession War the Clayborne system was known by the name Green Stone due to the vast jade deposits under the surface which were heavily mined.

name: Greifswald
detail: Greifswald is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Greypearl
detail: Greypearl was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Griffith
detail: The Griffith system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. It houses small but important weapons manufacturers which utilise the low temperatures to refine circuitry.

name: Grobin
detail: Grobin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gronholt
detail: Gronholt is an impoverished system, with little in the way of mineral wealth or resources.

name: Grootfontein
detail: Grootfontein was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Grossbach
detail: Grossbach is an impoverished system, with little in the way of mineral wealth or resources.

name: Grosvenor
detail: The Grosvenor system was colonized during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. It's capital city, Andreas, houses numerous bureacratic offices for nearby worlds.

name: Groveld
detail: Groveld III is an arid world, with short days. Notable terrain features on Groveld III include a desert named the Vashner Flats, a region surrounded by badlands, the ancient battlefield of the Viking Flats and the St. Adrian Plains.

name: Grumium
detail: Grumium is home to the Frihet Training Facility, which trains conventional forces and MechWarriors from nearby worlds. Grumium Creations is based here, a recent manufacturing consortium with many products.

name: Grunwald
detail: The Grunwald system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Protectorate of Donegal prior to the formation of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Gruyeres
detail: Gruyeres was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Guangzho
detail: Guangzho was settled during the Exodus from Terra by settlers from China.

name: Guatavita
detail: The Guatavita system was settled by the Lyran Commonwealth at some point during or shortly before the Age of War.

name: Guldra
detail: The ancestral home of House Madeira, Guldra is the most Earth-like planet in the entire Aurigan region, and is a major breadbasket for the area. Massive cities house a total population just over a billion, and exporting food has made Guldra an extremely wealthy, diverse, sophisticated world.

name: Gulkana
