detail: Gulkana has a single continent, Pangaea, and the majority of Gulkana's surface is barren, rocky, and devoid of native life due to its harsh, arid climate. It is home to Yeffters Weapons Factory.

name: Gunthar
detail: Gunthar is a pleasant world covered in water. The major cities are all built on the rocky coastlines of the single small continent; however, a spray of islands in a planet-girdling archipelago support a vast agricultural enterprise.

name: Gunzburg
detail: The Gunzburg system was settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. The planet is still recovering from damage from the First Succession War.

name: Gurgaldar
detail: Gurgaldar is located in the anti-spinward region of the Deep Periphery between the Vul Rift and the Eagle Cloud Complex.

name: Gurnet
detail: The Gurnet system was colonized at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Gurrnazovo
detail: The Gurrnazovo system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the United Hindu Collective prior to the Collective joining the Federated Suns.

name: Gustrell
detail: A heavily forested world, Gustrell offers agricultural produce to nearby worlds.

name: Gwynedd
detail: Gwynedd was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Gypsum
detail: The Gypsum system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Haappajarvi
detail: The Haappajarvi system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Hachiman
detail:
A system rich in resources and with a strong industry.
Its 3.6 billion inhabitants enjoy comparatively more freedoms than most Draconians do.
It's known for an excessive night life, its high crime rate & several high ranking Yakuza as overt chairmen.

name: Haddings
detail: Haddings was devastated by WMDs during the Amaris Civil War, to the point the planet disappeared off star charts. ComStar rediscovered it in 3028 and found it populated by small communities living at an approximately 17th century level of technology.

name: Hadnall
detail: The Hadnall system was colonised during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Haerhbin
detail: Haerhbin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Haggard
detail: Haggard was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hagiwawa
detail: The Hagiwawa system was colonised during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. It was a member of the Alliance of Galedon before joining the Draconis Combine.

name: Hahira
detail: The Hahira system was colonised during the Star League era at some time after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Hainfeld
detail: The Hainfeld system was colonised during the Star League era at some time after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Hakkaido
detail: Hakkaido was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Halesowen
detail: The Halesowen system was colonised during the Star League era at some time after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Halfway
detail: Halfway is best described as a barely-habitable rock. With only primitive, fern-like vegetation as the highest form of life, Halfway has largely been a stopover point for travelers for centuries.

name: Halgrim
detail: Halgrim was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Halifax
detail: Halifax was originally a part of the Timbuktu Province of the Rim Worlds Republic though was almost abandoned during the Republic-Commonwealth war. It is now used as a base of operation for exploration teams.

name: Halkidik
detail: Most of the population live an agricultural lifestyle maintained by technology of an equivalent to that found on Terra in the late eighteenth, a consequence of the heavy influence of the Omniss philosophy within the Compact

name: Hall
detail: Hall is a populous planet with a significant agricultural sector as well as a large light industrial base. Only recently lost by the Capellan Confederation, a battalion of Wolf's Dragoons currently makes up part of the planetary garrison. Hall joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Halla
detail: Halla was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Halloran
detail: A bleak and frozen world, Halloran has nonetheless hosted considerable mining and manufacturing industries since its colonization, exporting large quantities of ice, copper, and hydrocarbons to other worlds.

name: Halmyre Deans
detail: The Halmyre Deans system was colonised during the Star League era at some time after the end of the Reunification War. They are known for their multi million c-bill production line which exports Halmyre Beans to nearby worlds.

name: Halstead Station
detail: Halstead Station is a world settled exclusively for its vast mineral resources. The atmosphere is toxic, so the population lives in vast underground cities.

name: Hamal
detail: Hamal was originally colonised by settlers from the highland regions of South America on Terra. Hamal have passed from a Capellan to the Federated Suns during the Fourth Succession War. Most of the population live in a tribal, nomadic fashion.

name: Hamar
detail: Hamar was settled by the JàrnFòlk because of the large metal deposits and other raw materials located there. The mining communities are dependent on special equipment to generate a livable environment for the workers and on food produced by the farming communities found in the lowlands.

name: Hamburg
detail: Hamburg is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Hamilton (FWL)
detail: Hamilton was one of some fifty-one heavily contested worlds to have been placed under Terran Hegemony authority as a jointly-administered world during the Age of War or Star League era, and was almost wiped out during the First Succession War.

name: Hamilton (LC)
detail: The planetary capital city, Triergart, is located west of Lake Carivorn which is renown for it's boating tourism.

name: Hammer
detail: Most of Hammer is covered by arctic tundras. The planet's extreme axial tilt and small star ensure that it will always be cold.

name: Handa
detail: Handa is a favourite retirement spot thanks to it's warm climate and arable land.

name: Hanover
detail: Saxe-Heidelberg Heavy Industries and People's Protection form the industrial backbone of Hanover, which exports it's products across the Inner Sphere.

name: Hanseta
detail: Hanseta was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Harbin
detail: Harbin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hardcore
detail: Hardcore IV, the only inhabited planet in the system, has been a Magistracy member world since the Star League days. Throughout the Succession Wars, Hardcore developed a reputation as an entertainment world, hosting everything from ballet to blood sports, including BattleMech combat in a series of prepared arenas in the northern hemisphere.

name: Hardisey's Haven
detail: A singular continent makes up the landmass on this watery world, known for it's native Water Horse.

name: Harlez
detail: Harlez was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Harloc
detail: A minor world in the Capellan Confederation, Harloc's prosperity is limited by its reliance on food imports.

name: Harminous
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Harminous was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison who were experts in amphibious operations.

name: Harmony
detail: Harmony MetalWorks has recently acquired a repair and refit center from SelaSys Incorporated, and have begun to produce Mech parts.

name: Harpster
detail: The Harpster system was colonised during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Harrow's Sun
detail: Harrow's Sun is a developed world that has been invaded numerous times due to it's rich mineral wealth and fertile lands.

name: Harsefeld
detail: The Harsefield system was colonised during the Star League era, however lost much of it's technological base during the First Succession War, from which it is only just recovering.

name: Hartshill
detail: The Hartshill system was colonised at some point during or immediately prior to the Age of War.

name: Harvest
detail: The continent of Ohio is the location of most of Harvest's major cities and agricultural industries.

name: Hassad
detail: A water rich world, Hassad survived the First Succession War intact only to fall victim to seismic activity which caused massive tsunamis which reduced much of the settlement to rubble.

name: Hassi R'mel
detail: Hassi R'Mel was colonized during the formation of the Star League. The system is the primary stop for ships leaving the Draconis Rift in an area of space with few habitable worlds.

name: Hastur
detail: The wasteland planet of Hastur is primarily a prison world, with the major city, Lockdown, functioning as a city-sized penal colony. Prisoners provide slave labor for the planet's dangerous mining industry.

name: Haublan
detail: Haublan was once a failed colony world inside the borders of the Rim Worlds Republic, before being abandoned to it's own devices. Now the world is ruled by a council of the three powers left: Agricorp, the Hanju Imperium, and the Star Skulls pirate band. Haublan remains a relatively backwater system in the Isles though.

name: Havdhem
detail: Prisoners assigned to the harsh landscape of Havdhem tend not to complain for long. The average life span is measured in months.

name: Hawktor
detail: Hawktor was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hayakawa
detail: One of the most recently colonized worlds in the Mallard Republic, Hayakawa sits on the far edge of Republican space and is questionably habitable at best. The brutal cold and icy conditions have kept immigration low, leading to some questions about how large the population can actually grow.

name: Haynesville
detail: A large rocky planet with high gravity and a thin atmosphere. The atmosphere only extends about three miles above sea level, and many mountain tops are exposed to the vacuum of space.

name: Hazeldean
detail: Hazeldean was colonised at the start of the Star League era, thanks to it's abundance of arable land.

name: Hazelhurst
detail: The Hazelhurst system was colonized during or at some point prior to the Age of War, and prior to the Reunification War was a member of the Outworlds Alliance.

name: Hean
detail: The Hean system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra, and may have been one of the worlds rendered independent as a result of the Demarcation Declaration. Hean subsequently joined or was annexed by the Terran Hegemony prior to the Age of War.

name: Heart Fjord
detail: Heart Fjord was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Heathville
detail: Heathville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hecheng
detail: The Hecheng system was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Hechnar
detail: Hechnar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hednesford
detail: The Hednesford system was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Hegel
detail: Hegel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Heidelburg
detail: Heidelburg was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Heidrunn
detail: Heidrunn is located in the anti-spinward region of the Deep Periphery and at almost nineteen hundred light-years distant from Terra is one of the farthest-flung inhabited systems to have been identified by Interstellar Expeditions.

name: Heiligendreuz
detail: Was colonized during the Age of War by Lyran Commonwealth. The name seems to be a misspelling of Heiligenkreuz (German, roughly translates as "Saint's Cross").

name: Helbrent (Andiron 3025+)
detail: Originally known as the Helbrent system, the colony was annihilated during the Second Succession War. It was recolonised as the Andiron system a century later.

name: Helduza
detail: Helduza was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Helen
detail: Originally a wealthy world, the population of Helen was exterminated by Amaris forces during the Amaris Civil War. It has not recovered.

name: Heliat
detail: Heliat is a pleasant agricultural world, but also a backwater, thanks to its position away from all major trade routes. This relative isolation has led to an insular, conservative culture, centered around the local offshoot of Catholicism.

name: Heligoland
detail: The capital city of Helio is surrounded by verdant green hills, making it a popular world in brochures.

name: Helios
detail: Helios features diverse geological features and environments that makes the world capable of supporting a thriving population.

name: Helixmar
detail: Helixmar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Helland
detail: Helland was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hellespont
detail: Despite its location far from the Inner Sphere, Hellespont is a rich, high-tech manufacturing world. The headquarters of the ComStar Explorer Corps (Rimward) is located on the planet, and the infrastructure necessary for ComStar's operations has led to prosperity and investment.

name: Hellos Minor
detail: Hellos Minor orbits a large gas giant, and was colonised at the start of the Star League era, thanks to it's abundance of arable land.

name: Hell's Paradise
detail: Hell's Paradise was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Helm
detail: Helm was an SLDF logistical depot long time ago. Was known for being the site of the discovery of the Helm Memory Core in 3028 by the Gray Death Legion. The Memory Core triggered the technological renaissance of the mid-31st century.

name: Helsingfors
detail: The Helsingfors system was colonised during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. It was a member of the Alliance of Galedon before joining the Draconis Combine.

name: Helvetia
detail: Ninety percent of the population of Helvetia lives an agricultural lifestyle maintained by technology of an equivalent to that found on Terra in the late eighteenth century, a consequence of the heavy influence of the Omniss philosophy within the Compact.

name: Helvetica
detail: Helvetica was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hephzibah
detail: The Hephzibah system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Herat (FS)
detail: Herat (FS) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Herbania
detail: Herbania was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Here
detail: Here is home to a vast ancient catacomb system, due the millions of deaths during the Reunification War.

name: Hergazil
detail: Hergazil was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hermagor
detail: The Hermagor system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Herndon
detail: The Herndon system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Herotitus
detail: Herotitus is famed for its planet-wide pleasure industry; it is a sought-after vacation and recreational world. This hedonism exists side-by-side with the original agricultural colonists, who are largely puritanical and staid.

name: Herrmaz
detail: Herrmaz was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Herzberg
detail: Andrea County Armor Yards and Kaiser Systems both employ or contract with a large portion of Herzbergs population

name: Hesperus
detail: The Hesperus system is one of the most important manufacturing system in the Lyran Commonwealth. It has many production lines for battlemechs, including one of the last few in the Inner Sphere that can produce new Atlases for the ever expanding LCAF

name: Hexare
detail: The Herndon system was colonised during the Exodus from Terra, and was part of the Sian Commonwealth before joining the Capellan Confederation.

name: Hiberius
detail: Hiberius was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hibernia
detail: Most of the population of Hibernia lives an agricultural lifestyle maintained by technology of an equivalent to that found on Terra in the late eighteenth century, a consequence of the heavy influence of the Omniss philosophy within the Compact.

name: Hibuarius
detail: This lush forest world teems with diverse insect and plant life. Almost all this life, however, is highly toxic to humans, and the theocratic government has strict laws against entering the forest without protective gear.

name: Hickok
detail: The Hickok system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Highspire
detail: Highspire II - more commonly known simply as Highspire - is the second planet in the system and has a single moon named Peak.

name: Hildaman
detail: Hildaman was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hillerod
detail: The Herndon system was colonised during the Exodus from Terra, and was part of the Protectorate of Donegal before joining the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Himmels (Baltazar 2864+)
detail: Originally named Himmels, the colony was devastated during the First Succession War, leaving a scant population to survive for centuries. During the Third Succession War, it came under the dominion of the Circinus Federation.

name: Hinckley
detail: Those who have heard of Hinckley will often only know it for it's geothermal swamps, though it's therapeutic baths are meant to be some of the best in the Inner Sphere.

name: Hindmarsh
detail: Prior to the Fall of the Star League, Hindmarsh served as the homeport for the 7th Fleet (SLDF) of the Star League Navy. Many caches have been found over the centuries.

name: Hiratsuka
detail: The Hiratsuka system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and remains an important colony due it's exports of sulfur.

name: Hirtshals
detail: Hirtshals was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hivrannee
detail: The hot surface of Hivrannee requires all colonists to wear environmental suits when outside the colony enclosure, however it does allow easy access to rare chemicals.

name: Hobbs
detail: During the Succession Wars the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns used the caves on Hobbs as a giant warehouse for supplies and materiel, used to support units throughout the Capellan March. The native animals known as the Takooma viewed this as an intrusion into their habitat, and waged a guerilla war against the human intruders.

name: Hobson
detail: The Hobson system was colonised during or shortly before the Age of War, and had been incorporated into the Federated Suns by the beginning of the Reunification War.

name: Hódmezovásárhely
detail: Hódmezovásárhely was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hoensbroek
detail: Hoensbroek was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hoff
detail: Hoff, sometimes called 'The Hoff', developed advanced industry prior to the Succession Wars. Crippled during the Succession Wars, The Hoff then became the home of the Friden Aerospace Park, which developed prototype double heat sinks.

name: Hofn
detail: With all bar a twentieth of the surface of Hofn covered by water, the Jàrnfòlk who colonised the planet established subterranean settlements, away from the mighty storms that raged across the oceans.

name: Hohenems
detail: The Hohenems system was colonised during or shortly before the Age of War, and is an unremarkable world with calm weather and steady seasons ideal for agriculture.

name: Hollabrunn
detail: The world of Hollabrunn was re-colonized during the Star League era; originally having been colonized centuries earlier during the days of the Terran Alliance, the first colony was a casualty of the Age of War.

name: Holloway
detail: Holloway is home to the 2nd Battalion of Warrior House Fujita. Holloway is not an important world for raw materials or manufacturing, but it provides the Warrior House with an excellent base to conduct raiding operations against FedCom border worlds.

name: Holmsbu
detail: Colonists from the Federal Democratic Republics of Finland, Norway and Sweden emigrated in significant numbers to Holmsbu, and set up a colony based on their freedoms from Terra.

name: Holt
detail: Holt was one of some fifty-one heavily contested worlds to have been placed under Terran Hegemony authority as a jointly-administered world during the Age of War or Star League era.

name: Homam
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Homam was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Home
detail: "There is no such thing as a wrong opinion" is the slogan of Kira Place, a premium center for education located on Home.

name: Homestead
detail: The Homestead system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Capellan Hegemony prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation.

name: Hongor
detail: The Hongon system was colonised during the Star League era for it's easily accessible gemstone deposits.

name: Hongqiao
detail: Hongquio is notable for its steamy jungle environments, from natural boreholes located deep within the rainforests.

name: Hood
detail: The Hood system was colonised during the Star League era by the Rim Worlds Republic, until it was devastated during the Amaris Civil War. The recovery has been slow.

name: Hoonaar
detail: Following the discovery of rich gem and mineral deposits on Hoonar by teams from Gronholt, relations between the two worlds broke down substantially.

name: Randis IV
detail: A remote Periphery world, Randis IV was unremarkable until an order of warrior monks decided to call it home. Many pirates have since been driven offworld, and it looks as though stability may finally have arrived at last.

name: Hoplon
detail: Among the most inhospitible places in the region, Hoplon consists of a series of moons orbiting a great gas giant world. Each moon has been heavily fortified and is nearly crawling with robotic defenders, as though prepared for some great and terrible war that never came...

name: Horatius
detail: Home of Marian Arms Incorperated, Horatius serves as one of the major industrial centers of the Marian Hegemony. It is the birth place of the Ravager and Marauder Battlearmour.

name: Horgens
detail: Horgens is located in the rimward region of the Deep Periphery beyond the Perses-Cepherus Cloud Complex and the California Nebula, and has been identified by Interstellar Expeditions as the site for a possible colony.

name: Horneburg
detail: The Horneburg system was colonized during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Protectorate of Donegal, prior to the formation of the Lyran Commonwealth in the mid-twenty-fourth century.

name: Hornir's Keep
detail: Hornir's Keep was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Horsham
detail: Originally a Taurian world, Horsham boasted several Taurian Defense Force naval yards. During the Reunification War, Horsham was overrun by the SLDF, pacified, and taken by the Federated Suns. The total destruction of the naval yards was a crippling blow to the world's economy.

name: Hortense
detail: The Hortense system was colonised at some point during or shortly before the Age of War. It was once home to the Grandin family, who have since been ousted.

name: Hot Springs
detail: The world was noted for its mineral water and for having sizable portion of its people of Black American and African descent from later half of the 28th century. Tectonically active, the planet has two continents that are covered in active volcanoes.

name: Housekarle
detail: Housekarle is a moderately prosperous world in the Capellan Confederation. A safe distance from the FedCom border and the presence of a working Recharge Station have made it a popular stop for shipping in the Confederation.

name: Howick
detail: The Howick system was colonised during the Star League era due to the rich deposits of petroleum under it's oceans.

name: Howrah
detail: The Howrah system was colonised during the Star League era due to the rich deposits of petroleum under it's oceans.

name: Hoyleton
detail: Hoyleton is a successful agricultural world with a large temperate zone. Many ranches dot this zone where they are the center of a large processed meat industry, based on the Terran Buffalo and the native Hoyleton Forest Steer, that exported food to other star systems.

name: Hrafn
detail: Hrafn was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hsien
detail: Hsien was only recently integrated into the Federated Commonwealth, having been a Liao possession until 3029. It is heavily garrisoned in order to protect the significant mineral wealth of the planet. Hsien joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Huaide
detail: The Huaide system was colonised during the Star League era due to the rich deposits of rare gemstones found amidst it's turbulent volcanic band.

name: Huan
detail: Much of Huan's water was made toxic to human life by overmining, chemical dumping, and fallout from the Succession Wars, which is why the largest water-purification company in the Inner Sphere is headquartered here.

name: Hudeiba
detail: The icy surface of Hudeiba is home to numerous mining facilities, as well as a nascent snow sports industry.

name: Huesta
detail: Huesta was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Humansville
detail: The Humansville system was colonised at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Hunan
detail: Hunan is a large inhospitable mining colony which has earned itself the reputation for being possibly the last place in the Inner Sphere anyone would want to visit, let alone live.

name: Hun Ho
detail: Despite the industry present on Hun Ho, along with well over one and a half billion people, much of the planet remains a tropical paradise.

name: Hunter's Paradise
detail: Hunter's Paradise was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Huntington
detail: The Huntington system was colonised at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Hurgh
detail: Hurgh was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Hurik
detail: Hurik is a garden world, its steep valleys and broad plains home to over one billion inhabitants. As the gateway to the Aurigan Reach, it is a nexus for trade and exploration, and supplies food and manufactured goods to all its neighbors.

name: Huron
detail: The Huron system was colonised at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Hustaing
detail: Hustaing is the long-time home of the 1st McCarron's Armored Cavalry. While a mercenary command, the 'Big Mac' has served House Liao for years; first against the Federated Suns and now against the St. Ives Compact.

name: Hyalite
detail: Named after a Terran semi-precious stone, Hyalite was originally settled to gain access to chemical compounds and gemstones. Whilst the gemstone industry ran dry centuries ago, the chemical industry still remains strong with uses including munitions and propellant.

name: Hyde
detail: Zettle Metals Incorporated produces purified precious metals and industrial alloys for use in civilian, commercial and military industries from the rich metal mines on Hyde.

name: Hyner
detail: Luthien Armor Works operates a large facility on Hyner. The thick cloud cover makes orbital surveillance difficult.

name: Hyperion
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Hyperion was the host of a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Ibarra
detail: Massive herds of three-legged, brown beasts move across the planet in time with the seasons.

name: Ibstock
detail: Large homesteads cover the landscape of Ibstock, whilst the capital city of Torrick has a burgeoning textiles industry.

name: Icar
detail: The planet of Icar has most of its surface covered by water with two continents seperated by a vast channel.

name: Ichlangis
detail: Ichlangis is a Martian planet, with atmosphere too thin to breathe, no surface water, and temperature below freezing. The planet is rich in titanium, and the ores are made easily accessible by the deep chasms that crack the planet's surface.

name: Ichmandu
detail: Ichmandu was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ictus
detail: Ictus was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ideyld
detail: The Ideyld system was colonised at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Idlewind
detail: A quiet colony not far from the Periphery, Idlewind is a minor trading hub and a semi-popular base for independent Deep Periphery explorers.

name: Idrmarch
detail: Generally regarded as a pirate haven, Idrmarch was on the slow decline into death when it was saved by the arrival of a misjumped DropShip, the Pendragon, which claimed to have entered jump 5 centuries before arriving at Idrmarch. The truth of that story was never determined but the colonists saved the planet. Now, Idrmarch is known for its slaving and piracy, but is by all accounts thriving regardless.

name: Ife
detail: Ife was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Igualada
detail: Igualada has a circular orbit around it's primary, meaning seasonal and temperature variations are caused by the day/night cycle only.

name: Iijima
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Iijima was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Ikast
detail: The Ikast system was colonised at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Iknogoro
detail: The Iknogoro system was colonised during the Exodus from Terra. Now a thriving agrimarket world, it's history was much more grim with the Iknogoro Famine of the 2400s.

name: Ildlandet
detail: Ildlandet was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ilion
detail: Ilion was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Illium
detail: Illium was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Illiushin
detail: Illushin is famed for its cheeses; its two continents feature vast fertile grasslands on which a variety of herd animals can be grazed. Large coastal spaceport cities ship luxury foods off-world, as well as manufactured goods and military supplies.

name: Illyria
detail: The capital planet of the Illyrian Palatinate, for many years Illyria's inhabitants spent their time searching their world for Star League caches rumored to exist on the world. Though there were some modest discoveries, most of the world's economy was based on shipbuilding. During the Clan Invasion, many expatriates from the Free Rasalhague Republic settled on Illyria, taxing the Palatinate's resources somewhat as it tried to absorb them.

name: Ilmachna
detail: Ilmachna was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ilmar
detail: Ilmar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ilzra
detail: Ilzra is home to numerous rice wine vineyards, which are exported across the Inner Sphere.

name: Imalda
detail: The Imalda system was colonised at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Sian Commonwealth prior to the founding of the Capellan Confederation

name: Imbrial
detail: Was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra. Was liberated in 2804-05 during the first major AFFS counter-offensive of the First Succession War against the Draconis Combine.

name: Imbros
detail: A fairly cold world, Imbros is only important due to its strategic positioning within 2 jumps of Terra, the Draconis Combine, the Free Worlds League, and both halves of the Federated Commonwealth.

name: Immenstadt
detail: The Immenstadt system was colonised at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War. Cold for much of the year, it has a strong hydroponic industry.

name: Ina
detail: Ina was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Inarcs
detail: Inarcs had a most unusual founding when it was selected as a Star League penal colony world sight unseen, after a clerical error in the twenty-fourth century incorrectly classified the comfortable planet as uninhabitable. Nowadays, it is a thriving hub of activity.

name: Inchicore
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Inchicore was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Incukalns
detail: The Inculkalns system was colonised at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra due to it's rich mineral content.

name: Independence
detail: Independence is a lush world, dominated by vast oceans and jungle-covered volcanic islands. The plutocratic government runs the planet primarily for recreational tourists, with the inhabitants regulated by a strict caste system.

name: Indicass
detail: Indicass was settled by Ceres Metals Industries and the company invests a sizeable sum in ensuring the population is comfortable despite the planet's harsh climate. Ceres' plants on Indicass manufacture a variety of munitions and military vehicles.

name: Indrapurai
detail: Indrapurai was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ingenstrem
detail: The Ingenstrem system was colonised at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra.

name: Ingersoll
detail: Ingersoll is a very properous world, as not only is it widely believed to be the most beautiful in the entire Confederation but it also possesses large deposits of gold and silver ore.

name: Ingonish
detail: This bleak, rocky world was captured from the Capellans early in the First Succession War. The fierce fighting has left centuries-old ruins scattered around the surface, and scavengers still turn up valuable technology on occasion.

name: Ingress
detail: Ingress was one of the first worlds settled during the Terran Exodus. Its rich soil soon allowed the inhabitants to grow a great deal of food, far more than they needed. These crops remain the foundation of Ingress' economy, but the planet does have some light industry as well, making it totally self-sufficient. Ingress joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Ingvolstand
detail: The collapse of the Rim Worlds Republic led many worlds to a slow decline and death, Ingvolstand among them. That is, until the Hell's Queens pirate band arrived in 2802. The Queens rapidly took over and reshaped the world into a matriarchal society, the Helena Collective, based on their own structure. A trade agreement with Rondane led to great prosperity and Ingvolstand is one of the most powerful of the nations in the Chainelane Isles.

name: Inman
detail: The Inman system was colonised at some point prior to the end of the Age of War and known for it's native wildlife that tastes suspiciously like chicken.

name: Inner End
detail: The Inner End system was colonized during or at some point prior to the Age of War, and prior to the Reunification War was a member of the Outworlds Alliance.

name: Inner Surge
detail: Inner Surge was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Interstellar Expeditions Base #14
detail: This system is little more than a supply and operations base for Instellar Expeditions teams.

name: Interstellar Expeditions Base #22
detail: This system is little more than a supply and operations base for Instellar Expeditions teams.

name: Interstellar Expeditions Base #6
detail: This system is little more than a supply and operations base for Instellar Expeditions teams.

name: Iolas (Diedre's Den 3025+)
detail: Now known as Diedre's Den, the original colony of Iolas died out during the Second Succession War. It was reclaimed by colonists from the Circinus Federation, who found the abandoned colony still in working order.

name: Ionus
detail: Ionus has only one major continent, Ionus where the capital city Kargon is located. In orbit, the Illium Shipyards produce components vital for warship construction.

name: Ipava
detail: The Ipava system was colonised at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was one of the founding worlds of the Crucis Pact.

name: Ipswich
detail: The Ipava system was colonised shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was one of the founding worlds of the Sian Commonwealth.

name: Irece
detail: The planet Irece has three continents, Santana, Salvador and Baiano. It is also the home of a 9.7 kilometer tall mountain known as Tengoku, which reaches into the planet's stratosphere and is located a hundred kilometers from the world's capital city. Thanks to the Draconis Combine's alliance with the Nova Cats, Irece now serves as the capital world of Clan Nova Cat.

name: Irian
detail: Irian is a heavily industrialized world and for much of its history has been a local power. It is the headquarters of Irian BattleMechs Unlimited, a large interstellar coroporation.

name: Iron Land
detail: Iron Land was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Irurzun
detail: Irurzun contains a great deal of metal ores, gemstones, and radioactive materials, with New Samarkand Metals finding new deposits almost annually for centuries.

name: Isabela
detail: The Isabela system was colonised during the Star League era, beginning life as a mining colony.

name: Isesaki
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Isesaki was the headquarters world of the XXXV Corps (Star League) of the Star League Defense Force. It has been a trading post for centuries, with massive warehouses storing goods for dispersal to worlds across the Inner Sphere.

name: Isfahan
detail: Isfahan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ishtar
detail: The primary agricultural world of the Taurian Concordat, Ishtar was one of the earliest colonies in the region. It is totally undefended, and has no manufacturing or heavy industry, in an effort to make it less appealing to raiders. The entire population is engaged in food production.

name: Islamabad
detail: Once part of the United Hindu Collective, Islamabad's difficulty integrating into the Federated Suns has led to centuries of on-and-off religious tension and smoldering caste-based revolts.

name: Islington
detail: Ruled by the Humphrey Family the world of Islington is a water world that helps supply the millions of marian subjects with fresh fish. It also is the main training world for Marian Marines and terrestial naval personel.

name: Issaba
detail: Issaba was originally settled as part of the Finmark Province of the Rim Worlds Republic due to being extremely hospitable to human life.

name: Itabaiana
detail: Settled by the Terran New Habitat during the Exodus from Terra due to rich rhenium deposits, Itabaiana has an extremely agreeable climate.

name: Ito
detail: Settled towards the end of the Star League era, the rich fertile jungles of Ito allow for large exports to nearby worlds.

name: Itrom
detail: One of the four founding worlds of the Aurigan Coalition under the direction of House Gallas, Itrom is a jewel of the region, a pleasant Terran world with a population of over a billion. Centuries-old wars left a scar across the surface: a cratered radioactive wasteland that dominates the northern hemisphere.

name: Itsbur
detail: Itsbur is a frozen world, nearly uninhabitable, and as a consequence the Capellan government had a difficult time recruiting colonists. Terraforming efforts never made it past the early stages, and eventually the colony died out, with insufficient population growth.

name: Itzehoe
detail: Itzehoe was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Izar
detail: Izar is actually a binary system; the major star in the system is a blue-white B5 supergiant, which is orbited by a cool orange K0 star.

name: Izmir
detail: Izmir was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jaboatao
detail: The Jaboatao system was colonised at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra due to it's rich mineral content.

name: Jabuka
detail: The Jaboatao system was colonised at some point towards the end of the Star League era as successor states clamoured for resources.

name: Jacobabad
detail: Jacobabad was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jacomarle
detail: A hot, wet world with a dense atmosphere, Jacomarle has very little to attract conflict; the residents are farmers and fishers, and local industry produces consumer goods for nearby systems. Thus despite being one jump from the border, there are no real military threats.

name: Jacson
detail: Jacson is a lush, verdant world, dominated by an equatorial megaforest known as the Perpetual Forest. The massive boles make modern sensors useless, and overmatched military forces can retreat into its relative safety.

name: Jaipur
detail: Jaipur has long been an agricultural world that exports its products to nearby systems, though in recent years the ruling family has been attempting to industrialise.

name: Jaivardhan
detail: Named for the explorer that first marked the planet on a starmap, Jaivardhan is a quiet and unassuming backwater. Though it sports several military outposts, it's not clear what anyone would want from such a planet.

name: Jamestown
detail: One of the founding worlds of the Taurian Concordat, Jamestown is a peaceful, modestly prosperous world, with three continents and vast oceans. Once the site of a SLDF garrison, the planet still benefits from the high-tech industrial infrastructure.

name: Janina
detail: Janina was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jansen's Hold
detail: Jansen's Hold is a dry, cold world, dominated by windswept tundra in the temperate zones, and glacial mountains in the north and south. Heavily industrialized, the planet is a manufacturing center for a major arms manufacturer, Taurus Territorial Industries.

name: Jápminboddu
detail: Jápminboddu was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jardangal
detail: Jardangal was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jardine (Herakleion 2822+)
detail: Settled during the earler eras of space exploration, Jardine fell off of maps during the Succession Wars. ComStar kept access to the planet though and used it as a secret base of operations for clandestine efforts.

name: Jarett
detail: Alshain Weapons has a large manufacturing facility here. After the planet was attacked by the mysterious Minnesota Tribe after the Second Succession War, the company rigged the facility with explosives to ensure it can never be captured.

name: Jasmine
detail: Issaba was originally settled during the First Exodus from Terra due to it's largest continent being extremely hospitable to human life.

name: Jászberény
detail: Jászberény was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jatznik
detail: The Jatznik system was colonised at some point towards the end of the Star League era as successor states clamoured for resources.

name: Jaumegarde
detail: Settled in the golden age of the Star League, the rich fertile jungles of Jaumegarde allow for large exports to nearby worlds.

name: Java
detail: Java was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jeanette
detail: Jeanette Naval Yards produces submarine vehicles in a vast naval yard on the Tal'Dorei ocean. Their specializations in naval vehicles has created an expert workforce.

name: Jeju
detail: Jeju was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jenet
detail: Jenet was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jeppens
detail: Jeppens was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jerangle
detail: Jerangle was originally settled as part of the Finmark Province of the Rim Worlds Republic due to being extremely hospitable to human life, however the planet did sustain some ecological damage during the Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Jeronimo
detail: Settled in the golden age of the Star League, the rich fertile oasis of Jeronimo allow for large exports of foodstuffs to nearby worlds.

name: Jesenice
detail: Jesenice was originally settled as part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic due to it's easily accessible mineral deposits, however the facilities did sustain some damage during the Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Jesup
detail: A small, dry planet colonised purely because of the discovery of sizable veins of tin and silver. The entire population is involved in the small but significant mining industry, which is totally reliant on interstellar shipping for food.

name: Jezersko
detail: Settled in the golden age of the Star League, the rich fertile oasis of Jezersko allow for large exports of foodstuffs to nearby worlds.

name: Jiddah
detail: Jiddah was originally settled at the beginning of the golden age of the Star League due to it's easily accessible mineral deposits.

name: Jilin
detail: Jilin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Joan's Post
detail: Joan's Post was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but vanished from maps during the Second Succession War. However, it seems that a somewhat significant, if technologicaly backward, population remained on Joan's Post all this time.

name: Jodipur (Neukirchen 3025+)
detail: Neukirchen was originally named Jodipur, and was one of the three planets which formed the nucleus of the United Hindu Collective, along with Basantapur and Panpour.

name: Johnson
detail: Johnson was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but vanished from maps during the first several Succession Wars for unknown reasons. A minor population seems to have stayed behind, though not a notable one in any sense.

name: Johnsondale
detail: Wunderland Enterprises and Valiant Systems export military vehicles, communications systems and electronics from Johnsondale across the Inner Sphere.

name: Jonathan
detail: The statue of the horse of a Tikonov Grand Union general stands outside the city hall, a symbol of remembrance of the Tikonov massacres.

name: Jonzac
detail: Settled in the golden age of the Star League, the rich fertile oasis of Jonzac allow for large exports of foodstuffs to nearby worlds.

name: Joppa
detail: The colony of Joppa IV is located on Specula, the gas giant's largest moon, in the remains of an SLDF station. With no significant resources, the inhabitants of the moon have leveraged their position as a trade hub to survive.

name: Jordan Wais
detail: A core world of the Outworlds Alliance, it escaped most notice during Operation UNION HOLD. It's primary export is of a tabletop wargame where each player controls numerous BattleMechs in battles against each other. Designed for children, it has nevertheless gained a strong foothold amongst the older aristocracy.

name: Jordian Cluster
detail: The Jordian Cluster is a collection of stars within close proxity to each other.

name: Jorvikland
detail: Jorvikland was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Joshua
detail: Joshua was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Josselin
detail: Josselin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Jouques
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, it was originally part of the Federation of Oriente.

name: Joyz
detail: Settled in the golden age of the Star League, the rich ore fields of Joyz allow for large exports of minerals to nearby worlds.

name: Juazeiro
detail: The Juazeiro system was colonised during the Star League era, beginning life as a mining colony.

name: Jubka
detail: Jubka has been described as a "lucrative mining world" that is however vitally dependant on a lifeline of iceships supplied by Curtiss Hydrosystems.

name: Jump Point1
detail: This system contains near to nothing. It's whole purpose is to refill your jumpdrive.

detail: This system contains near to nothing. It's whole purpose is to refill your jumpdrive.

name: Junction
detail: Junction once held sway over several smaller worlds in the region centuries ago, before willingly joining the Draconis Combine for protection. Its importance has waned, but it still serves as a military depot and logistical hub.

name: June
detail: Michaelson Heavy Industries utilises the raw materials from the numerous mines to create components for VTOL, as well as having a secondary line for armour threading.

name: Jungar Qi
detail: Jungar Qi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Junior
detail: Settled during the golden age of the Star League, the rich ore fields of Junior allow for large exports of minerals to nearby worlds.

name: Juniper
detail: Juniper was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kabah
detail: When Kabah was first settled, there was a terrible hemorrhagic fever that scythed through the colony. The population slowly developed a resistance to it over the centuries.

name: Kaesong
detail: After suffering an attack from the Daemien's Destroyers mercenary unit during the First Succession War, the government is reluctant to hire mercenaries.

name: Kafr Silim
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the vast jade deposits under the surface are heavily mined.

name: Kagoshima
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Kagoshima was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison. It is the capital of the local prefecture.

name: Kaguyak
detail: The Kaguyak system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War.

name: Kaifeng
detail: Kaifeng is an agricultural world that exports its food surplus to feed a number nearby worlds, especially Sarna and Sakhalin.

name: Kaitangata
detail: Kaitangata is an impoverished system, with little in the way of mineral wealth or resources.

name: Kaiyuh
detail: The Kaiyuh system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the United Hindu Collective prior to the Collective joining the Federated Suns.

name: Kajikazawa
detail: Kajikazawa is a prefecture capital in the Benjamin Military District, and houses numerous luxury holiday homes for politicians and bureaucrats from Benjamin.

name: Kakada
detail: Kakada is an impoverished system, with little in the way of mineral wealth or resources. It's main source of income is the production of woodcrafts thanks to abundant lumber.

name: Kaldu
detail: Kaldu was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kalidasa
detail: Mercilessly hot and dry, Kalidasa is nonetheless a major industrial world, hosting large amounts of cross-border trade and a major Mech factory.

name: Kalmar (CC)
detail: Kalmar (CC) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kalmar (HL)
detail: Kalmar is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds. It is a mostly water world, with vast ship building facilities for boats.

name: Kamarod
detail: Broiling with discontent, the population of Kamarod is known for their rebel activities.

name: Kamenz
detail: Memorials to the 7th Bolan Defenders stand proud in many cities across Kamenz, an historic reminder of the end of the Star League.

name: Kampen
detail: Kampen is one of the worlds that form a part of the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds. It is an icy mining facility for the most part, but small manufacturers are setting up here in recent years.

name: Kanata
detail: Was the provincial capital of the Duchy of Andurien.  Have a few military schools including three of significant size. One of which - the Humphreys School of Warfare - was opened in 2762 and is pretty hi-tech.

name: Kandersteg
detail: Settled a few years before the formation of the Star League, the rich fertile oasis of Kandersteg allow for large exports of foodstuffs to nearby worlds.

name: Kandis
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the rich fertile mountains of Kandis allow for large exports of foodstuffs to nearby worlds.

name: Kannon
detail: Kannon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kanowit
detail: Lacking an atmosphere, barren Kanowit would have fallen off the maps of the Inner Sphere entirely if not for its impressive mineral riches, and the ease with which the Combine's prisoners extract them.

name: Kansu
detail: The small and frozen world of Kansu was only settled in the second half of the 24th century. The icy world's flora is unique in that it stores energy as frozen methane rather than as fat. Whilst now a source of power, the initial encounters were quite explosive.

name: Kanto
detail: Kanto was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Karachi
detail: The vast sulfur fields of Karachi leave the otherwise breathable atmosphere with a constant smell of rotten egg, ensuring visitors rarely stay for long periods of time.

name: Karakiraz
detail: Karakiraz is a relatively poor system, with little in the way of mineral wealth or resources. It's main source of income is the production of woodcrafts thanks to abundant lumber.

name: Karbala
detail: A tropical paradise known for it's rare gemstones, Karbala's aristocrats are some of the wealthiest in the Inner Sphere.

name: Karkkila
detail: Karkkila was originally a part of the Timbuktu Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Karlstejn
detail: Karlstejn was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Karpathos
detail: Most of the population of Karpathos lives an agricultural lifestyle maintained by technology of an equivalent to that found on Terra in the late eighteenth or early nineteenth century, a consequence of the heavy influence of the Omniss philosophy

name: Karston
detail: Settled during the golden age of the Star League, the rich mineral fields of Karston allow for large exports to nearby worlds.

name: Kasdach
detail: The Kasdach system was colonised shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was one of the founding worlds of the Sian Commonwealth. Despite constant volcanic activity, the soils remain infertile in many areas.

name: Kashilla
detail: Kashilla is an unremarkable tropical world within the Capellan Confederation near the border with the Free Worlds League. While it supports a large population, it lacks any major military, research, or manufacturing facilities.

name: Kathil
detail: Kathil itself was an insignificant planet with limited rare metal deposits until the Star League set up the James McKenna Shipyards in 2602.  While the Succession Wars effectively destroyed them, rumors are that the Feds have recently rebuilt them.

name: Katinka
detail: The SLDF facility on this world made it a prime target during the Periphery Uprising, and an orbital mass-driver strike left an enormous crater and a badly-disrupted ecosystem. The potential for scavenging LosTech continues to flood the system with prospectors and colonists.

name: Katla
detail: The constant vulcanism of Katla made it suitable for only a minor surveillance outpost. When that outpost was destroyed in a minor skirmish during the Third Succession War, not enough remained of it to make it viable to rebuild.

name: Katlehong
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the vast copper deposits of Katlehong have been heavily mined for centuries.

name: Kaufermann
detail: Kaufermann was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kaumberg
detail: Kaumberg was settled for it's vast mountain ranges and forest lands. Though mining would seem to be a logical industry for the world, most of Kaumberg's economy is based on the timber trade.

name: Kaus Australis
detail: Kaus Australis was only settled to take advantage of the mineral resources available in its crust, particularly Germanium. Without this vital metal, JumpShips cannot travel between the stars.

name: Kaus Borealis
detail: When it was originally settled, Kaus Borealis was a paradise of green plants, fresh water, and beautiful seasons. In the past 300 years, however, a series of volcanic eruptions and other geological events have spewed massive amounts of ash, methane, and sulfur into the atmosphere, tainting it.

name: Kaus Media
detail: Kaus Media had nearly everything the early colonists needed to make a successful colony: Foodstuffs, water, temperate climate. The only thing they lacked was any sort of easily accessed mineral resource to build industry. After discovering that Kaus Australis had the opposite problem, traders from Kaus Media rapidly established mutually-beneficial trade agreements that allowed both worlds to survive.

name: Kautokeino
detail: Kautokeino was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kawabe
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Kawabe was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Kawich
detail: Kawich's soil is spread across ten large island continents in shallow sea basins. The soil itself isn't good for agriculture, but it is packed with petroleum, minerals, and metal ores that are extremely valuable to manufacturers.

name: Kazanka
detail: For centuries Kazanka has been a major industrial and mining world that supplies Yttrium, an element used in the production of high-tech laser optics and crystals. A heavy Star League presence existed centuries ago, and many caches are still being found today.

name: Kazlam
detail: Kazlam is located in the anti-spinward region of the Deep Periphery, in a remote location anti-spinward of the Hanseatic League and coreward of Interstellar Expeditions Base 14.

name: Kaznejoy (Kaznejov)
detail: Kaznejov was a sun-baked world with modest ore deposits that prompted colonization in the early 24th century. Since then, the population has imported life-forms to make this world more habitable.

name: Kazu
detail: A barren expanse of sand and rock, Kazu was inhabited as recently as a century ago. The technology used to extract water from the limited subterranean aquifers was destroyed in the ending days of the Second Succession War, and the planet was abandoned to the sand.

name: Kearny
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the oceans of Kearny are filled with underwater volcanoes, which bring raw material to the surface.

name: Keeling
detail: In the final years of the Star League, Keeling served as the headquarters world for the XXVI Corps (Star League) of the Star League Defense Force. The main base on world was Fort Wittman, which is now the site of a ruined Castle Brian.

name: Keid
detail: A fertile, slightly colder Earth like world; Keid was one of the first planets settled outside the Sol system. Though its orbital shipyards were lost in the First Succession War, the planet's agrarian and industrial economies remain strong.

name: Keihoku
detail: The Keihoku system was colonised during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. It was a member of the Alliance of Galedon before joining the Draconis Combine.

name: Kek
detail: Kek was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kelang
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the oceans of Kelang teem with aquatic life, allowing for large exports of fishstuffs to nearby worlds.

name: Kelenfold
detail: The weak electromagnetic field around Kelenfold means that it's citizenry have some of the highest cancer rates in the Inner Sphere. Visitors are advised to wear sunscreen.

name: Kempten
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Kempten was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Kendall
detail: Natives of Kendall are some of the best-fed people in the League, and the combination of good nutrition and light gravity means that natives routinely reach seven feet in height.

name: Kenilworth
detail: Kenilworth was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kennard
detail: An agrarian world settled by the Outworlds Alliance, it was seized by the Star League in in 2582.

name: Kent
detail: Kent was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kentares
detail: This is the site of one of the largest war crime in history. The Kentares Massacre was a dark mark in the proud history of the DCMS, and it rallied the Davions to mount an invigorated defense that exemplifies the stalemate in the succession wars.

name: Kentwood
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the forests of Kentwood teem with native wildlife, allowing for large exports of protein to nearby worlds.

name: Kerman
detail: Kerman was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kern
detail: Once a highly-fortified military world, Kern's garrison, the 8th Sian Dragoons, was tasked with rapid response along the Rimward border. As the Third Succession War began, the armories and fortresses were shut down and demolished to prevent their potential capture.

name: Kervil
detail: Kervil's mineral rich surface is mostly covered with water, with multiple volcanic island chains scattered across the world. Numerous manufacturers exist on the planet including Wakazashi Enterprises.

name: Kesai (Kasai)
detail: Kesai IV is a barren and forbidding world. It was once home to a major Star League military depot, the remains of which have been fought over for centuries.

name: Kessel
detail: Kessel was a pristine world rich in minerals and metals and has always been a key manufacturing planet.  Since being captured by the Draconis Combine in 2866, poor environmental practices have tainted the atmosphere, and organised crime is rampant.

name: Kestrel
detail: Kestrel is a beautiful garden world with fertile plains and plentiful natural resources. The world's colonization and industrial expansion were planned wisely. Most of the heavy industry operates on Kestrel's two moons, which were terraformed into habitable worlds of their own.

name: Kettering
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the forests of Kettering teem with native fungi, allowing for large exports of fungal protein to nearby worlds.

name: Keuterville
detail: Keuterville is an impoverished system, with little in the way of mineral wealth or resources.

name: Keystone
detail: Keystone is a harsh world that was initially settled for its supply of minerals and other raw metals. The presence of these materials more than made up for the thin atmosphere and poisonous soil.

name: Keytesville
detail: Keytesville was one of the last wave of worlds colonised during the Exodus from Terra.

name: Khartoum
detail: The Khartoum system was colonized at some point during the reign of the Star League, and was host to a Star League garrison.

name: Khi
detail: Khi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Khon Kaen
detail: The Khon Kaen system was colonized at some point during the reign of the Star League

name: Kiamba
detail: The planet Kiamba is exceptionally large and hot, with three continents along the equator and extensive polar oceans. Between the continents, numerous island chains of volcanic origin exist.

name: Kiesen
detail: The Kiesen system was colonized at some point during the reign of the Star League

name: Kievanur
detail: Kievanur is a planet or system which was originally located within the Duchy of Orloff region of the Free Worlds League. Kievanur is between Vanra and Fuentes and vanished from maps during the 2nd Succession War.

name: Kigamboni
detail: The Kigamboni system was colonized during the Exodus from Terra.

name: Kikuyu
detail: Originally discovered shortly after the fall of the Terran Alliance, Kikuyu was first colonized on the more temperature archipelagos by New Zealanders, Australians, and Tasmanians.

name: Kilarney
detail: The Kilarney system was colonized at some point during the reign of the Star League.

name: Kilbourne
detail: Kilbourne is one of the few Outback worlds of the Federated Commonwealth to have a military academy, which is located within one hundred kilometers of a small series of volcanoes, allowing the cadets to train in harsh conditions.

name: Killarney
detail: The Killarney system was colonized at some point during the reign of the Star League.

name: Killbourn
detail: Killbourn was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kilmarnock
detail: The Kilmarnock system was colonised during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. It was a member of the Alliance of Galedon before joining the Draconis Combine.

name: Kimball
detail: First settled by a colonists supported by a wealthy twenty-first century industrial magnate interested in the mineral resources available on the world and in it's asteroid belt, Kimball II offered an ecosystem with abundant free water and support for Terran crops.

name: Kimi
detail: The presence of two habitable worlds in this system, one arctic and one tropical, make it a rarity. Both are ruled by a theocracy, the New Salvationist Order, that preserves the ruins of SLDF bases in-system as religious shrines.

name: Kingtribel
detail: Kingtribel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kinkaid
detail: The Kinkaid system was colonized by the Outworlds Alliance at some point during the reign of the Star League.

name: Kirbyville
detail: When colonised in the last years of the Star League, the world of Kirbyville was in the middle of a global ice age.

name: Kirchbach
detail: Kirchbach has few natural resources, but does possess plenty of arable land to allow the population to feed themselves.

name: Kirei Na Niwa
detail: Kirei Na Niwa ("Beautiful Garden") is a world whose economy is largely based on agriculture. The broad plains and fertile soil allow many crops to be grown here year round.

name: Kirkcaldy
detail: Ninety percent of Kirkcaldy is owned by a single corporation, Baker Pharmaceuticals. Kirkcaldy is relatively free of pollution, with the bulk of the manufacturing activity going on in areas of Liska, while the continent of Arcas tended to be home to managerial or creative efforts.

name: Kirkenlaard
detail: Settled in the Exodus from Terra, it was part of the Marik Republic before joining the Free Worlds League

name: Kirklin
detail: Kirklin is an industrialised world with Kallon Industries and it's subsidiaries making up much of the workforce.

name: Kirkvåg (Toch Zu 2822+)
detail: Kirkvåg (Toch Zu 2822+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kiruna
detail: Kiruna was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kiserian
detail: Settled at the dawn of the Star League, Kiserian is a world with a harsh climate.

name: Kitalpha
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Kitalpha was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Kitopler
detail: Kitopler was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kittery
detail: When initially colonised, Kittery was known as an inhospitable jungle world. Civilization finds a way however, and the rich deposits under the surface have allowed vast cities to spring up all across the world.

name: Kitzingen
detail: Inhabited since the Exodus from Terra, the colony was impoverished until the discovery of radioactives under the surface which revitalised the economy.

name: Kiyev
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, the initial colony remained independent for centuries before joining the Free Worlds League in the Star League era.

name: Ki Zoban
detail: Ki Zoban was a core industrial planet within the Outworlds Alliance until it was utterly destroyed and abandoned during the Second Succession War.

name: Kladnitsa
detail: The Kladnitsa system was either settled by the Rim Worlds Republic at some point during or shortly before the Age of War.

name: Klathan (Klathandu)
detail: Klathandu IV is a sparsely populated world in the Klathan system with little arable land or industry, described as arid and marginally habitable. The infrastructure of the world is very fragile.

name: Klayne
detail: Klayne was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kleinwelt
detail: Kleinwelt was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Klenkar
detail: Klenkar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kluane
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, the initial colony remained independent for decades before joining the Federated Suns.

name: Knechee
detail: According to the latest Interstellar Expeditions maps, Knechee is located in the rimward region of the Deep Periphery, close to the Perses-Cepherus Cloud Complex.

name: Knox
detail: A heavily fortified planet, Knox has served as the headquarters for the Mallard Republic Armed Forces for centuries. Many battles have been fought here but the MRAF have held their ground every time, leading to Knox's reputation as an unassailable fortress.

name: Knutdor
detail: Knutdor was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Knutstad
detail: Knutstad was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ko
detail: Ko is possessed of great swathes of arable land and thus primarily exports foodstuffs. It was recently conquered by the Lyran Alliance and the local Kuritan garrison put up only token resistance.

name: Kobe
detail: A once hospitable world, the original colonies were destroyed when massive volcanic activity decimated the world turning it into an arctic wasteland. The rich material brought to the surface makes Kobe a major producer of electronics and chemical engines.

name: Kochab
detail: Kochab is a seismically active arid world. Largely ignored, the Lyran Commonwealth has not invested much money into the system.

name: Kockengen
detail: Low G martian world with a couple of bases. Pretty nothing to do in here, commander.

name: Köln (FWL)
detail: Köln (FWL) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Köln (HL)
detail: Köln is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Köningsberg
detail: Köningsberg is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds. It is a rocky, but hospitable planet.

name: Kogl
detail: Settled during the Star League era, Kogl is an unremarkable world.

name: Kohlman
detail: Kohlman was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kokpekty
detail: Settled during the Star League era by the Draconis Combine.

name: Kola
detail: Kola was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kolobrzeg
detail: Kolobrzeg was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kolovraty
