detail: Kolovraty was a part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Komephoros
detail: Komephoros was settled by colonists looking to take advantage of the vast mineral resources they suspected were underneath the glaciers of this frozen world. The first wave of settlers vanished without a trace however, when decades later their dropships were discovered under one of the massive glaciers frozen within ice.

name: Koniz
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Koniz served as the headquarters of the II Corps (Star League).

name: Konopiste
detail: Konopiste was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Konstance
detail: Konstance is known for its Carbon Dioxide rich atmosphere, which forces its population to rely on CO2 scrubbers to sustain life on the planet.

name: Kooken's Pleasure Pit
detail: Named after a fictional womanizer's mansion, Kooken's Pleasure Pit is a small planet with a pleasant climate and a thriving set of "pleasure industries".

name: Koping Chian
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, the initial colony remained independent for decades before being annexed into the Draconis Combine.

name: Korramabad
detail: Korramabad has a punishingly hot climate and is dominated by open plains and sandy deserts; only the hardiest souls can tolerate living on the planet.

name: Korvitz
detail: Korvitz was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kosciusko
detail: Settled during the Star League era by the Free Worlds League, Kosciusko has abundant native Kodiak bear like animals that act like herd creatures.

name: Koskenkorva
detail: Koskenkorva was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kossandra's Memory
detail: Originally little more than a military outpost for the Magistracy, Kossandra's Memory has since grown into a sparsely populated but prosperous world rich in natural resources.

name: Kostinbrod
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era, Kostinbrod was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison

name: Kotzebue
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns before the Star League era, the planet of Kotzebue is known for it's breweries.

name: Koulen
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era, Koulen is known for it's lax intoxication laws.

name: Koumi
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, the initial colony remained independent for over a century before being annexed into the Draconis Combine.

name: Kountze
detail: A harsh world, the capital city of Kountze is known for its powerful tropical cyclones. The local apex predator is known as the Arctic Terror.

name: Koury
detail: Koury was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kowloon
detail: Kowloon was a part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Krakatau
detail: Krakatau was an early mining and industrial colony, but heavy pollution poisoned the air and heated up the climate to uninhabitability. By the fall of the Star League, the colony was importing all its food, and stopped being economically viable.

name: Kreller
detail: Kreller was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Krenice
detail: A lightly industrialised world, Alshain Weapons does maintain a small repair facility on the surface.

name: Krievci
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era, Krievci is known for it's raw fish delicacies.

name: Krimari
detail: Krimari III and its moon Names were the site of some of the bloodiest battles in the Magistracy during the Periphery Uprising. As the failing Star League shifted its forces outward in the 28th century, the staunch Magistracy partisians of Krimari turned it into a killing field. No other power has dared invade it since.

name: Krin
detail: Krin is a prosperous world along the Capellan/League border. The 4th Tau Ceti Lancers have recently been redeployed to the world to recover after suffering significant losses against House Davion forces over the last decade.

name: Kristiandsund
detail: Kristiandsund was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Krung Thep
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era, Krung Thep is known for it's street food.

name: Kublenz
detail: Kublenz was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kufstein
detail: Settled as an science outpost as part of the Principality of Rasalhague, it remained sparsely populated until the Star League era where upon a proper colony was established.

name: Kujari
detail: Settled by the Free World League during the Star League era, Kujari is known for it's narcotic plantlife.

name: Kumqwat
detail: Kumqwat was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kupang (CC)
detail: Kupang (CC) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kupang (RW)
detail: Kupang (RW) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Kurhah
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, the initial colony remained independent for over a century before being annexed into the Draconis Combine.

name: Kurragin
detail: During the era of the Terran Alliance, Ares was one of the founding members of the Capellan Co-Prosperity Sphere negotiated by the Capellan ruler Jurdan Aris between 2220 and 2225. In exchange for the continued free and open exchange of information with Capella, Kurragin and the other nations of the pact - which included Ares and Bandora - would come to the defense of Capella if it found itself under attack from hostile parties.

name: Kurvasa
detail: Colonized during the Second Exodus, Kurvasa accepted refugees from across Capellan space. Its canyon-cities are sprawling and riotous with different cultures and traditions, and farming on the fertile mud-flats supports all 700 million residents.

name: Kutludugun
detail: Settled at the start of the Star League era, Kutludugun is known for it's raw fish and sugared potato delicacies.

name: Kuzuu
detail: Recent investments in Kuzuu have modernised many of the old buildings and the population has swelled due to mass immigration from nearby worlds.

name: Kvistgard
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth in the early years of the Star League, Kvistgard is a world rich with nitrates.

name: Kwamashu
detail: Many of the industrial areas on Kwamashu are powered by the highly unstable radioactives that are found in the planet's crust.

name: Kwangchowwang
detail: Kwangchowwang was a part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Kwangjong-ni
detail: Defiance Industries is the sole major exporter on Kwangjong-ni, utilising salvaged machinery from an underwater facility that was destroyed during the Amaris Civil War.

name: Kyeinnisan
detail: Kyeinnisan is better known as the Gambler's World. Within the many lavish, smoke filled casinos and gambling halls, every game of chance known to man can be found as well those willing to bet it all for a chance at wealth.

name: Kyrkbacken
detail: During the Star League era, Kyrkbacken was a heavily industrialised world. Unfortunately during the Second Succession War, it was devastated and now has reverted to a mostly agrarian economy.

name: La Blon
detail: La Blon is primarily a water world, with popular beach resorts on the 3 island landmasses on its surface. One of its moons, Ivanov, also supports a large mining operation. La Blon saw a great deal of fighting during the 3020's.

name: Labouchere
detail: Labouchere was settled during the golden age of the Star League, becoming self sufficient within decades.

name: Labrea
detail: Labrea was settled during the golden age of the Star League, becoming self sufficient within decades.

name: Lacadon
detail: Lacadon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lackhove
detail: Lackhove was one of seven worlds settled by colonists from the Rim Worlds Republic between 2334 and 2338 as an attempt by Maxwell Rowe to create a buffer zone between the Republic, the Draconis Combine and the Tamar Pact.

name: Lackland
detail: Lackland is almost entirely oceanic apart from a few archipelagoes. The local population finds life on this quiet planet idyllic, despite the chronic inability of any industry to turn a profit.

name: Laconis
detail: Laconis is a cold, watery world, and between the chilly temperatures and the annual hurricane season, most of the 75 million inhabitants live below-ground. Taurus Majoris Mining is the world's largest employer, but many other smaller industrial firms have relocated to the prosperous world.

name: La Grave
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, the initial colony remained part of the Tamar Pact for decades before joining the Commonwealth.

name: Lahti
detail: Lahti was settled during the golden age of the Star League, becoming self sufficient within decades.

name: Laiaka
detail: Laiaka's atmosphere requires some basic filtration systems in order to be breathed by humans, but its vast oceans are teeming with life. Most of the planet's population are thus fishermen and kelp farmers and provide food to other nearby worlds.

name: La Ligua
detail: La Ligua was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lamar
detail: Lamar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lambrecht
detail: Large earthquakes caused by Lambrecht's sun were ironically the reason for the heavy fortification of the world. Castle Brian's inner cores were designed with this level of seismic activity in mind, contributing to their sturdiness.

name: Lamon
detail: Labrea was settled towards the end of the Exodus from Terra, but did not become self sufficient until the Star League era.

name: Lamu (Tunlmar 2822+)
detail: Lamu (Tunlmar 2822+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lancaster (FWL)
detail: Originally settled as part of the Marik Commonwealth, it became a garden world amidst the Free Worlds League.

name: Lancaster (LC)
detail: The first colony of Lancaster was founded by Scots-Irish refugees fleeing from the war between the Stewart Confederation and the Free Worlds League in 2305. Unfortunately for the colonists, they were forced to relocate to the world of Loxley.

name: Lande
detail: Lande was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Landfall
detail: The Landfall system was colonized at some point during the reign of the Star League.

name: Landmark
detail: The surface of Landmark is largely barren rock outside of the sheltered coastal valleys. This is due to the constant, planet-encircling windstorm scouring higher elevations. As a result, the planet is notably secure, and many industrial concerns conduct secret research there.

name: Landrum
detail: According to the latest Interstellar Expeditions maps, Landrum is located in the anti-spinward region of the Deep Periphery between the Vul Rift and the Cygnus Loop.

name: Land's End
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Land's End served as the base of operations for the 310th Dragoon Regiment of the Star League Defense Force. It is quite desolate on the Periphery of known space.

name: Langhorne
detail: Langhorne was originally a part of the Timbuktu Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Laong
detail: Laong was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lapida II
detail: Lapida II was settled for its vast mineral wealth. The centuries of removing and refining those minerals and ores, combined with the lax environmental protection mandated by the Combine government, have created a nearly toxic atmosphere. Despite this the world remains a major manufacturing world with industrial complexes that create a variety of military and civilian equipment.

name: Larned
detail: The Landfall system was colonized at some point towards the end of the Exodus from Terra. Much of it's industry was destroyed during the First Succession War.

name: Larsha
detail: Larsha is a linchpin of Capellan control over the Rimward portion of the Sian Commonality. Over a billion inhabitants call the pleasant Terran world home, living in four major metropolises, and they're defended by a 'Mech battalion headquartered in the planet's extensive fortifications.

name: Last Chance
detail: The Last Chance system was settled by the Rim Worlds Republic during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. It's name refers to two previously failed expeditions to the system.

name: Last Frontier
detail: Prisoners were forced to create the infrastructure for the colony on Last Frontier for the Draconis Combine during the Star League era.

name: Lastpost
detail: The heavy jungles of Lastpost are filled with rare fauna and flora, much of which is used in the planets burgeoning pharmaceutical industry.

name: Las Tunas
detail: Las Tunas was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Latexo
detail: An unremarkable world, it was used as a logistics base by the II Corps of the Star League Defence Force during Operation Union Hold.

name: Latice
detail: Settled by colonists from the Sian Commonwealth, it was annexed into the Capellan Confederation centuries ago.

name: Launam
detail: Settled by refugees during the Age of War, Launam is a mostly pacifistic society.

name: Laureles
detail: A pirates love this place, so be careful. Local militia is a garbage too. A wild place, I would say.

name: Laurent
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era.

name: Laurieston
detail: Originally part of the Federation of Skye, it became part of the Lyran Commonwealth when it formed.

name: Layover
detail: Layover is a rich world with a toxic atmosphere that is also site of numerous Star League era manufacturers, such as Kallon Weapon Industries, Quikscell Company and Kodiak Incorporated.

name: Leamington
detail: Leamington was a self sufficient independent world for centuries before joining the Federated Suns.

name: Le Blanc
detail: Basically a giant rock in space, Le Blanc was settled by miners looking for mineral wealth. Just barely enough atmosphere existed to allow the miners to breathe without a respirator.

name: Lee
detail: The first colony on Lee was founded by settlers from New Macao, and Lee was a member of the Capellan Hegemony during the four decades the Hegemony existed.

name: Leganes
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era due to rich crystalline deposits.

name: Leh
detail: Leh was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Leipsic
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era due to rich nitrate deposits.

name: Leiston
detail: Leiston was an independent colony before being annexed by the Draconis Combine in the Age of War.

name: Lemnos
detail: The population of Lemnos lives an agricultural lifestyle maintained by technology of an equivalent to that found on Terra in the late eighteenth or early nineteenth century, a consequence of the heavy influence of the Omniss philosophy within the Compact

name: Lengkong
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era due to rich nitrate deposits.

name: Leoben
detail: Prisoners were forced to create the infrastructure for the colony on Leoben for the Draconis Combine during the Star League era.

name: León
detail: León is a mineral rich cool world that has changed hands often over the centuries, shifting from the Castilians to the Umayyads and then back to the Castilians some years later. Today, it rests in Castilian hands.

name: Lepaterique
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era due to rich crystalline deposits.

name: Lesalles
detail: The jungles of Lesalles are renowned for the size of their trees where their average height is measured around 150 meters. It is in and within these jungles that the Lesallian Mailsloth is found.

name: Les Halles
detail: Settled only for it's galactic location, Les Halles is a frozen world that acts as a waypoint for nearby worlds. Only a narrow strip of land around the equator is free of ice, while the rest of the world is covered in glaciers.

name: Leskovik
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era due to an abundance of arable land.

name: Lesnovo
detail: Lesnovo is part of the Rim Commonality, a small power bloc in the Free Worlds League. It's soils are relatively weak, but the world produces enough to feed it's billions of souls.

name: Leviathans Rest
detail: Leviathans Rest is located in the rimward region of the Deep Periphery beyond the Perses-Cepherus Cloud Complex and is one of the most distant systems from Terra to have been identified by Interstellar Expeditions.

name: Leximon
detail: Alphard Trading Corporation has a small manufacturing and repair facility on the icy world Leximon which is supplemented by Lothian light industry base.

name: Lexington
detail: Lexington served as the headquarters of the entire XXXIII Corps (Star League) during the final years of the Star League. There were also massive supply dumps storing material for the SLDF as well as a SLDF fort, Fort Ballycastle, built in the center of a vast forest made up of imported Terran trees.

name: Leyda
detail: One of the founding worlds of the Capellan Confederation, Leyda served as a SLDF supply depot during the Reunification War. A pleasant water world with several major cities, it is a favored vacation spot for the wealthy and noble.

name: Leyland
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era due to rich crystalline deposits.

name: Lhasa
detail: Lhasa was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Liezen
detail: Despite supporting sizable forests in its higher elevations, Liezen must periodically import water from offworld to feed its agricultural lowlands. It is otherwise an unremarkable world.

name: Lihue
detail: Home to the Bashir College of Literature, the world of Lihue produces some of the finest authors in the Federated Suns.

name: Lima
detail: The capital city of Lima, Decatur, bears the architecture of both the Combine and Federated Suns due the world changing hands many times over it's history.

name: Lindassa
detail: The frosty climate of Lindassa is inhospitable without specialist survival gear. Much of the population resides in the cities.

name: Linden
detail: Linden was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lindenmarle
detail: When the Inner Sphere remembers Lindenmarle at all, they think only of the bloody delaying action fought to hold back the SLDF invasion during the 26th century Reunification War. Despite being outnumbered three to one, the 1st and 2nd Canopian Light Horse held off the invasion for months before attrition took its toll and they were forced to withdraw. Little has been heard from planet in the half a millennia since, and the inhabitants prefer it that way.

name: Lindsay
detail: Lindsay is a hot, damp world with a thick continuous cloud layer fed by a ring of volcanic activity that nearly encircles the planet. Local farmers take maximal advantage of the short dry season to plant and harvest; in the rainy season, extensive flooding restores the rich, fertile soil.

name: Ling
detail: Ling was the site of the famous Deep Raid of 2987 by Lyran Commonwealth forces. This raid destroyed a new BattleMech production facility that was being built on the world.

name: Linneus
detail: Settled in the years leading up to the formation of the Star League by the Federated Suns, Linneus is known for it's silicon manufacturies.

name: Linqing
detail: Settled in the years leading up to the formation of the Star League by the Draconis Combine, Linqing is known for it's silicon manufacturies.

name: Lintz
detail: Lintz was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lipton
detail: Lipton is a moderately prosperous world that acts as a trade hub for traffic between the two halves of the newly formed Federated Commonwealth and the Free Worlds League.

name: Listowel
detail: Listowel was devastated during the Second Succession War, leaving many cities devastated over the planet centuries later.

name: Liu's Memory
detail: This ice-locked world is pierced by deep, man-made boreholes that allow geothermal heat and power to escape from the core, sustaining a bustling mining and manufacturing industry in the temperate zones created around the holes.

name: Ljugarn
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Ljugarn was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Loburg
detail: Loburg is heavily settled, but most of its natural resources come from the second planet in the system. Named Hiburg, this planet possesses no atmosphere and crushing gravity. Despite this, workers spend several weeks there mining resources before transferring back to Loburg.

name: Lochmantle
detail: Lochmantle, a swampy world, was made habitable by massive pumping stations that reclaimed fertile, viable land from the muck. During the Second Succession War, those pumping stations were destroyed, and the colony is now slowly sinking.

name: Lockdale
detail: Lockdale was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lockton
detail: Lockton is an inhospitable world, naturally parched and relying heavily on water imports from Oasis, one of its moons. The capital city, Helios, holds 97% of the planet's population.

name: Loeches
detail: Loeches Trade School is one of the business schools, offering practical uses rather than academic courses in business and marketing. It's Phillip Cowin Campus is renown for it's alumni being some of the wealthiest in the Free Worlds League.

name: Logandale
detail: Settled by colonists from Celtic nations during the Exodus from Terra, it remained independent for over a century before joining the Federated Suns.

name: Logan Prime
detail: The Logan Prime system was colonised during the First Succession War by refugees fleeing the conflict.

name: Logan's Land
detail: Settled by eccentric billionaire Euan Logan, Logan's Land was originally a hedonistic paradise.

name: Logres
detail: Logres was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Loikaw
detail: Loikaw was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lokoja
detail: Lokoja was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lombardo
detail: One of the most fortified places in Haven space, Lombardo is the home of the Jacobson Haven militias. Each family maintains a compound on Lombardo and trains their milita forces here in mock battle with one another. The mock battles provide heavy prestige to the winner and so competition between the families is fierce here.

name: Lonaconing
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine  Star League era due to rich crystalline deposits.

name: Lone Star
detail: Lone Star was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Loongana
detail: Loongana is a relatively uninteresting world with a thin atmosphere.

name: Loparri
detail: Loparri is a core world within the Outworlds Alliance. When Operation UNION HOLD began in 2581, it was the third world to be hit by SLDF forces, with countless civilians massacred.

name: Lopez
detail: The desert world of Lopez is an unlikely colony; however, it is the only planet on which the banth, a flying reptile very similar to Terran legends of dragons, can be found. Care, training, and conservation of these dragons forms the foundation of the planet's economy.

name: Lordinax
detail: The icy world of Lordinax is rumoured to have entire mountains made of iron.

name: Loric
detail: A self sufficient world with a burgeoning mining industry. It's nearby asteroid field is full of mineral rich asteroids.

name: Lorkdal
detail: The second planet in the badlands cluster that was colonised briefly by the Taurean Concordant.  Due to limited resources and a generally hostile environment led to the planet being abandoned.  Now it's a haven for pirates.

name: Lost
detail: Lost was originally a part of the Finmark Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Lothair
detail: Kept hidden for over a century by the Taurian Concordat, Lothair first appeared on interstellar maps shortly before the Reunification War, but by that point was already a heavily-populated world with a rapidly growing industrial base.

name: Lothan
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth, it has changed hands multiple times over the years.

name: Lothario
detail: An icy, harsh world, Lothario is home to a number of dangerous species including predators that were born at the same size as an adult Kodiak bear.

name: Lovinac
detail: The Lovinac system was a treasure trove of Star League buildings when it was reclaimed in 2784, which spurred architectural development on numerous worlds.

name: Loxley
detail: Loxley is the site of major manufacturing facilities belonging to Norse-Storm Technologies Incorporated and Blue Shot Weapons.

name: Loyalty
detail: The Fidelity Space complex in orbit of this arid world is the sole employer for many of the skilled workers on Loyalty.

name: Loysville
detail: Loysville is a temperate, pleasant world largely populated by fishers, farmers and those working in the tourist industry.

name: Luanda
detail: Luanda was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lucerne
detail: Settled by colonists from the Isles nations during the Exodus from Terra, it remained independent for over a century before joining the Federated Suns.

name: Lucianca
detail: One of the earliest worlds in the Terran Alliance, it was the site of a massacre during 2244 which caused a mass depopulation until the dawn of the Star League.

name: Lucknow
detail: Lucknow's mining facilities, buried deep in the glacial ice that covers the planet, were lost when the geothermal power plants stopped working, and no parts or technicians were available to restore them.

name: Luderitz
detail: Luderitz was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ludwig
detail: Turanian Transport Company, a planetary freight and passenger shipping company, has a large office here on Ludwig due to the abundant radioactive material mining industry.

name: Ludwigshafen
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era due to rich mineral deposits.

name: Lübeck
detail: Lubeck is one of the worlds that forms part ofthe Hanseatic League. There are two worlds in this system, Quarantine, and Lubeck - Quarantine is used as a customs holding point before allowing access to Lubeck.

name: Lukla
detail: Lukla was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lummatii
detail: An arctic world that was settled by the Lothian League as refugees fled the First Succession War.

name: Lungdo
detail: Settled by colonists from the British Isles during the Exodus from Terra, it remained independent for over a century before joining the Free Worlds League.

name: Lurgatan
detail: Lurgatan was once a mining colony, with deep-core boreholes to reach the fissile minerals under the crust. The cost of maintaining the colony in the thin, cold atmosphere was eventually too much for the value of the minerals, and the world is mostly abandoned.

name: Lushann
detail: Lushann has a semi-arctic global climate, but due to its former geologic past, it enjoys an abundance of oil deposits, of which the planet's primary industry.

name: Lushun (Jibbet 3130+)
detail: Lushun (Jibbet 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Luthien
detail: Luthien, as well as being the capital of the Draconis Combine, is the state's largest industrial world, with large tracts of land devoted to huge industrial complexes.

name: Luxani
detail: Luxani was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Luxen
detail: Luxen is one of the few worlds lucky enough to have escaped the horrors of the Succession Wars completely unscathed. It is home to Canopian Medical Sciences Research and Training Complex, which produces the lion's share of the Magistracy's skilled medical personnel, as well as major deposits of gemstones and precious metals on the southern continent.

name: Luzerne
detail: Luzerne became a favored spot for those in the Draconis Combine looking to escape the ravages of warfare that have plagued the Inner Sphere for millennia.

name: Lyceum
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the early years of the Star League.

name: Lynchburg
detail: Lynchburg was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Lyndon
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era.

name: Lynn
detail: Lynn is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Lyons
detail: Lyons is a volcanic world that supports a significant agricultural industry. The planet briefly was home to a base for the famous Kell Hounds mercenary company, but is now protected by the 17th Donegal Guards RCT.

name: Lyreton
detail: This former Capellan colony is spread across three tropical moons of the system's large gas giant. Each moon is independent and civil conflict between the moons makes the system a tense and dangerous place.

name: Lywick (Ferreusvirgo 3130+)
detail: Lywick (Ferreusvirgo 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ma'anshan
detail: Ma'anshan was originally a part of the Finmark Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth War.

name: Machapuchre
detail: Machapuchre was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Machida
detail: Machida was a part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Macintosh
detail: The world was formerly known as Drekos before it was changed by the Apple Computers Interstellar company during the days of the Star League.

name: Mackenzie
detail: The Brigadier Corporation has a moderately sized orbital facility above Mackenzie which produces small craft and offers jump ship repairs to those with the C-Bills to pay their rates.

name: Mackolla
detail: Mackolla was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Macksburg
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era.

name: MacLeod's Land
detail: As a core planet in the Taurian Concordat, MacLeod's Land was once devastated in the Reunification War. More recently, its Terran-like geography and distributed population has made it a budget location for holovid shoots.

name: Macomb
detail: Settled by colonists from the British Isles during the Exodus from Terra, it remained independent for over a century before joining the Federated Suns

name: Maderas
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the early years of the Star League.

name: Madiun
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era.

name: Madras
detail: The mining colony of Madras has a thin atmosphere, but its high gravity causes air to pool in the lowlands, where the pressure makes it tolerable without specialized suits. The pooling air is moderately toxic, thanks to a concentration of particulate matter.

name: Maestu
detail: Settled by the Tamar Pact before the Lyran Commonwealth began.

name: Maharet
detail: Maharet was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mahone
detail: Mahone's sun is a very small point in the sky and daylight on the planet has a distinct blue tint.

name: Mahrah
detail: Mahrah was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Maia
detail: One of the three inhabited worlds of the Pleiades, Maia is the moon of a gas giant, and the gravity well of the planet has caused extensive vulcanism on the chilly, forested moon. Research and manufacturing dominate Maia's sprawling industrial cities.

name: Main Street
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era.

name: Maison
detail: Maison was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Maisons
detail: Maisons was a colony world settled by the Lyran Commonwealth late in the Star League era, and has had a slew of corrupt politicians.

name: Malacca
detail: Malacca was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Maladar
detail: Maladar was one of the main trading words of the St. Ives Mercantile League until being annexed by the Capellan Confederation.

name: Malador Cluster
detail: The Malador Cluster is a significant astronomical feature in the anti-spinward Deep Periphery. Located a little over 1,100 light-years from Terra, the Malador Cluster is relatively close to the Vul Rift and the Deep Periphery colonies known as Landrum and Doggerbank.

name: Malaga
detail: Malaga was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Malagrotta
detail: The Malagrotta system is home to a titanium-rich planetoid, the airless moon of Fontana. The system has been heavily contested nearly from the time of settlement, a dispute which helped provoke the Reunification War.

name: Malazan
detail: Malazan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Maldonado
detail: Settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, it was annexed in the 26th century by the Draconis Combine.

name: Malibu
detail: Malibu was one of four worlds acquired by the Rim Worlds Republic in an attempt to make a heavily fortified world.

name: Mallory's World
detail: Named after the scientist who saved the initial colony from disease, Mallory's World was once a lush garden world until the brutal fighting during the Succession Wars turned three of its continents into barren wastelands.

name: Manapire
detail: Remember The Great Exodus? Well, the Third Ceti Hussars, formed from Star League Defense Force troops, was ones who preferred to stay in the Inner Sphere. And this is their home world now.

name: Manaringaine
detail: The Elysian world of Manaringaine is a temperate planet maintained in a pristine wilderness state. The people supported themselves mainly as hunters and gatherers.

name: Manassas
detail: Manassas is the home of a large Interstellar Expeditions exploration office, and many expedition crews form here before setting off into the void. The planet itself is a sickly yellow from orbit, due to it's tainted atmosphere.

name: Manaus
detail: Manaus was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mandal
detail: Mandal was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mandalas
detail: Founded by religious separatists from Herotitus, Mandalas is a marginal agricultural world that relies on manual labor as much as industrial farming techniques. As resources dwindle, civil unrest and religious sectarianism are creating social turmoil.

name: Mandaoaaru
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era.

name: Mandaree
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era.

name: Mandate
detail: The capital city named Glory of Liao sums up the world of Mandate, filled with vanity projects and aristocrats retreats.

name: Mandeville
detail: Mandeville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Manennaia
detail: Manennaia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mangor
detail: Mangor was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mangzhangdian
detail: Mangzhangdian has a long year with high annual variance of climate -- very hot summers and cold winters. Thanks to these extremes, the original Capellan colonial structures have long since collapsed into ruin, leaving a marginal pastoral world.

name: Manihiki
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, it was originally part of the Marik Commonwealth before the formation of the Free Worlds League.

name: Mankova
detail: Mankova is covered with dense jungles with a multitude of wildlife. The most notable species is the Conqueror Worms that can slowly digest metal by means of secreted acid.

name: Manksville
detail: Manksville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mannedorf
detail: Mannedorf has two continents; Meilen, where the capital city Zurich is located, and Schifffahrtsgesellschaft. It is a large world, largely covered by arctic plains and at one point was home to numerous SLDF caches.

name: Manotick
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League  during the Star League era, Manotick offers many agricultural benefits for farmers thanks to the vitae of the soils.

name: Mansfield
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the start of the Star League era.

name: Mansu-ri
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the start of the Star League era.

name: Manteno
detail: Manteno is experiencing a period of sometimes violent geologic activity which has disrupted lives and industries on the planet. Many of the wealthiest have already emigrated.

name: Mantharaka
detail: Mantharaka is only marginally habitable, with barren rocky highlands and cold, arid lowlands, but the vast and easily-accessible deposits of titanium-bearing ores have made it a viable mining colony, regardless.

name: Mantle
detail: Mantle could almost be called a paradise... if it weren't for the obvious fortifications and mines dotting the planet. It appears ready to throw back any invasion, though none have ever come to test its mettle. Mantle stands ready though, its small population armed to the teeth.

name: Manx
detail: Manx was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mao
detail: Mao was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mara
detail: The wide plains of Mara, with fertile soils, allow the world to produce food for many neighboring planets. This fertile soil also permits allows a wide variety of tree species to flourish.

name: Marantha
detail: Marantha is home to one of the Magistracy's most important military academies, as well as major manufacturing facilities operated by the Alliance Aerospace Group. It hosts heavy industry in its asteroid belt, and is famed for its brandy, but the soil lacks certain nutrients required for most crops and famine is an ongoing problem for the inhabitants.

name: Mararn
detail: Mararn is a hot, dry world with an overabundance of deserts. Much of the population lives in sparse settlements in the more temperate areas.

name: Marathon
detail: Marathon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Marawi
detail: A terrestrial style world, Marawi is often used by aerotech fighters as a training area. During the Star League era the Fourth Rasalhague Regulars were based here.

name: Marcus
detail: Marcus is a harsh world, but one rich in heavy metal and radioactive metal ores. It was once home to the primary UrbanMech production facility, but that factory was destroyed during the Second Succession War.

name: Marduk
detail: Marduk has the dubious honor of being the first planet to be attacked in what would become known as the Second Hidden War.  It is also home to Norse BattleMech Works, a Star League era construction facility.

name: Marfik
detail: Marfik is a hot world that lacks a thick atmosphere and an ozone layer. As a result the surface of the world is constantly bombarded by radioactivity and cosmic rays. Colonists quickly set up new cities underground or under protective domes.

name: Mariefred
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, Mariefred was originally independent for over a century before joining the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Marielund
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era.

name: Marik
detail: The planet Marik was settled in 2139 by Antonin Marik acting under authority of the Terran Alliance, was the former capital of the Republic of Marik. These days it is still a wealthy world, but has been eclipsed by Atreus.

name: Maripa
detail: Maripa was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Marisura
detail: Marisura was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Maritgues
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era.

name: Marius's Tears
detail: The world of Marius' Tears was originally named Herculaneum. The world was renamed after Imperator Marius died in a climbing accident on Herculaneum in 3048 and was renamed by his son.

name: Markab
detail: One of the first worlds settled by the Azami, Markab is very similar to Terra's Middle East and North African regions. The land is dry and windblown, forming a single supercontinent. The economy is mainly formed from the exploitation of the petrochemicals under the desert.

name: Markesan
detail: Settled during the Star League era, during the First Succession War the planet and population was ravaged by DCCS forces until it was liberated many years later.

name: Marknick
detail: Marknick has only recently been marked for colonisation by settlers from the Taurian Concordat.

name: Marlette
detail: Marlette was once the capital of the Marlette Association, a small post-Terran Alliance interstellar polity. To this day it retains it's status as a Regional capital.

name: Marlowe's Rift
detail: The name of the system comes from a bubble of interstellar dust and gas which floats nearby. Originally a scientific colony, it's fortune changed with the discovery of the local Meat Tree, a citrus fruit with the same taste and consistency of cooked beef.

name: Marodzi
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era due to the discovery of a local plant which can act as an aphrodisiac.

name: Marsalle
detail: Marsalle was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Marshdale
detail: The thick marshland that covers much of the surface of this world is where Marshdale gets it's name.

name: Mas
detail: Mas was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Masterson
detail: The self sufficient world of Masterson was part of the Capellan Commonality before the formation of the Confederation.

name: Masterton
detail: Masterton was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Matamoras
detail: Home to a ruined Castle Brian named Wazukana Fortress, Matamoras is a desolate world after the damage taken during the Succession Wars.

name: Matar
detail: Matar was annexed by the Draconis Combine due it's strategic position between Izurkun and Proserpina.

name: Matheran
detail: The 3rd Jump Infantry Division often trained in the wooded areas of Matheran during the Star League era.

name: Matsu
detail: The precious metals mining centeron Matsu forms the basis for much of the employment on Matsu

name: Matsuida
detail: Matsuida hosts a large and important fishing industry. Some of the fishing vessels on-planet host prisoners who volunteer for the deadly jobs in exchange for having their sentences shortened.

name: Mattisskogen
detail: Desolate Mattisskogen once had specialized shipbuilding facilities that were bombed to the ground during the Second Succession War. There are still remnants of the base underground, in highly unstable tunnels.

name: Mauckport
detail: The Tri-Area Spaceport on Mauckport is home to many vices for passing transport and freighter crews.

name: Maule
detail: This harsh rocky desert world is a source of gemstones and not much else. It was annexed into the Draconis Combine at some point before the Star League era.

name: Mauna Loa
detail: Mauna Loa was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mauripur
detail: Settled during the exodus from Terra, it remained independent for over two hundred years before finally joining the Free Worlds League.

name: Mavegh
detail: Mavegh was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Maxie's Planet
detail: Named after the renown biologist who saved the colony from starvation, Maxie's Planet is home to Maxie's Militia, a fierce light brigade.

name: Maximillian
detail: Settled during the Succession Wars by refugees seeking an escape from the conflict.

name: Maxwell
detail: Maxwell is known throughout the Free Worlds League for two things: Exporting food and capable Parlimentarians. The mostly mountainous terrain makes farming the few flat areas critically important, and it also makes most land vehicles useless.

name: Mayenne
detail: Mayenne was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mayetta
detail: During the Star League era, the world was chosen by DoME, Department of Mega-Engineering, as a candidate for terraforming. The extensive costs of the terraforming were greatly offset by the massive mineral wealth discovered on world as well as in the planet's two moons

name: Maynard
detail: Settled during the exodus from Terra, it remained independent for over two hundred years before finally joining the Federated Suns.

name: Mazdru
detail: Mazdru was never more than a scientific outpost, established to investigate the rare planetary ring system that surrounds it. Sometime in the past fifty years, the Capellans evacuated all remaining personnel and abandoned the outpost.

name: McAffe
detail: The turbulent weather patterns on McAffe have been known to create lethal storms known to the locals as Rakshasa.

name: McAlister
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era.

name: McComb
detail: Settled by independent colonists during the Exodus from Terra, the population was annexed into the Draconis Combine over a hundred years later. During the Succession Wars, the world changed hands many times.

name: McEvans' Sacrifice
detail: No records indicate who McEvans was, or what their sacrifice might have been. The surface of this arctic world is bare of much sign of prior human colonization, aside from the ruins of a single colony DropShip half-buried in ice.

name: McEvedy's Folly
detail: McEvedy's Folly was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: McGehee
detail: Often described as a neglected colony, the world is an unremarkable agrarian world, featuring two major continents-Berkeley in the north, and Rhindoe to the south.

name: McHenry
detail: Around 2163 McHenry was a newly-opened colony world, and the destination for a group of almost 100,000 colonists whose JumpShip malfunctioned in the nearby Muskegon system, leading eventually to the founding of the Muskegon Empire.

name: McKellan
detail: McKellan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: McKenna
detail: McKenna served as the headquarters for the XIX Corps of the Star League Defense Force prior to the fall of the Star League.

name: McRae
detail: The headquarters of McRae Quik Construct are situated here, which is the civil and commercial construction division of Federated Suns based Green Star Corporation.

name: Meacham
detail: Originally a member of the Tamar Pact, it joined the Lyran Commonwealth due to increased aggression from the nearby Draconis Combine.

name: Meadowvale
detail: During the Reunification War, the world of Meadowvale acted as a Star League Defense Force marshalling yard and was a key world in the supply chain for the task force based around the SLDF's VII Corps tasked with conquering the nearby Magistracy of Canopus.

name: Mearra
detail: Mearra was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mechdur
detail: Mechdur is a bustling trade and industrial hub, with three different starports, over a billion inhabitants, and gleaming cities in the heart of its vast grasslands. Ruled by a group of oligarchs, it is in many ways the heart of the Aurigan region.

name: Medellin
detail: Medellin was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war in a violent battle that rendered the main colony uninhabitable. The colonists moved to a new location, Tabatinga, which exists to this day.

name: Medron
detail: Medron was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Medzev
detail: Medzev was an independent world for centuries before joining the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Megarez
detail: Megarez was an agrarian world of little strategic importance during the reunification war, but it had one strength - the SLDF did not know about it. Exports to worlds under attack helped the Magistracy of Canopus survive the onslaught.

name: Megaris
detail: Megaris was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Meghy
detail: Meghy was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Megiddo
detail: Megiddo was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Meglan (Victoria 2537+)
detail: After the Davion Civil War Meglan was renamed Victoria by the victorious First Prince Alexander Davion. The world was a shining jewel until the First Succession War, where Draconis Combine troops unleashed massive chemical and nuclear attacks upon the world.

name: Megrez
detail: Having been conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Second Succession War, the Eridani Light Horse mercenary unit recaptured Megrez for the Free Worlds League in 2854

name: Meilen
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era.

name: Meinacos
detail: The mountainous islands of Meinacos form a natural barrier for invaders.

name: Meinhof
detail: Meinhof was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Meinrad
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the formation of the Star League.

name: Mejicanos
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the formation of the Star League.

name: Melcher
detail: Melcher was devastated during the First Succession War, with much of the population killed during a five year occupation.

name: Melidron
detail: Melidron is located in the rimward region of the Deep Periphery, close to the Flying Bat Nebula and the Perses-Cepherus Cloud Complex. It is uninhabited.

name: Melilla
detail: Melilla was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Melissia
detail: Melissia was a part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war. It is the headquarters of Grumman Industries, creators of the Marksman tracked vehicle.

name: Melk
detail: Melk was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Melville
detail: Melville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Memmingen
detail: Memmingen was settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era as a fortified world. It was eventually conquered at great loss of life during the Second Succession War.

name: Memphis
detail: Memphis is situated in the Outback of the Federated Suns, and is oft neglected.

name: Mendham
detail: Though initially settled by the Taurians, Mendham was seized by the Capellans in a brutal war of aggression which saw civilian massacres. The world was later conquered by Davion, and is now a thriving industrial center, though its orbit is choked with battle debris.

name: Menion
detail: Menion was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Menkalinan
detail: Settled as an independent world, within a century it lay within the Capellan zone and was annexed. It is an oft disputed world, with much of it's population holding no loyalty to the owning house.

name: Menkar
detail: Menkar has thus far escaped much of the horrors of war, and it's government has adopted a surrender first policy to ensure the world is spared devastation.

name: Menke
detail: This lush jungle world is the home base of McCarron's Armored Cavalry, a storied mercenary unit allied with the Capellans. Sprawling megacities coexist with the deep rainforests, and the wealthy planet is always heavily defended by the Cavalry.

name: Menkent
detail: Menkent is an arid world lit by a dim orange star. While it posseses water, it is so salty that purification units are needed to prep it for consumption and irrigation. Menkent has little to offer, exporting common metals and small industrial goods.

name: Menkib
detail: Protected by the Menkib militia, this world has thus far been spared much of the horrors of war.

name: Mentasta
detail: Mentasta was almost entirely depopulated during the Second Succession War due to heavy fighting which destroyed much of the industrial base.

name: Merak
detail: Merak was part of the Stewart Confederation before being invaded by the Free Worlds League.

name: Mercedes
detail: In 2758, a Rim Worlds Republic unit attacked Mercedes. The 209th BattleMech Division of the Star League Defense Force responded to the attack and smashed the brigade responsible, accidently unleashing radiation into the atmosphere.

name: Merdal
detail: Merdal is covered in a deep sea of dense, fragile vegetation. 'Solid' ground only exists on a few lifeless stone mesas. Anything that burns through the vegetation is swiftly entangled in rapidly vining blooms eager for the open space.

name: Merlin
detail: Though there's no official record of anybody colonizing Merlin, the desert planet is nonetheless dotted with multiple unfinished construction projects on high rocky cliffs that suggest somebody once had ambitions for the world.

name: Merlynpede
detail: Merlynpede was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mermentau
detail: The harvest of speckled-back prairie squid by local company Cephaloped Food Alternatives Ltd. on Mermentau has became somewhat famous.

name: Merope
detail: One of the three inhabited worlds of the Pleiades, Merope's climate is the result of Star League terraforming; giant boreholes down into the planet's mantle heat the atmosphere and make the planet temperate and pleasant.

name: Merowinger
detail: Merowinger was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mersa Matruh
detail: Formally one of the worlds of the Alliance of Galedon, it became a key world in the formation of the Draconis Combine.

name: Merton
detail: In the years prior to the Amaris Civil War, elements of the 13th Royal Mechanized Infantry Division were ambushed by pirate forces near the planetary capital of Meyer while on patrol. The attacks caused considerable damage to the SLDF forces as well as civilian housing nearby.

name: Mesartim (Conway)
detail: The original settlers of Mesartim found a world perfectly suited for growing grapes, and many vineyards are located here - the source of much conflict in the planets history.

name: Mesa Verde
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era.

name: Metter
detail: The world was colonized primarily by individuals from western Europe, and compared to most is considered rural.

name: Mezzana
detail: The Mezzana system was colonized at some point during the Star League era, and was host to a Star League garrison.

name: Miaplacidus
detail: Originally one of the core worlds of the Marik Commonwealth, it became part of the Free Worlds League during it's formation.

name: Mica Majority
detail: The Micanos system was originally colonized by the Draconis Combine in the second half of the twenty-sixth century to take advantage of the rich mineral deposits on three of the worlds within the system.

name: Michtal
detail: Michtal was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but, as is the fate of many worlds in the Outworlds Wastes, fell off the maps during the Third Succession War. Some inhabitants lingered but the planet was beneath notice for even the Alliance's government.

name: Mickleover
detail: Mickleover was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Micros
detail: Recently settled by the Taurian Concordat, Micros is still reliant on supplies from nearby worlds.

name: Midale
detail: Once the home of the SLDF 5th Fleet, Midale is now an agricultural world notable for its thin, high spires of rock and beautiful coral reefs. The residents farm tropical tree nuts on long, curving archipelagos.

name: Midden
detail: Midden was apparently used by the Star League and Magistracy of Canopus as a dumping site for toxic waste; the world was staffed by a small population of workers who lived deep underground and oversaw the largely automated facilities.

name: Midkiff
detail: Originally one of the core worlds of the Marik Commonwealth, it became part of the Free Worlds League during it's formation.

name: Midthun
detail: Midthun was a sterile potentiality when first visited by the Liao. They soon dismissed it from their planning, but not before leaving behind some algae and bacteria that have since established a thriving ecosystem that draws curious biologists from all over.

name: Midway
detail: Midway is a water-rich world with a unique celestial feature: Its satellite (Oscuro Corazon) doesn't reflect any light and appears as a pure black spot in the sky, even in daytime. The native shrikebat has been known to carry off small children.

name: Millerton
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era due to it's unique flora and fauna.

name: Milligan
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era due to it's unique flora and fauna.

name: Milligan's World
detail: Devastated during the Reunification War, Milligan's World is mostly an agricultural world these days, with one of the delicacies being a tiny bird that is edible without removing the bones.

name: Millray
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era due to it's unique flora and fauna.

name: Millungera
detail: During the Star League era both Millungera and the nearby Saltillo system were jointly administered by the Free Worlds League and the Star League, with the intention on keeping an eye on the traffic moving in and out of the region known as the Bolan Thumb.

name: Milnerton
detail: Colonised by the Federation of Oriente, it became a defacto core world of the Free Worlds League.

name: Milos
detail: Milos is an agricultural world of some strategic importance.

name: Milton
detail: Milton was a paradise world when it was first discovered. Unfortunately, it was ravaged by nucelar and chemical weapons during the early Succession Wars, leaving the atmosphere tainted and the population at half of its Star League Era peak.

name: Milvano
detail: Milvano was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Minakuchi
detail: Minakuchi is the home of Spreading The Glories Incorporated, which produces and distributes art, holos, and films throughout the Draconis Combine. Known for churning out a large number of low-quality productions, the majority of STG's titles are war movies and morally instructive romances for the civilians of the Combine.

name: Minderoo
detail: Colonised by the Protectorate of Dongeal, it became a defacto core world of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Mindrel
detail: Mindrel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Minerva
detail: Minerva is the capital world of the highly religious Dane Sacellum. Founded by the Dane family and named for their patron goddess, Minerva is a highly urbanized planet that is brimming with technology, history, and spirituality. Well maintained and managed, Minerva is as close as it gets to paradise.

name: Minette
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era due to it's rich mineral content.

name: Minnacora
detail: Colmar Myomics and Cortide Magnetics operate facilities on Minnacora, producing massive amounts of myomer related products used within BattleMechs.

name: Minowa
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era.

name: Miquelon
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era, it is known for the largest water wheel within the Inner Sphere.

name: Mira
detail: Mira is a relatively hot world with exceptionally dense jungles and a gravity above the norm. It is quite wealthy, with a large industrial base.

name: Mirach
detail: Mirach was originally settled to take advantage of the large amounts of minerals and metal ores that were simply lying on the surface of the world. Easy access to these minerals rapidly boosted the planet's economy

name: Mirage
detail: Settled by the Federation Suns during the Star League era.

name: Mirfak
detail: Taurus Majoris Mining owns most of the planet, which is made up of it's own employees mining the rich veins of germanium.

name: Misery
detail: The icy world of Misery has earned it's name, with the winds and temperature leaving the population in a constant state of distress.

name: Mishkadrill
detail: Settled by the Outworlds Alliance during the formation of the Star League.

name: Mississauga
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era, it is known for being a tax haven within the commonwealth.

name: Mitchel
detail: When surveyed by the Capellans, Mitchel was found to be marginally habitable but rich in minerals. The massive industrial complexes that strip the world for its resources are supplemented by towering megacities that cluster along the green ocean shorelines.

name: Mitchella
detail: Mitchella was the second target for the 10th Brigade of the SLDF during the Reunification War, who earned the name The Baby Killers. The United Outworlders Corporation now operates from Mitchella, but produces only a fraction of industrial output from before the attacks.

name: Mithron
detail: While Mithron was originally settled by a minor religious group, the inhabitants have mostly left that faith behind. They are, however, justifiably proud of the planet's sunsets, which apparently make living in the mining settlements worth it.

name: Miyada
detail: Settled by independent colonists from the Isle of Man, the planet was annexed by the Draconis Combine at some point before the formation of the Star League.

name: Miyako
detail: Miyako was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Miyazaki
detail: Miyazaki was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mizar
detail: Four small Type A stars permanently illuminate the planet Mizar, making it a tourist world featuring some of most famous vistas in the Inner Sphere. It is unique as the only settled world in a double binary star system in the Inner Sphere.

name: Mizdargh
detail: Mizdargh is located in the rimward region of the Deep Periphery beyond the Perses-Cepherus Cloud Complex and the California Nebula. It is uninhabited.

name: Mizt
detail: Mizt was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mizunami
detail: One of the core worlds of the Alliance of Galedon, it became a defacto world of the Draconis Combine.

name: Mkuranga
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era.

name: Modesto
detail: Modesto was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mogabouti
detail: Mogabouti was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mogyorod
detail: Mogyorod was a part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war. The ruins of a Castle Brian, Fort Shannon, lie amidst the mountains.

name: Mohács
detail: Mohács was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mokane
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns in the years before the formation of the Star League.

name: Mokpo
detail: Mokpo was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Molino
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns in the years of the Star League.

name: Molokai
detail: For over a century Molokai was an independent world before being invaded by the Free Worlds League.

name: Mondra
detail: Mondra was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Monhegan
detail: Monhegan is home to Bankin Preserve Forest - a vast forest made up of imported Terran vegetation.

name: Monistrol
detail: An independent colony for almost a century, it was annexed by the newly formed Draconis Combine.

name: Monongahela
detail: Monongahela is a water rich, agricultural world. Prior to the fall of the Star League, a majority of the planet's land area was devoted to meat-animal production while there was a major industry in the harvesting of the native Monongahela Tuna Shark.

name: Monroe
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns in the years before the formation of the Star League.

name: Montcoal
detail: Settled by independent colonists, it was absorbed by the Federated Suns before the formation of the Star League.

name: Monthey
detail: Monthey was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Montmarault
detail: Settled by independent colonists, it was absorbed by the Lyran Commonwealth before the formation of the Star League.

name: Montour
detail: Montour was originally a Taurian colony, until the reunification war where it became the graveyard to thousands of warriors.

name: Montsegur
detail: Montsegur was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Monument to Man
detail: The Monument to Man is a man-made structure, with a height of about 20 meters, containing a time capsule of human cultural objects. It is due to be placed here during 3077.

name: Monywa
detail: Monywa's economy is dominated by the petrochemical industry. The size of the industry itself, plus Monywa's proximity to New Samarkand, warranted the Star League to post a garrison of Star League Defense Force troops on world.

name: Moore
detail: Only 15% of Moore's planetary surface is land, the rest of it is covered in oceans. Due to the high water content, most of the land is swamp. Moore was settled for the large supplies of uranium, germanium, and titanium.

name: Moravian
detail: Moravian is a torrid world, with a mining industry smashed by war and a depressed economy.

name: Mordialloc
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns in the years before the formation of the Star League.

name: Morgan's Holdfast
detail: Morgan's Holdfast was settled by Phillip Morgan, a famed pirate and MechWarrior. Using his newfound wealth made from raiding wealthy worlds, he settled this small world and formed a trading colony.

name: Morges
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Morges supported a garrison of the Star League Defense Force.

name: Moriguchi
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era, it is known for being a haven for criminal activity.

name: Moritz
detail: Large veredant valleys criss cross the single massive continent of Moritz.

name: Morningside
detail: In 2407 a two-pronged invasion into the Lyran Commonwealth by the Draconis Combine was finally stopped at great cost on Morningside after Archon Alistair Marsden personally assumed command of the defense of the Commonwealth.

name: Moroney
detail: Moroney is located between Otisberg and Waypoint in the Rim Collection and is uninhabited.

name: Morrigan
detail: Morrigan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Morrill
detail: Settled during the Exodus from Terra, Morrill is a poor industrialised world with a high crime rate. The high pollution requires most buildings to be outfitted with atmospheric scrubbers, and much of the population endures indoors.

name: Morthac
detail: Morthac was a pristine garden world until the Reunification War, where weapons were unleashed into the atmosphere poisoning the world. During the Succession Wars, vast mineral fields were found at the polar caps bringing new wealth to Morthac.

name: Morven
detail: Settled during the Star League era, Morven's petrochemical industries supply nearby worlds.

name: Mosiro
detail: Mosiro is predominantly Islam. The capital Al-Ilb, carved into a 1km cliff, is devoted to arts and has the largest mosque rimward of Terra. The Ministry of Information houses one of the most extensive libraries of physical books found in the League.

name: Moultrie
detail: Settled during the Star League era, Moultrie's nascent petrochemical industry supplie nearby worlds.

name: Mozirje
detail: Settled during the Star League era in order to capture the world's massive petroleum deposits, it was devastated during the First Succession War leaving only the northernmost continent inhabitable.

name: Mualang
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Mualang was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Multan
detail: While Multan is a sparsely populated agricultural world, it was the host of a Star League Defense Force garrison during the final years of the Star League.

name: Mumbai
detail: Mumbai was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mundrabilla
detail: An independent agricultural world for over a century, it was conquered by the Free Worlds League after the fall of the Terran Alliance.

name: Muphrid
detail: Muphrid is blessed with mild seasons, expansive seas and fertile soil. The world has been heavily zoned to protect its natural environment, including a entire continent which is designated as a nature preserve.

name: Murchison
detail: Murchison is a habitable planet with a moon (Oasis) that also supports Terran life, and has three continents Abla, Harschweld and Felkra. Whilst Oasis was once an agricultural paradise, it was irradiated during the Succession Wars and the population moved back to Murchison

name: Muridox
detail: Granted as a backhanded reward to a troublesome minor Liao family, Muridox is a deep-water planet with vast floating hydroponics platforms and settlements on the polar ice caps dedicated to deep-dive harvests of native sea life.

name: Murmansk
detail: Murmansk was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Muroto
detail: Muroto was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Murris
detail: Murris is a vibrantly alive planet with an oxygen-rich atmosphere and legendarily huge megafauna. It enjoyed a brief period as a safari destination for the Capellan Confederation nobility, but the fad for fighting giant animals with Battlemechs passed.

name: Muscida
detail: Muscida was one of the founding worlds of the Principality of Regulus, before the formation of the Free Worlds League.

name: Muskegon
detail: Muskegon is described as a harsh, marginally habitable planet on which survival depended on equally harsh measures. It's petroleum and plastics industry bring riches to the world that belie the horrid conditions on the surface.

name: Muswell
detail: Muswell was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Myrrdin
detail: Myrrdin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Myrvoll
detail: Myrvoll was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Mystras
detail: The faceted domes over the mining outposts of Mystras glitter along the twilight zone of the tidally locked planet, where constant winds keep the sky clear. Despite the planet's challenges the Taurians have found mining there extremely lucrative.

name: Mytilene
detail: Mytilene was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.
