name: Naco
detail: Naco was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nadrin
detail: Nadrin was settled due it's vast stepped plains and transplanted with many terran forests and wildlife. It holds the distinction as one of the founding worlds of the Alliance of Galedon before the formation of the Draconis Combine.

name: Nagel
detail: The world of Nagel is water-rich and most settlements, during the Star League era, lay close to sea level. Boats and hovercraft are preferred methods of travel due to large areas of mangrove trees that restrict ground movement. Every year, the inhabitants hold a boat parade to celebrate the colonization of the planet.

name: Nahoni
detail: Settled by colonists from Croatia during the Exodus from Terra, it joined the Federated Suns in the years before the formation of the Star League.

name: Nai-Stohl
detail: Nai-Stohl was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Naikongzu
detail: Naikongzu was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Naissus
detail: Naissus was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Najha
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Najha was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison, however has been scoured clean of any caches during the Succession Wars.

name: Nakaojo
detail: The Naka Pabni system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and was annexed into the Draconis Combine during it's formation.

name: Naka Pabni
detail: The Naka Pabni system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the United Hindu Collective prior to the Collective joining the Federated Suns.

name: Nam Dinh
detail: Nam Dinh was a part of the Andurien Commonality of the Capellan Confederation, but was conquered by the Free Worlds League during the 1st Succession War. Nam Dinh vanished from most maps during the 3rd Succession War due to depopulation.

name: Namen
detail: Located in the Coreward Combat Theatre of the Capellan March, Namen is near Helixmar and Quittacas but vanished from most maps during the 3rd Succession War due to abandonment.

name: Nanking
detail: Nanking was founded during the reign of the Terran Alliance, and has been the capital of numerous nations over the centuries. It is an extremely wealthy world that is home to Rivverson Technologies and Kallon Industries.

name: Nara
detail: Nara was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Narellan
detail: Settled by colonists from Cyprus during the Exodus from Terra, it joined the Federated Suns in the years before the formation of the Star League.

name: Naryn
detail: Naryn is a pretty blue-gold snowball that the Liao made a brief attempt to colonize before more practical minds realized it was best appreciated in holovids made from orbit. Three failed colonies are slowly sinking into the permafrost.

name: Nashira
detail: Nashira is a heavily industrialised world, that was once segregated into two. The remnants of the Terran Alliance have all but been washed away over time however.

name: Nashuar
detail: Settled during the Star League era by the Capellan Confederation due to it's vast edible vegetation.

name: Nathan
detail: Used mostly as a recreational hub for the Free Worlds Military, the agricultural world of Nathan is a prime relaxation spot.

name: Naudain
detail: Naudain is a quiet backwater world, mostly used in the Republic for vacations and as a breadbasket for export to the rest of the Republic. The world is well defended though, and Republican forces have fortified the planet against any invasion.

name: Navarre
detail: Navarre is one of the worlds that formed a part of the Deep Periphery region known as Nueva Castile, and is the headquarters of Quixote Industries, a local military production company for the Castilians.

name: Nebula D77
detail: Nebula D77 was the name given to a nebula located rimward from the Capellan Confederation, approximately 1,947 lightyears from Terra, in the Rimward Sector

name: Necedah
detail: Necedah was settled by the Federated Suns during the formation of the Star League to cement the system and it's trade routes as being Davion territory.

name: Necromo
detail: Necromo's tiny population of about a million are there purely to support the planet's Star League orbital dropship manufacturing and repair facility. The planet is wholly dependent on imported food.

name: Neerabup
detail: Neerabup was settled by colonists who commandeered their jumpship after reaching their initial destination as they wished to go further. A mostly agrarian world, it has had an influx of herdlife recently.

name: Negushevo
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era.

name: Nekkar
detail: Once an independent world with rich resources, it joined the Lyran Commonwealth for protection after the Terran Alliance fell.

name: Neosho
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era to claim it's rich ytterbium deposits.

name: Nerum
detail: Nerum was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nestor
detail: Home to the Nellus Military Academy, this mostly agricultural world is filled with transplanted Terran crops, and exports Terran style foodstuffs to nearby worlds. The rolling hills are ideal for training purposes.

name: New Aberdeen
detail: The New Aberdeen system was colonised during or shortly before the Age of War, and is pockmarked with fresh water lakes across every continent.

name: New Abilene
detail: New Abilene is a grassy world dedicated to raising livestock. The pastureland is mostly owned by a few wealthy 'barons' who are prone to violent squabbles over water rights and shipping privileges; MechWarrior marshals try to keep the peace.

name: New Aragon
detail: New Aragon is an agricultural world which resides in the near core of the Inner Sphere, anti-spinward of Terra. It's location brings it wealth, as well as a large transient population.

name: New Athens
detail: New Athens was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Avalon
detail: As the capital world of the Federated Suns since the founding of the nation in the twenty-fourth century New Avalon is a heavily industrialized and populated planet, home to numerous major defense corporations and military academies.

name: New Bergen
detail: Settled by colonists from the Scandinavian region of Terra, New Bergen formed one of the core worlds of the Rasalhague Consortium before being annexed by the Draconis Combine during it's expansion.

name: New Britain (Inglesmond 2349+)
detail: New Britain (Inglesmond 2349+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Caledonia
detail: The vast agricultural shipping facilities in the city of Avesta provide transport to billions of tons of foodstuffs every year. The ruined Castle Brian known as Redcastle sits overlooking the landings sights.

name: New Canton
detail: As the Terran Hegemony collapsed, the Capellan Confederation seized the rich mines and fields of New Canton with little bloodshed. New Canton joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: New Capetown
detail: New Capetown still retains an unstated class system based on skin colour that carries over from the days of Terra.

name: Newcastle
detail: Settled by Free Worlds colonists during the formation of the Star League.

name: New Ceylon
detail: New Ceylon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Crete
detail: New Crete was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Dallas
detail: New Dallas was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Damascus
detail: New Damascus is the eighth planet in the system, and is home to manufacturing facilities belonging to a subdivision of Federated Industries.

name: New Delos
detail: The vast rainfall on New Delos causes many of the rapidly flowing rivers to flood in areas where there are no defences.

name: New Delphi
detail: The capital of the New Delphi Compact, this warm humid world is located far from the Inner Sphere.

name: New Exford
detail: Crescent City is known for being a pilot's wet dream, with eclectic adornments to suit even the most savage beast.

name: New Florence
detail: New Florence was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Galicia
detail: New Galicia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Ganymede
detail: On New Ganymede, a career miner finds novelty: the valuable ore is on the surface while the water is underground.The Taurian Concordat also maintains a desert warfare training facility in the polar region.

name: New Gascony
detail: After the stable and self-sufficient colony on Tortuga was well-established enough, colonization begun on other worlds, leading to the settlement of New Gascony and four other worlds.

name: New Haiti
detail: After the stable and self-sufficient colony on Tortuga was well-established enough, colonization begun on other worlds, leading to the settlement of New Gascony and four other worlds.

name: New Hessen
detail: New Hessen orbits the system primary at a much greater range than Terra does Sol. This means that even though the star is hotter than Sol, the world should be much cooler than it is. Thanks to the thick atmosphere, however, New Hessen enjoys a tropical climate.

name: New Home
detail: A moderately prosperous mining world, New Home has seen a lot of combat over the years as the Lyran Alliance, Free Worlds League, and Capellan Confederation have fought for control.

name: New Hope
detail: New Hope was colonised by classic holovid fans at some point before the formation of the Star League.

name: New India
detail: The New India system was discovered and colonized in the early to mid-twenty-second century. It is currently home to the New India Parts Depot, a thrift shop for old and scrapped BattleMechs.

name: New Ivaarsen
detail: New Ivaarsen is a center of industry, agriculture, learning, and culture, on par with many of the more famous worlds of the Inner Sphere. This has, of course, made it a coveted prize.

name: New Kyoto
detail: The hostile fauna on New Kyoto took many years to tame, but during the Star League era it was a shining jewel of human ingenuity. Sadly during the Succession Wars, the great Bolson Shipyards in orbit were destroyed, littering the surface with debris. Whilst New Kyoto still has a bouyant electronics industry, it is still producing less than half of it's Star League glory days.

name: New Macao
detail: New Macau was colonised by classic casino enthuisiasts at some point before the formation of the Star League.

name: New Mendham
detail: New Mendham was a thriving world filled with ranches until joining the Federated Suns, who invested much into industrialising the world.

name: New Olympia
detail: New Olympia is home to both the Lloyd Marik-Stanley Aerospace School and the Allison MechWarrior Institute. It's Star League era agridomes produces billions of tons of foodstuffs every year for export to nearby worlds.

name: New Oslo
detail: New Oslo is an icy world home to many manufacturers such as Alshain Weapons and Galileo Instruments.

name: New Port Royal
detail: After the stable and self-sufficient colony on Tortuga was well-established, the Dominions began the colonization of other worlds, leading to the settlement of New Port Royal and four other worlds. New Port Royal also has come to host Tortugan 'Mech combat tournaments, as suits the pirate spirit.

name: New Praha
detail: New Praha was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Rhodes
detail: A harsh desert world, it is home to the "Colossii of New Rhodes", a chain of nearly 150 geological towers scattered across the vast desert like islands in a sea, which has become a tourist attraction that brings people from across the Inner Sphere.

name: New Roland
detail: New Roland is a Terra-like planet with unusually mobile and predatory plant life, so most of the residents live on the coastlines and work on the oceans, which is also where most of the non-insectile animal life dwells.

name: New Sagan
detail: New Sagan was part of the Capellan Commonality before joining the Confederation.

name: New Samarkand
detail: This former capital of the Draconis Combine was once heavily populated and industrialised, although it has recently been in decline.  It is however still the home of the Combine's ISF and an important university.

name: New Sapporo
detail: New Sapporo was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Sarna (Tsinghai)
detail: Originally called New Sarna, Tsinghai served as a prefecture capital world in the Sarna Supremacy. After the Supremacy joined the Capellan Confederation, Tsinghai's residents turned to mining and the export of nuclear fuel as the cornerstone of their economy.

name: New Sarum
detail: New Sarum was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Sierra
detail: New Sierra was colonized in the late twenty-sixth century, and grew to three billion people by the late twenty-eighth century. Soon after, a conflict broke out among the population that led to a global thermonuclear war and nuclear winter...

name: New St. Andrews
detail: New St. Andrews is an isolated Periphery planet. The planet possesses few natural resources but it does have a manufacturer - Meridian Manufacturing - which produces menacing looking Mechs such as the Arbiter.

name: New Stevens
detail: New Stevens was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Sumatra
detail: New Sumatra was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Syrtis
detail: Originally settled in the late 2260's, New Syrtis is an icy planet with a narrow temperate band around the equator.  New Sytris is an important mining, manufaturing and military training planet for the Feds.

name: Newton
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era, it was heavily damaged during the First and Second Succession Wars, leading to mass depopulation from which it is only now recovering.

name: Newtown Square
detail: Newtown Square was a world within the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic, and the site of numerous large battles during the Reunification War.

name: New Troy
detail: New Troy was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: New Valencia
detail: New Valencia was a major food exporter during the Star League era. The destruction of JumpShips during the Succession Wars resulted in New Valencia's agriculture shifting to expensive boutique foods.

name: New Vallis
detail: The mining colony of New Vallis is located on the tidally locked moon of a gas giant locally known as Joramander. It has a single city, with a notoriously active nightlife, on a plateau covered with huge, slow-growing trees.

name: New Vandenburg
detail: Long after its eponymous Uprising, New Vandenburg remains a core component in the Taurian Concordat's military industrial complex, while also maintaining a wealth of other industries that make it a highly desirable place to live.

name: New Venice
detail: New Venice was founded by the Marian Hegemony to capitalise on trade routes during the Third Succession War. Little more than a trading outpost, it still garners a fair amount of traffic.

name: New Wessex
detail: New Wessex was once a beautiful world that had light industry and moderate agricultural production, but due to the Succession Wars is now a poisoned world with a dimishing population.

name: New Westin
detail: New Sagan was part of the Sian Commonwealth before joining the Confederation.

name: Nexus Ri
detail: Nexus Ri was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ngake
detail: Ngake Ducal Spaceport is one of the few remaining DropShip manufacturers left in the Inner Sphere.

name: Niangol
detail: Niangol is one of the main petroleum and ore processing centers in the Commonwealth.

name: Nichol's Rest
detail: Nichol's Rest was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nightwish
detail: Nightwish was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nihal
detail: Nihal is a mainly agricultural world that was part of the Sian Commonwealth before joining the Confederation centuries ago.

name: Niihau
detail: Annexed into the Free Worlds League during it's formation, Niihau is mainly known for it's timber products.

name: Niles (OA)
detail: Niles was a recently settled world when it was conquered by the Star League during the Reunification War, which killed most of it's nascent population. Now mostly an agricultural world, it's light industrial base is suitable for minor Mech repairs.

name: Ningpo
detail: Ningpo's wide and fertile plains make it an agricultural producer of some renown.  Covered in several exotic hardwood tree species, careful logging practices have allowed custom furniture businesses to produce some of the most beautiful furniture in the Inner Sphere. Some suggest that the Celestial Throne on Sian is made from Ningpo timber.

name: Ningxia
detail: Though Ningxia has many diamonds perfect for industrial processes, the world was actually settled for it's beautiful landscapes. Regarded as a planet-sized bonsai garden, every effort since the fall of the Star League to exploit the diamonds has been stopped by highly placed nobles, including Coordinator Takashi Kurita.

name: Niomede
detail: Niomede is the largest airless rock in a system full of them. Yet people dwell there, deep under the surface in sealed caves. The original valuable mineral deposit was long ago exhausted, but a thriving astronomical research community endures.

name: Niops
detail: The Niops system was colonized by the Star League to conduct the first study of a falling star based on generations of direct observation. After the fallout of the League, they elected to remain forgotten, a technocracy with no ruler.

name: Niquinohomo
detail: The Niquinohomo system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the United Hindu Collective prior to the Collective joining the Federated Suns.

name: Nirasaki
detail: Nirasaki is a warm but pleasant world whose people are known for their fierce streak of independence. While not home to any military production, Maltex Corporation maintains a 'Mech design thinktank on the planet.

name: Nis
detail: Nis was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nito
detail: Nito was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nizina
detail: The Nizina system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra and was an independent world prior to joining the Federated Suns.

name: Noatak
detail: An icy world known for its whales, seals and aquatic life.

name: Nobel
detail: Nobel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nockatunga
detail: The Nockatunga system was colonized at some point prior to or during the early 23rd Century. During the Star League era, it was classified as a 'vital' world and the construction of many Fort Brian's commenced. Only one remains today, Fort Brittany.

name: Nogales
detail: Nogales was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Noh-wan Hohm
detail: Noh-wan Hohm was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Noisiel
detail: Noisiel is a small and humble Lyran Commonwealth system, best known for its summer 'Mech games, which in addition to more casual sports such as mech chess or mech dances also included 'Mech live combat, with cash prizes to the winners.

name: Non Diz
detail: Non Diz was briefly occupied by the Capellan Confederation, in order to keep it clear of pirates. Eventually they determined even pirates didn't want to deal with the endless dust storms, and redirected their resources elsewhere.

name: Nopah
detail: Nopah is a world with a dying star. Though well suited for flora the radiation from the star had killed all native life by the time the first settlers arrived. In response they imported insects from Terra to make sure their crops were fertilized. This effort was successful, and Nopah became a breadbasket world supporting many nearby systems

name: No Return
detail: Settled during the Star League era after colonists from the Capellan Confederation misjumped into the system, the world was luckily not far from known space.

name: Norfolk
detail: Thyne Weapons Plant utilises local radioactives to produce numerous weaponry for export across the Free Worlds.

name: Norman's World
detail: Norman's World was settled during the Star League era, and was the site of a large rebellion. Norman told them to stop it though, and they did.

name: Norn (Verthandi)
detail: The most habitable world in the Norn system, Verthandi, is considered a Lostech world with its people dependent on others for transport and commerce. Primary industries are agriculture and manufacturing which supports agriculture and local commerce.

name: Northfield
detail: Northfield is home to numerous germanium mines and refineries.

name: Northsun
detail: Northsun was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Northwind
detail: Northwind is the homeworld of the famed mercenary unit the Northwind Highlanders and Northwind Military Academy. Cosara Weaponries and Bulldog Enterprises also have large manufacturing facilities on the surface. Northwind joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Notwina
detail: During the Star League era, great chasms opened up on the surface due to a once in a million years seismic event.

name: Nouasseur
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Nouasseur was the host of a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Nouveau Toulouse
detail: Nouveau Toulouse was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Novara
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Novara was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Nova Roma
detail: Nova Roma is an agrarian world. Lacking a strategic position and possessing a great deal of arable land, Nova Roma quickly became one of the "breadbasket worlds" in the Free Worlds League.

name: Novaya Zemlya
detail: Novaya Zemlya has the dubious honor of being the first inhabited world bombarded by WarShips. The resulting bombardment killed three-quarters of the world's population, destroyed nearly all cities and planetary infrastructure, and poisoned the farmlands. The few survivors had to then deal with the "nuclear winter" that resulted from the dust and debris thrown into the world's upper atmosphere. The Federated Suns are currently pouring many resources into the world.

name: Novensides
detail: Novensides is an unremarkable planet by any account. With a relatively normal environment and with no notable native plant or animal life, Novensides serves mostly to buoy the population of the Sacellum and to serve as a quiet planet for nobles in the Conclave to retire to.

name: Novgorod
detail: Novgorod is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, exporting goods to other Hanseatic worlds.

name: Novo Franklin
detail: Novo Franklin is a hot, agricultural world settled in 2598 by Reunification War refugees fleeing the Outworlds Alliance. Over the next four hundred years, all of these splinter groups had developed feudal states, as many as 55 different kingdoms. Today, Novo Franklin is a dedicated pirate haven world, with little to offer beyond ilicit black markets and danger.

name: Novo Tressida
detail: One of the more disreputable worlds in the Magistracy, Novo Tressida was made famous as the setting for a popular holo-drama involving intrigue, drama, stabbings, and no shortage of dangerously attractive women. The actual planet is home to smugglers and pirates, but not nearly as many exploding dropships as the show would suggest.

name: Nowhere
detail: Nowhere is aptly named. While it was spared the general devastation of the Succession Wars, it has little that makes it stand out, making it a marginal world on the edge of space.

name: Nox
detail: Nox was settled by the wealthy Tamar family and was one of the worlds within the Tamar Pact, a short lived protostate. It's mines are operated by Metals of the Earth, who have a loose relation with Operational Health and Safety.

name: Nuelson Minor
detail: Nuelson Minor was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nukus
detail: Nukus was a minor colony until the Capellans withdrew, leaving the residents to fend for themselves. Only the volcanic equatorial region is inhabited, where temperate climate allows some subsistence agriculture. Elsewhere, the planet is scoured by ice storms.

name: Nullarbor
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, Nullarbor was an independent colony for over a century before joining the Free Worlds League.

name: Numenor
detail: Numenor largely escaped the ravages of warfare during the Succession Wars, leading to the population becoming some of the most confident, erudite and snobbish to be found in the Federated Suns. It is home to Aston-Martin, one of the premium electric vehicle manufacturers in the Inner Sphere.

name: Numki
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era due to one of the Kuritas wanting to play with a space seal. Yes, really.

name: Nuneaton
detail: The Lyran Commonwealth settled Nuneaton at some point during the Star League era, taking advantage of the thick lumber in the primeval forests.

name: Nunivak
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era, it was heavily damaged during the First and Second Succession Wars, leading to mass depopulation from which it is only now recovering.

name: Nusakan
detail: Nusakan, despite its cold climate, has become home to many consumer electronics and luxury aircraft manufacturers. While these are not military industries, they are highly profitable.

name: Nyasa
detail: Nyasa was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Nykvarn
detail: Annually, a viral plague would break-out on Nykvarn's northern continent, which was also the site of special type of grain that was the only viable cure for it. At the first sign of the plague, the grain was harvested and baked into loaves of bread which the locals ate to survive that year's outbreak.

name: Oberon
detail: Oberon, the capital of perhaps the most infamous bandit kingdom, has been home to numerous proto states over the centuries. A great pirates fortress towers over the main capital city.

name: Obrenovac
detail: The Obrenovac system was colonised at some point prior to the end of the Age of War by the Magistry of Canopus, before becoming part of the Inner Sphere during the Reunification War.

name: Oceana
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, Oceana was an independent colony for over a century before joining the Free Worlds League.

name: Odabasi
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, Odabase was an independent colony for over a century before being annexed into the Draconis Combine.

name: Odawara
detail: Odawara was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Odell
detail: Odell's Star League industrial base was destroyed entirely during the First Succession War

name: Odessa (Gabriel)
detail: Odessa was settled early in humanity's expansion to the stars and is home to the Odessan Raxx, a reptilian pack animal used across the world.

name: O'Fallon
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, O'Fallon was an independent colony for over a century before joining the Federated Suns.

name: Offerman
detail: During the Star League era, the planet Offerman was a lightly populated industrial world. Whilst never invaded, the fall of the Star League caused most of the factories to fall into disrepair and most of the remaining industry is related to lumber and woodwork.

name: Ogano
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, Ogano was an independent colony for over a century before being annexed into the Draconis Combine.

name: Ogilvie
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, Ogilvie was an independent colony for over a century before being incorporated into the Federated Suns.

name: Ohrensen
detail: Fort Gorndack is the first sight of many to the world of Ohrensen, a vast heavily defended Star League era spaceport.

name: Okains
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns at the dawn of the Star League, Okains is known for it's high quality gemstones that are mined from the surface.

name: Okaya
detail: Okaya was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Okefenokee
detail: Having been colonised in the twenty-sixth century by deeply religious individuals seeking the solitude of deep space, by the end of the Second Succession War Okefenokee was one of the poorest worlds to be found within the borders of the Federated Suns.

name: Olafsvik
detail: Maarakiva University, located on Olafsvik, is one of the Free Worlds League's top two business schools. Maarakiva focuses more on the academic and theoretical in its courses, with particular attention paid to advertising and market research.

name: Olancha
detail: Great canyons scour the desert world of Olancha, remnants of massive detonations from the First Succession War where it was brutally and swiftly taken by the Combine.

name: Old Canton
detail: Old Canton was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Old Kentucky
detail: Infamously known as the planet where the Inner Sphere's only known deployment of a gigaton-range nuclear device occured, Old Kentucky is still recovering from the centuries of abuse in the Succession Wars.

name: Oldsmith
detail: Oldsmith was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Oli
detail: Oli was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Oligar
detail: Oligar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Olindo
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns at the dawn of the Star League, Olindo is known for it's high quality radioactives that are mined from the surface.

name: Oliver
detail: Oliver is an important industrial world, site of both a Brigadier Corporation's 'Mech factory and a Quickscell Military Vehicle Plant. The planet was only recently seized from the Free Worlds League who no doubt desire it back.

name: Oltepesi
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns at the dawn of the Star League, Olindo is known for it's high quality hydrocarbons that are mined from the surface.

name: Omagh
detail: Omagh was one of the initial colonies that made up the Alliance of Galedon, before it formed the Draconis Combine.

name: Onverwacht
detail: Onverwacht was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Oporto (Veil 3075+)
detail: Oporto (Veil 3075+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Orbisonia
detail: During the Second Succession War, Isla Liao attacked the planet, only to be rebuffed. She was killed directing the Rearguard action which allowed most of her forces to escape - the first Liao Chancellor to die on the battlefield.

name: Orcus
detail: Named for the god of oath-breaking, Orcus is considered a cursed world in the Sanctuary. Every attempt at colonization has ended in some major tragedy. At the moment, Orcus is claimed by the Sacellum for the second time in their history. Privately, most Sanctuary Worlders are waiting for the next Orcus disaster to hit the headlines.

name: Ordino
detail: The major population center on Ordino, a city of a few hundred thousand, was destroyed during the Third Succession War. The remaining inhabitants eke out a living on the impoverished world, but the Capellans have largely withdrawn from the system.

name: Orestes
detail: The world is quiet and unassuming, except for the massive rainforests that circle the equator. Here trees that tower more than 500 meters tall block out the sun, creating a mood of perpetual twilight at the forest floor. Orestes has been pressed into service in recent years as the new capital world of the much-diminished Free Rasalhague Republic.

name: Organo
detail: Organo has two continents, Alphus and Omegus. The capital city, Typae, is located on Alphus. The Pinard Protectorates Limited plant is located in a vast cavern located at the interface zone between a large agricultural area and a desert.

name: Oriente
detail: Oriente was the capital of the protostate known as the Federation of Oriente, before the formation of the Free Worlds. It's status as a regional capital is maintained to this day.

name: Orkney (LC)
detail: One of the core worlds of the Tamar Pact, it became a defacto world of the Lyran Commonwealth when it formed.

name: Orkney (TC)
detail: Recently settled by the Taurian Concordat due to the wealth gained in the Fourth Succession War, Orkney is little more than a farming outpost at this time.

name: Ormal
detail: Ormal was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ormstown
detail: The Ormstown system was colonized during or shortly before the Age of War and had been incorporated into the Rim Worlds Republic by the time of the Reunification War, where it was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Oscar
detail: Settled by the Taurian Concordat in the wake of the Fourth Succession War, many privateers are attempting to create diamond and rare heavy metals industries from the harsh surface of the world.

name: Oshika
detail: Oshika has long been a prefecture capital world. Large quantities of rare earths and germanium in the mountains power a vast economy and industrial base.

name: Osmus Saar
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, Osmus Saar was an independent colony after the fall of the Terran Hegemony until it was annexed by the Draconis Combine.

name: Osset
detail: Osset was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Osumi
detail: Osumi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Otho
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Otho was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Otisberg
detail: Otisberg is the fourth planet in the system and has a single moon named Miloe. Recently there have been talks with nearby worlds about forming an Alliance to band together, but so far talks have stalled.

name: Ottumwa
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, Ottumwa was an independent colony for over a century before being incorporated into the Federated Suns.

name: Ouagadougou (Silence 3130+)
detail: Ouagadougou (Silence 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ourem
detail: Ourem was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Outer Volta
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era due to the high concentrations of mineral wealth within the continent spanning Kodiak mountains.

name: Outpost
detail: Originally only a small outpost, it gained notoriety thanks to the exotic holovid productions which used Outpost as a daring setting.

name: Outreach
detail: Outreach was first settled during the twenty-second century by Terran colonists attracted to the planet's warm climate. Tourism became the mainstay of the planet's economy after it played host to the Star League Martial Olympiads in 2704. It became home to the Wolf's Dragoons in the early 3000s and by 3060 was an independent world that served as the Dragoon's homeworld and logistical center. Outreach also became home to one of the largest mercenary hiring halls in the Inner Sphere, with dozens or even hundreds of commands on-planet at any given time.

name: Ovan
detail: Ovan is a rocky world with a river that runs around the entire equator. Ovan's industrial economy was damaged by the first two Succession Wars, and has been further damaged by mismanagement in recent years.

name: Overton
detail: Overton is temperate, mostly water covered world near where the Capellan, St. Ives, and Federated Suns borders meet. It supports a population of just under a billion, most of whom are involved in the aquaculture industry.

name: Oyevaina
detail: Oyevaina was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ozawa
detail: Once a lush and beautiful world, Ozawa was wracked by nuclear bombardment. Nonetheless, its lucrative mines have kept civilization alive on this poisoned world, and there are occasional signs of recovery.

name: Paches
detail: Paches was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pacifica (Chara)
detail: Pacifica has highly fertile soil and is home to a Mechwarrior Academy. Unfortunately, Pacifica has highly unpredictable weather and only a 14 hour long day-night cycle, so it requires quite a while to acclimate.

name: Paf
detail: Paf was briefly a Taurian research station, but the punishing climate made large-scale construction far too expensive to further exploit the planet's possible resources.

name: Pajarito
detail: Pajarito was annexed into the Inner Sphere during the Reunification war, which caused thousands of refugees to flee the world. The ruins of entire cities can be seen from orbit.

name: Palladaine
detail: One of the founding colonies of the Sian Commonwealth, Palladaine was the source of much of the initial mineral wealth of the Capellan Confederation.

name: Palladix
detail: Palladix is unusual among inhabited worlds in that of the three continents, only one is hospitable to human life. Nearly 250 million inhabitants live on the continent of Gdansk, while the other two continents, Krakow and Polska, have permanent populations less than 10 thousand combined, despite each being larger than Gdansk. They are parched and volcanic wastelands, utterly devoid of vegetation, fresh water, or mineral wealth.

name: Palm
detail: A central system in the Magistracy Of Canopus, Palm is a beacon of stability and prosperity in the periphery. While soldiers of fortune may call it boring, the vast majority of citizens consider steady prosperity and bountiful agriculture far more pleasant.

name: Palmyra
detail: Palmyra Petrochemicals has a monopoly on the vast deposits of petroleum contained within the deserts of Palmyra, and is a major exporter.

name: Palos
detail: Palos is a large world with vastly different climates on each of it's five continents.

name: Pandora
detail: Settled by colonists from different regions, Pandora was settled due to it being a rich world. However, wars and battles raged over the world for most of its early history until the Lyran Commonwealth annexed the system before the Star League era..

name: Pangkalan
detail: Pangkalan was a part of the Apollo Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Panjang
detail: Settled during the Star League era by colonists from the Free Worlds League.

name: Panpour
detail: During the Succession Wars, Panpour was responsible for a vast portion of the Federated Suns industrial output thanks to it's rich minerals and industrial base.

name: Panzyr
detail: As a result of multiple conflicts above the surface of Panzyr, the orbital approach to the planet is potentially hazardous, so despite its pleasant climate and resources, Panzyr is in a slow decline. House Decimis, originally from Guldra, took possession of the world and it is now their home system.

name: Paracale
detail: Settled during the Star League era by relocated colonists and prisoners from the Draconis Combine.

name: Paradise
detail: Sarcastically named Paradise, the dim sun makes growing crops extremely difficult whilst the constantly seismic activity makes mining dangerous.

name: Parakoila
detail: Parakoila is a mineral rich world, known for its gold and heavy metals. The planet's capital is the city of Mainstrike, named after the vast gold veins that were struck here.

name: Paran
detail: Paran VI served as a breadbasket system for the Rim Worlds Republic, covered in island-spanning orchards and massive fisheries. After the Amaris Civil War ended, Paran kept to itself, eventually becoming a haven for outcasts and misanthropes across the isles. Paran is a safe haven for anyone, as long as they keep to themselves.

name: Pardeau
detail: Pardeau was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Parian
detail: Parian was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Paris
detail: During the reign of the Star League, the 171st Mechanized Infantry Division of the Star League Defense Force was formed on this planet, and Fort McKittrick stands to this day as a ruined symbol of the Star League.

name: Park Place
detail: The arable lands and parks of Park Place make this an ideal retirement world for the eldest and wealthiest citizens in the Inner Sphere.

name: Parma
detail: Originally the settlers of Parma organized themselves into a plethora of city-states and declared that no one, not even the Duke, could interfere with the affairs of each city. This did not work.

name: Parvan
detail: Parvan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pascagoula
detail: Settled at the dawn of the Star League era by Federated Suns colonists, who placed a claim on the rich gold veins contained with the peaks of Pascagoula.

name: Pasemah
detail: Pasemah was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pasig
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Pasig was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Patan
detail: Patan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pattison
detail: Settled at the dawn of the Star League era by Federated Suns colonists, who placed a claim on the rich gold veins contained with the peaks of Pattison

name: Pattonsbrug
detail: Settled at the dawn of the Star League era by Federated Suns colonists, who placed a claim on the rich platinum veins contained with the peaks of Pattonsbrug

name: Paulding
detail: Settled at the dawn of the Star League era by Federated Suns colonists, who placed a claim on the rich plains ideal for agriculture.

name: Paulinus
detail: Recently colonised by the Lothian League, the rich platinum veins under the surface are being exported to nearby worlds, making the initial colonists very wealthy.

name: Paulus Prime
detail: Named after the famous mercenary commander Paul the Paulrus. The locals changed the name to Paulus after Paul's death. Their planetary flag is a walrus with machine guns and a cigar.

name: Pavia
detail: Pavia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Payia
detail: This arid world was the site of a 'gold rush' of scavengers looking for LosTech. When hopes of sudden Star League era wealth proved unfounded, the planet was slowly abandoned, and is now littered with ghost towns.

name: Payvand
detail: Payvand was the site of many battles during the Reunification War, and many of it's urban areas were turned into battlefields by the SLDF despite being a clear breach of the Ares Convention.

name: Peabody
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, it was incorporated into the Federated Suns before the Star League era.

name: Peacock
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Peacock was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Pec
detail: Pec was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pegasi
detail: Pegasi is an independent Periphery world located close to the worlds of Carcri and Cephei and the Tortuga Dominions

name: Pell
detail: Pell was never more than a stopping-off point on the way to Buenos Aires. During the Third Succession War the refueling station in orbit was shut down due to lack of parts and technical expertise. The Capellans have since abandoned the system.

name: Pella
detail: Originally one of the worlds of the Sian Commonwealth, it became a defacto member of the Capellan Confederation during it's inaugeration.

name: Pelta
detail: Pelta is only lightly colonized, though its good climate and close orbit around its sun makes it a tempting prospect for the Sanctuary powers, though internal divisions in their political landscape have kept colonization efforts minimal. For now, Pelta serves as a resource world, offering mineral wealth to the Sanctuary Alliance.

name: Pencader
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Pencader was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison. Towerlund City as it is now called is a large walled city located close to the Oxide Desert.

name: Penobscot
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era, it is a mostly self sufficient agri-world.

name: Pentvar
detail: Pentvar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Perdido
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns early in the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Perdition
detail: The oceanic world of Perdition is wracked by constant storms and vulcanism. It would be a fairly unpleasant place to live if not for the money that its mining and military manufacturing industries bring in.

name: Périgueux
detail: Périgueux was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Perkasie
detail: An oft contested world, the original industrial base was destroyed in the Succession Wars, leaving only deep mine shafts to provide material.

name: Pernik
detail: When the Free Worlds League withdrew its support from the mining colony of Pernik, the residents who chose to stay were able to survive by moving to subterranean hydroponic agriculture in the planet's extensive cave systems.

name: Perrot (Shaula 3025+)
detail: Alternatively known as Perrot or Shaula throughout the Succession Wars, it is an unremarkable agri world with areas filled with natural hot springs.

name: Persistence
detail: Persistence was one of seven worlds settled by colonists from the Rim Worlds Republic between 2334 and 2338 as an attempt by Maxwell Rowe to create a buffer zone between the Republic, the Draconis Combine and the Tamar Pact. It was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Pesht
detail: Pesht was discovered by early explorers which were part of the Ozawan merchants in 2212, but due to hostile wildlife wasn't colonised until 2320. A heavily forest world, it is extremely hospitable to humanoid life.

name: Petrolia
detail: Named for it's vast petroleum deposits under the ice, Petrolia is a heavily industrialised world.

name: Phact
detail: The Phact system was colonized sometime prior to 2366, and has had a long history as an industrialised world.

name: Phalan
detail: Settled for rich high-quality metal and oil deposits, the only inhabited planet in the system is 'Hades', a hot caustic world.

name: Phecda
detail: Phecda is a cold and inhospitable world in slow decline. The world's economy is kept afloat only by its important strategic position and its ability to produce high-tech water purification systems. It was home to Snord's Irregulars in the 3020's.

name: Pherkad
detail: An industrialised world, it's flagship exporter is Longanecker PlastiSteel which utilises locally sourced petroleums and materials to produce synthetic plastics and materials.

name: Philadelphia
detail: An industrialised world, it's flagship exporter is Osaka Heavy Metrics which utilises locally sourced silicon to produce electronics.

name: Piedmont
detail: Piedmont holds the infamous distinction of being the home of Chungalomeningitis, a disease that killed over a billion people during the Age of War. The Piedmont Institute for Disease Control was formed shortly afterwards, in order to prevent further outbreaks.

name: Pierce
detail: The initial mining colony founded by the Taurian Concordat was annexed by the Federated Suns during the Reunification War.

name: Pietermaritzburg
detail: Pietermaritzburg was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pike
detail: Pike's population live in heavy stone structures as the planet's rocky surface is regularly swept by powerful windstorms. Pike is rich in metals and most of the population make their living as miners or supporting the mining industry on the planet.

name: Pilkhua
detail: An independent mining colony for centuries, it was annexed by the Draconis Combine during the initial years of the Star League.

name: Pilon
detail: Pilon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pilpala
detail: Pilpala recently changed hands when the Free Worlds League moved in a large number of mercenaries that dominated the few troops stationed there by the Capellan Confederation. The planet's mercantile population is uneasily adapting to the regime change.

name: Pinard
detail: Pinard was and is a Taurian manufacturing center, despite having its cities bombed into radioactive rubble during the Reunification War. The Taurians built new cities and new factories, leaving the dangerous ruins as an eternal reminder.

name: Pingree
detail: An independent mining colony for centuries, it joined the Free Worlds League during the initial years of the Star League.

name: Pinnacle
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era to ensure a monopoly on the world's uranium deposits.

name: Pinzolo
detail: Luckily for Pinzolo, it was settled by the Jacobson family themselves (they of Jacobson Haven fame). The Jacobson family brought their expertise with manufacturing to Pinzolo's lush fields and forests and the planet quickly became a manufacturing and industrial hub, one it remains to this day.

name: Piriapolis
detail: While visitors to Piriapolis are welcomed at its starport, the privilege of emigrating there is jealously guarded as a way of protecting the precious Lipizzaner horses that were once almost wiped out during a bandit raid.

name: Pitkin
detail: Annexed by the Federated Suns during the Reunification War, Pitkin is a quiet agricultural world with no particular claim to fame since then, apart from a military garrison.

name: Placida
detail: A mountainous world, Placida provides raw material to nearby worlds.

name: Planting
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the seabed.

name: Plataea
detail: Plataea was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pleiades Cluster
detail: The Pleiades (or Seven Sisters) is dominated by hot blue and extremely luminous B-type stars.

name: Pleione
detail: Pleione is a planet with a relatively small landmass - less than twenty percent of the surface of the planet is dry land, concentrated in a single continent named Jezrael.

name: Pliska
detail: Pliska was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Plymouth
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, it was incorporated into the Federated Suns before the Star League era.

name: Pobeda
detail: Originally one of the worlds of the Protectorate of Donegal, it became a defacto member of the Lyran Commonwealth when it formed.

name: Pocologan
detail: Pocologan was originally a part of the Timbuktu Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Point Barrow
detail: Point Barrow was originally settled to exploit the massive deposits of rare earth minerals. Aside from that, there is no reason for humans to be on the world. The only other interesting feature is the Point Barrow Military Academy.

name: Pojos
detail: Pojos, with its colored ice ring, is beautiful to look at but dangerous to approach. The planet specializes in botanical concerns, and the tolerances of the thorny Pojos Rose make it a desirable bloom across the Confederation.

name: Pokhara
detail: Pokhara was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Polcenigo
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Polcenigo was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison. The families of the forces that made up the garrison were the original colonists.

name: Pollux
detail: Pollux is an arid world that was settled early on in human expansion. It has significant heavy metal reserves, though its industrial development has been inhibited over the course of the Succession Wars as the FWL and LA have fought over the planet.

name: Pomme De Terre
detail: As of 3025, Pomme De Terre is considered the most productive agricultural world within the Draconis Combine. The value of this world was high due to the fact that many Combine worlds could not provide enough food for themselves.

name: Pomona
detail: Bitter cold and biting winds are constant companions on Pomona. The Sacellum only colonized the world in order to make use of its plentiful mineral wealth for their war machine which was always in need of raw resources. The few colonists making a life on Pomona are renown as some of the hardiest sons-of-bitches in Sanctuary space.

name: Pompey
detail: Pompey is a crucial Marian world. Home to Harian Mechanized Industries it employs vast numbers of slaves to meet the Marian Armed forces vicious appitite for fighting vehicles.

name: Pondicherry
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine in the run up to the Reunification War, it was used as a marshalling point for Star League forces.

name: Porrima
detail: Porrima has abundant, but not overwhelming, supplies of industrial metals, gemstones, and arable land. When originally settled, it was a paradise until the settlers discovered that every 62 years a neighbouring planet orbits close enough to cause horrific storms upon the surface.

name: Port Arthur
detail: Port Arthur is a relatively sparsely-populated world, owing largely to endemic root parasites within its soil that make farming difficult. However, it boasts incredible natural and mineral resources, crucial for military production.

name: Porthos
detail: The Porthos system was colonized by the faction known as the Inheritors. Foreswearing any military might and with no wealth, these worlds are of no use to anyone.

name: Portland
detail: A former Taurian world, Portland was invaded as part of the Taurian-Canopian war, but its inhabitants successfully repelled the Magistracy with guerilla tactics. Now independent, the population engages in subsistence farming and a slow trickle of food exports.

name: Port Moseby
detail: The planet itself is very plain and stable. Typical weather, terrain and resources focus life into the cities where the Lyran merchants have their colorful bazaars making it an important, if boring, trading hub.

name: The Rack
detail: The Rack was once a world in the Rim Worlds Republic during the Star League era. However, after that realm fell, Port Vail was lost and forgotten. Today, it endures as a pirate haven and a perpetual thorn in the side of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Potwin
detail: Settled by colonists fleeing Terra, it was incorporated into the Federated Suns before the Star League era.

name: Poulsbo
detail: A relatively poor world, much of the population works in mining or manual labour.

name: Poznan
detail: A rich world filled with farmlands and rich mountain ranges, it never the less has substantial socio economic problems.

name: Prato
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era due to it's extensive farmland availability.

name: Praxton
detail: Praxton is the Outworlds Alliance's primary producer of precious fusion engines, used in their tanks, AeroFighters, and Mechs. As such it is a crucial part of the Alliance's military logistics, and a constant target of attacks.

name: Predlitz
detail: The original settlers of Prediltz fled the world when the Draconic Combine invaded during the Age of War, leaving only the stupid or brave behind.

name: Premana
detail: Even at the height of the Star League era Premana was considered something of an isolated system, as ships travelling to the system via inhabited systems - rather than taking the riskier option of travelling through uninhabited systems - were forced to either approach from the Rimward direction, or journey outside of Commonwealth space

name: Pressby
detail: Pressby was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pressville
detail: Pressville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Preston (CC)
detail: By 2271, there was two worlds colonised by settlers from Terra. The clerk in charge of system naming should have by rights demanded one change their name to prevent duplicates but they couldn't be arsed.

name: Preston (FWL)
detail: By 2271, there was two worlds colonised by settlers from Terra. The clerk in charge of system naming should have by rights demanded one change their name to prevent duplicates but they couldn't be arsed.

name: Primus
detail: Primus is a fertile world of vast river floodplains, and its land is given over to highly-automated farming. Small farming communities serve the logistical needs of the automated farms, and a single spaceport moves food off-world.

name: Principia
detail: Principia is the seat of the judiciary for the Capellan Confederation and, as such, caters to the needs of Capellan nobles who have taken it as a vacation home. It also has courts dedicated to adjudicating mercenary contracts with the Liao.

name: Princton
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns early in the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Prinis Prime
detail: Devastated during the Reunification War, the population has revitalised many of the poisoned continents.

name: Prix
detail: This major manufacturing and commercial world is known for the massive typhoons that occasionally form in the vast tropical ocean. During storm season, the skyscrapers of the coastal cities seal themselves against the gale-force winds.

name: Procyon
detail: Procyon's rocky soil is ill-suited to agriculture but rich in heavy metals. While not possessed of any military industry, the ouput from the planets mines are used to produce a variety of civilian vehicles.

name: Promised Land
detail: Promised Land is one of the major ports of entry for Lyran traders entering League space, the city closest to the planet's primary spaceport containing a magnificent bazaar teeming with an endless array of merchants, wholesalers and speculators

name: Propus
detail: Settled as one of the Capellan Commonality worlds, it became a defacto member of the Capellan Confederation when it formed.

name: Proserpina
detail: Proserpina was one of the Core Worlds housing heavy industry companies such as Guided Technologies and Bulldog Enterprises. These factories, and many others, exploited the petrochemical and mineral resources of the planet directly and refined metals from the ores in the world were shipped to many other planets. During the succession wars, two out the five continents were rendered uninhabitable nuclear wastelands, which the population hasn't recovered from to this day.

name: Protection
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns early in the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Prydain
detail: Prydain was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pula
detail: Pula was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Purvo
detail: Settled by the Capellan Confederation during the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Pusht-i-rud
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Puttalam
detail: Puttalam was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Pyrrhus
detail: Technically part of the Taurian Concordat, Pyrrhus is a dreary rock where convicts are turned loose with a pickaxe and a pat on the back, there to make a poor living as a miner, or, more likely, join one of the resident pirate gangs.

name: Qalzi
detail: Qalzi is a relatively recent addition to Aurigan holdings. The cold and rocky Terran world is in a legal limbo, with the Taurian Concordat maintaining that their original colony, since abandoned, gives them a prior claim on the system.

name: Qanatir
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Qandahar
detail: Qandahar is a world that was totally exploited by humanity for its vast natural resources. Unfortunately the early settlers didn't show any care in handling the output of their factories and this has led the ecosystem of Qandahar to collapse.

name: Qarahta
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Qauata
detail: A minor and mostly unremarkable system, Qauata is only truly notable for the great defensive fortifications that dot its surface, though who they're meant to guard against is somewhat unclear as there aren't many people in this region of space.

name: Qualip (Kerensky's Vision 3130+)
detail: Qualip is the site of a failed colony which died out due to an experiment with G-23 Paxilon Hydrochlorate, a chemical compound added to the air processors in order to pacify the populace.

name: Quantraine
detail: Quantraine was devastated during the Reunification war and became depopulated until recently. New colonists are still striving to set up a new colony.

name: Quarell
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Quarell was considered important enough to host a SLDF garrison thanks to it's rich boreholes.

name: Quatre Belle
detail: Quatre Belle is a lightly-populated, agricultural world. The planet's soil was rich in nutrients from volcanic activity and the system's F-class primary provided abundant energy for the world to be covered in lush vegetation.

name: Quelimane
detail: Quelimane was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Quemoy
detail: The icy world of Quernoy was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Sarna Supremacy prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation

name: Quentin
detail: Despite its tainted atmosphere, the planet of Quentin has been a prize for most of the Succession Wars due to its intact 'Mech production facilities. Recently captured by the Combine, its facilities pump out MAD-3Rs and AS-7Ks for the DCMS.

name: Quiberas
detail: Quiberas is a core world within the Outworlds Alliance, though it still bears the marks of the Reunification war where the Star League burned cities and populations across the Periphery.

name: Quilino
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era to claim the vast mineral wealth under the surface.

name: Quimberton
detail: Despite a lack of natural resources or majestic scenery, Quimberton has managed to become a recreational hub, mostly due to vast estates it rents out as timeshares to well-off people who want a taste of true wealth.

name: Quimper (Chirac 3130+)
detail: Quimper (Chirac 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Quimper
detail: Quimper was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Quincy
detail: The Quincy system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was incorporated into the Federated Suns during or shortly before the Age of War

name: Quines
detail: Quines was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Quirinus
detail: A beautiful garden world, Quirinus serves as an immense breadbasket for the Sanctuary Worlds, growing a vast amount of food that is exported across the entire region. Among its most famous exports are Quirinus wheat, which makes a wonderful rich dark bread that's wildly popular, and the fruit of the Sacellum quince tree, which makes a tart and aromatic jam that goes well with the aforementioned bread.

name: Quittacas
detail: The Quittacas system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was incorporated into the Federated Suns during or shortly before the Age of War

name: Qurayyat
detail: Qurayyat was discovered and colonized in the early to mid-twenty-second century by settlers from the Middle East who were drawn to the vast desert oasis on the surface.

name: Raballa
detail: Raballa was once a vast food exporter, but in the late Succession Wars the world's weather patterns shifted. With this shift in weather the amount of food it could grow declined and the population is slowly declining.

name: Radlje
detail: Settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era to claim the vast petroleum fields.

name: Radostov
detail: Before the fall of the Star League, Radostov was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Radstadt
detail: Radstadt is mostly known for a unique wood, the Radstadt pine which, when processed, shimmers like gold. The decentralized population is supplied with food from the planet's rich oceans

name: Raetia
detail: Raetia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ragusa
detail: Ragusa was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rahne
detail: Rahne is a small world without adequate water or growing seasons. Major dust storms fling themselves across the planet creating a need to protect exposed machinery, which constantly churns through the vast fields of radioactives.

name: Rajkot
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era due to the vast germanium deposits under the polar ice caps.

name: Raldamax
detail: The Raldamax system was settled by the Outworlds Alliance during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War by refugees from the worlds seized by the Star League.

name: Raman
detail: The Raman system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra and was an independent world prior to joining the Federated Suns.

name: Ramen
detail: Ramen was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ramgarh
detail: Settled by prisoners from the Draconis Combine during the initial years of the Star League, it remains one of the less pleasant penal colonies within the Draconis Combine.

name: Ramona
detail: The Ramona system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra and was an independent world prior to joining the Federated Suns.

name: Ramora
detail: A warm, semi-tropical world, Ramora is home to small industrial complexes for United Outworlders Corporation and Ravenna Electronics.

name: Ramsau
detail: Ramsau is a large cold desert with ice across half the planet, and a day six times longer than it ought to be thanks to it's position as an almost tidally locked world.

name: Randar
detail: Randar was part of the Capellan Commonality before joining the Capellan Confederation. It supplies nearby worlds with electronics and timber products.

name: Raphael
detail: Raphael is a mainly agricultural world that was part of the Sian Commonwealth before joining the Confederation centuries ago.

name: Rapla
detail: Rapla was originally a part of the Timbuktu Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war

name: Rasalas
detail: Annexed by the Free Worlds League during the initial years of the Star League.

name: Rasalgethi
detail: A warm world with a light industrial base, Rasalgethi is entirely self sufficient.

name: Rasalhague
detail: The capital of the newly re-created Free Rasalhauge Republic, Rassalhague has long been an important industrial and agricultural world.

name: Rastaban
detail: Home to Rastaban Agricultural, one of the key agricultural transport companies within the Commonwealth.

name: Recife
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era due to the vast germanium deposits under the polar ice caps.

name: Redfield
detail: Redfield boasts several large plains well-suited to growing crops and raising herd animals, with a thick iron deposit under the surface in many areas - hence the name of 'Redfield'

name: Redondo
detail: Settled by colonists from the Federated Suns in the years leading up to the formation of the Star League. It is now an important agri-world with numerous Star League era agri-domes.

name: Reese Station
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Reese Station was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Refuel Base Gamma
detail: Refuel Base Gamma is located in the rimward region of the Deep Periphery, close to the coreward border of the Vul Rift. The nearest identified inhabited system is the Deep Periphery system known as Doggerbank.

name: Regis Roost
detail: Regis Roost is filled with fungal life, in a dizzying array of forms; fungal 'plants', 'fish' and even 'animals' comprise the complex biosphere of the world. Consequently, the air is thick with spores. Visitors are prone to an unpleasant illness known as 'spore-lung'.

name: Regulus
detail: Once the capital world of the Principality of Regulus, it remains an important world. During the Star League era, SLDF troops would form part of the honor guard for the ruling family of the Principality of Regulus.

name: Reinbak
detail: Reinbak was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Reinhardstein
detail: Reinhardstein was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Reisling's Planet
detail: Annexed by the Draconis Combine during the initial years of the Star League for it's vast rubidium deposits.

name: Reisterstown
detail: Settled by the Federated Suns during the Star League era due to the vast germanium deposits under the polar ice caps.

name: Relevow
detail: Annexed by the Capellan Confederation during the initial years of the Star League.

name: Remagen
detail: During the Star League era, Remagen was the site of the annual Remagen Rally, a military exercise for jump troops.

name: Remshield
detail: Remshield exports it's vast mineral wealth from it's capital city, aptly named 'Mineral City'

name: Remulac
detail: "Habited" the description in your star atlas says, and nothing more.  It seems like there should definitely be more information, but once you visit you'll understand.

name: Renfield
detail: One of the original planets of the Taurian Concordat, Renfield has a deep purple nutrient-rich ocean that produces the raw materials for most of the planet's thriving industries. The residents are known for being particularly antisocial.

name: Rennes
detail: Rennes was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Renorsal
detail: Renorsal was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Renown
detail: Renown is a Terran paradise when the skies are clear, which unfortunately doesn't happen very often. The planet is subject to vast tornadoes and 'meteorologist' is an essential position in Renown's mostly-automated factories and farms.

name: Renren
detail: Renren was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rentz
detail: Rentz is a habitable world with breathable atmosphere. The MacLean Valley on Rentz is a pleasant rural landscape with towns, extensive farms, and scattered grain silos as well as rivers, forests, and abandoned mine shafts.

name: Repulse
detail: Repulse is a lush agricultural world with valuable mining deposits accessed through vast gashes at the rocky poles. Despite the planetary resources, the population remains low due to an undesirable and mercurial climate.

name: Restitution
detail: Restitution was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rest Stop
detail: The installation known as Rest Stop is located in the system in the Deep Periphery cataloged by the Star League as SLSC M9III.2855, the site of a Star League era Recharge Station thanks to the suns amazing potential.

name: Revel
detail: Revel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Revivim
detail: Settled by colonists from the Lyran Commonwealth during the formation of the Star League.

name: Rexburg
detail: Annexed by the Free Worlds League during the initial years of the Star League.

name: Reykavis
detail: A small farming combine in the Illyrian Palatinate, Reykavis manages to eke out a good living from the harsh terrain and serves as a breadbasket for the Palatinate.

name: Rezak's Hole
detail: The history of Rezak's Hole is intertwined with that of the pirate group known as the Band of the Damned, pirates that raid nearby Combine worlds with little regard for human life.

name: Rhodos (Runrig 2822+)
