detail: Rhodos (Runrig 2822+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Richmond
detail: Richmond is a pleasant and very habitable planet, with breathable atmosphere, forests and rivers.

name: Richmond's World (Murrain 3025+)
detail: Once a lush world, the initial colonists brought a pictovirus with them that ended up wiping all life off the planet - down to the smallest microbes. Now quarantined, Murrain is best left to it's own devices.

name: Richvale
detail: Richvale is a humid and hot world best known for the Quickscell Company plants on the surface

name: Ridderkerk
detail: Settled by colonists from the Lyran Commonwealth during the formation of the Star League.

name: Ridgebrook
detail: The lightly populated world of Ridgebrook is best known for the battles fought there during the Reunification War. The world's surface and orbital space are littered with military debris, making salvage one of the planet's major industries.

name: Riga
detail: Riga is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, and trades many aquatic goods with nearby worlds.

name: Rigil Kentarus
detail: Previously called Alpha Centauri, Regil Kent or Rigil Kentarus was also one of the Prime or First Circuit A-Class Hyperpulse Generator stations of the SLCOMNET and ComStar HPG Network.  The only moon is called Riken Minor. Highest native life: Mammals.

name: Rijeka
detail: Settled by colonists from the Lyran Commonwealth during the formation of the Star League.

name: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #11
detail: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #11 was a station settled in this system by the Rim Worlds Republic but subsequently abandoned... Or was it?

name: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #27
detail: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #27 was a station settled in this system by the Rim Worlds Republic but subsequently abandoned, before being found by pirates who settled here.

name: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #4
detail: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #4 was a station settled in this system by the Rim Worlds Republic but subsequently abandoned... Or was it?

name: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #7
detail: Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #7 was a station settled in this system by the Rim Worlds Republic but subsequently abandoned... Or was it?

name: Rio
detail: When first settled, Rio was a beautiful world covered in scenic valleys. With little to export, the world instead became known as a prime vacation spot, artists colony, and tri-vid production planet and one of the richest worlds in the Star League. Fierce nuclear bombardments throughout the Succession Wars have rendered the world dead.

name: Risin
detail: A recently discovered Star League cache has brought other visitors to this sleepy agricultural world.

name: Roadside
detail: Roadside was settled in the late 24th century to take advantage of the vast amounts of fertile soil. These vast plains were perfect for agricultural production of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Robinson
detail: Originally settled during the Terran Exodus, Robinson became one of the 5 founding systems of the Federated Suns, and remains a key system to the Feds to this day.  It is home to the recently rebuilt Robinson Battle Academy.

name: Robsart
detail: The site of the largest naval battle in the Reunification War, Robsart's orbital space is choked with debris even now. During its pacification, the SLDF used orbital bombardments against civilians, damaging the climate and killing a quarter million people.

name: Rochelle
detail: Rochelle is a rainy world with violent thunderstorms. It's industrial base was mostly destroyed during the Succession Wars, leaving the atmosphere poisoned.

name: Rochers
detail: Rochers was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rochester
detail: Rochester features wide plains full of arable land and pristine oceans. Unfortunately the soil and water also contain a series of trace elements that combine in Terran lifeforms to form poison, which led to the abandonment of the colony until technology was discovered during the Star League era which made the world habitable again.

name: Rockland
detail: Rockland is a small planet with large mountain range across the surface which gave it its name. Most of its population is concentrated on the southern continent called Granite, which is where the capital city is. The northern continent, Limerock, has numerous spread-out settlements concentrated on mining and quarrying.

name: Rockwellawan
detail: Formerly a Magistracy world, Rockwellawan has found new life as an independent mining colony. During the abortive Taurian-Canopian War, the Taurians landed on the planet, but were unable to decisively engage the Magistracy.

name: Rocky
detail: Rocky was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rodigo
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the formation of the Star League.

name: Rohinjan
detail: Annexed by the Free Worlds League during the initial years of the formation of the Star League.

name: Rollis
detail: Temperate Rollis is the source of a rare and highly valued variety of wood, and, consequentially, a busy black market. It also serves as a jumping-off point for those planning an adventurous journey into the Periphery.

name: Romita
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the initial years of the formation of the Star League.

name: Romulus
detail: The home of the Romulans, pointy eared ali%%%. ERROR. Holovid database corrupted.

name: Rondane
detail: The capital world of the powerful Rondane Syndicate, Rondane is an economic powerhouse among the Isles, largely due to its alliance with the Helena Collective of Ingvolstand. That economic and political alliance has strengthened both worlds considerably and let the shadowy Syndicate grow in influence and power quietly.

name: Rondon
detail: Rondon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Ronel
detail: Ronel is an inhospitable world located close to its parent star. Though it possesses significant mineral wealth, the planet was never settled properly. Instead mining companies assigns workers to multi-year contracts on the world and then rotates them off-world

name: Rosamond
detail: A young and geologically active world, Rosamond joined the Federated Suns during the formation of the Star league.

name: Roscoff
detail: Roscoff was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rosendal
detail: Rosendal was a cold but habitable world when it was settled just after the Reunification War, but the same instability that produced its magnificent rings slowly shifted its orbit until the planet was glacier-bound and howling ice storms swept its surface.

name: Rosepine
detail: Settled by colonists from the Federated Suns during the Star League era. It was named after a local tree with viscous thorns.

name: Rosetta
detail: Rosetta was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rosice
detail: Settled by colonists from the Lyran Commonwealth during the formation of the Star League.

name: Rosiclare
detail: Settled by colonists from the Federated Suns during the formation of the Star League.

name: Rover
detail: After its rediscovery by Interstellar Expeditions during their exploration of the region, Rover has evidently been the subject of some kind of experiment conducted by the Star League due to the vast network of satellites in orbit.

name: Rowe
detail: Settled by colonists from Croatia during the Exodus from Terra, Rowe joined the Federated Suns in the years before the formation of the Star League.

name: Royal
detail: Royal was one of the worlds engulfed in conflict during what became known variously as the Second Hidden War of the Star League era, also known as the War of Davion Succession. DCMS infantry forces captured the First Prince, pulling him from his cockpit, forcing him to kneel and then beheading him.

name: Royal Foxx
detail: Royal Foxx has three continents named Skulk, Waagosh and Vixen, which hosts the capital city of, Reynard. The planet was occupied once by the SLDF during the Reunification War, but its inhabitants have seen little in the half millenia since.

name: Royalston
detail: Royalston was an important trading world within the St. Ives Mercantile League  thanks to numerous jump points within easy reach of the planet.

name: Rubigen
detail: Rubigen is a small, dark, and cold world with over half of its surface locked away under ice. Over 15% of the admiralty of the Draconis Combine comes from Rubigen, proving the addage that tough times create tough people.

name: Ruchbah
detail: Michaelson Heavy Industries is headquartered on Ruchbah, and is the main source of income for the world.

name: Rudolpho
detail: Settled by the Outworlds Alliance during the Star League era, this quiet world avoids attention for the most part.

name: Rukbat
detail: Rukbat is a poisoned jewel of a world. Despite the abundant plant and animal life, the vast mineral resources, and a climate much like Terras, the environment is totally incompatible with human and Terran lifeforms.

name: Ruschegg
detail: Ruschegg once rebelled against the Free Worlds League, but mercy granted by Marion Marik has ensured that the population is now fiercely loyal.

name: Rushaven
detail: Rushaven didn't attract significant attention from the Star League and Draconis Combine forces during Operation UNION HOLD.

name: Ryans Fate
detail: A hot, arid world with a single, shallow, briny sea, Ryans Fate survives on flood farming in the brief rainy seasons, and mining high-quality crystals and fissionable materials from the extensive caverns that honeycomb the planet's surface.

name: Ryde
detail: Ryde is a cold world with a great deal of volcanic activity. It is an important manufacturer of pharmaceuticals, water purifiers, and chemicals (including explosives) and therefore enjoys a permanent defensive garrison of Lyran 'Mech Regiments.

name: Ryerson
detail: Most of Ryerson's lowlands are taken up by a single massive megacity, carefully planned in the reconstruction following the Second Succession War. Industrial centers in the highlands supply raw materials to the factories at the outskirts of the city.

name: Rypful
detail: Rypful was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Rzhishchev
detail: Rzhishchev was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and remained fiercely independent until eventually joining the Free Worlds League over three centuries later.

name: Saaremaa
detail: Saaremaa was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and was part of the Alliance of Galedon until eventually joining the Draconis Combine over a century later.

name: Sabanillas
detail: Gold is only one of the precious metals found here, and the other rare metals, minerals, and gems, as well as the more common metal ores, make Sabinillas a valuable resource center. Sabanillas Mining Company has an almost mafia like grip on the government.

name: Sabik
detail: Sabik is a sparsely populated desert world in a strategically important location. While there are some profitable mining operations on the planet, most of the small population exists to support the garrisoned 11th Lyran Regulars.

name: Sackville
detail: Settled during the Star League era, the green rolling hills of Sackville are known for producing pipeweed and Bagginses.

name: Sacromonte
detail: This subterranean colony is excavated into a barren rocky planet. It serves as a critical shipping and travel link between the Aurigan region and the Magistracy. Trade, both legal and otherwise, thrives here.

name: Sadachbia
detail: Most of Sadachbia's inhabitants live along the large islands scattered through the northernmost ocean for the simple reason that the most of the inland areas are harsh deserts.

name: Sadalbari
detail: Sadalbari is a mostly tropical world; most of the two major continents, Aberlani and Beth'lamel, and the island continent of New Kenya are covered with rainforests and jungles.

name: Sadurni
detail: The agricultural world of Sadurni once served as the HQ of the SLDF 7th Army. Since then it has traded hands between Liao and Marik several times. The small population is spread out in rambling rural villages and cities, serving the surrounding farms.

name: Safe Port
detail: Safe Port was an important trading world within the St. Ives Mercantile League  thanks to numerous jump points within easy reach of the planet.

name: Saffel
detail: Saffel is an artic world along the Davion/Kurita border. Both a common target and staging area for attacks between the two nations, Staffel was only just seized by the Kuritans in 3039.

name: Saggina
detail: Discovered by an eagle eyed private citizen as part of the OBT movement, Saggina is a long way from anywhere.

name: Saginaw
detail: Saginaw was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and remained fiercely independent until eventually joining the Federated Suns over a century later.

name: Saiph
detail: The headquarters of Sitwell Corporation, the main competitor to Bluth Corporation. Saiph joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Sakai
detail: An independent world for centuries until annexed by the Draconis Combine. During the final years of the Star League, Sakai was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Sakhalin (CC)
detail: The icy world of Sakhalin was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Sarna Supremacy prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation

name: Sakhalin (LC)
detail: Sakhalin marks one edge of the area of space within which the interstellar trade company Skye Traders was the dominant commercial interest, and was once host to an SLDF Garrison.

name: Sakhara
detail: Sakhara V was originally settled for its wide variety of rare earth metals. The harsh local terrain, mostly desert, also serves as a demanding training environment. With that in mind, the Sakhara Academy was established here.

name: Sakuranoki
detail: Sakuranoki was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and was part of the Alliance of Galedon until eventually joining the Draconis Combine over a century later.

name: Salardion
detail: Once a minor travel hub, this system was quarantined due to an incurable, disfiguring viral plague. The moons serve as bases for pirate activity, but the status of the population on the surface is unknown.

name: Salem
detail: Salem is the location of a significant percentage of the defense manufacturing that supplies the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns.

name: Salford
detail: Home to the University of Salford, it's lessons focus more on practical applications than theory.

name: Salisberg
detail: Salisberg was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Saltillo
detail: During the Star League era both Saltillo and the nearby Millungera system were jointly administered by the Free Worlds League and the Star League, which sparked conflict.

name: Saltural
detail: Saltural was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Saltville
detail: Saltville was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Salur
detail: Settled by the Federation of Oriente during the initial years after the Exodus from Terra.

name: Salvende
detail: Salvende was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Samantha
detail: One of the founding planets of the Taurian Concordat, Samantha is a large planet where cold-weather entertainment thrives and a broad range of manufacturing industries benefit from the low temperatures.

name: San Carlos
detail: San Carlos was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sanda
detail: Sanda was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and was part of the Alliance of Galedon until eventually joining the Draconis Combine over a century later.

name: Sanilac
detail: Sanilac was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and remained fiercely independent until eventually joining the Federated Suns over a century later.

name: San Nicolas
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the initial years of the formation of the Star League.

name: Santa-Ana
detail: Santa-Ana was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Santana
detail: Santiago IV is a surface garrison located in the Deep Periphery, near Kinbrace and Ramsey. During Operation Revival, Santiago IV was controlled by Clan Jade Falcon.

name: Santander (Santander's World)
detail: Santander is also known as Santander's World. The infamous pirate Helmar Valasek is believed to launch operations from this planet.

name: Santiago (Clan)
detail: Santiago IV is a surface garrison located in the Deep Periphery, near Kinbrace and Ramsey.

name: Santiago (OA)
detail: Santiago (OA) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sanurcha (Ildrong 2750+)
detail: Sanurcha (Ildrong 2750+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sanurcha
detail: Sanurcha was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Saonara
detail: The Saonara system was home to a military outpost prior to the Reunification War, and became a colony world after the end of the War.

name: Sapienza
detail: Sapienza was originally a part of the Timbuktu Province of the Rim Worlds Republic and was conquered by the Lyran Commonwealth during the 2773-2775 Republic-Commonwealth war.

name: Sappho
detail: Sappho was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sappir
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the initial years of the formation of the Star League.

name: Saravan
detail: Settled by the Lyran Commonwealth during the initial years of the formation of the Star League.

name: Sardis
detail: Sardis was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sargasso
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Sargasso was the host of a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Sarikavak
detail: Colonised by the Rim Worlds Republic before the era of the Star League.

name: Sarkel
detail: Sarkel was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sarmaxa
detail: An industrialised world of grasslands and forests, Sarmaxa exports many products across the Inner Sphere thanks to the Tao 'Mechworks facility.

name: Sarna
detail: Sarna has a dense population spread across seven mountainous heavily industrialized continents. The other seventy percent of the planet is deep saltwater oceans.

name: Sarpsborg
detail: After the original Terran colony was violently destroyed during the Age of War, the Star League tried to re-establish a functioning colony here with marginal success.

name: Sartu (Bastille 3130+)
detail: Sartu (Bastille 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Satalice
detail: Covered in wide volcanic plains and plagued by storms, Satalice still has enough oases of beauty to support a moderate-sized population and even a 'Mech production plant.

name: Sauk City
detail: Sauk City was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and remained fiercely independent until eventually joining the Federated Suns over a century later.

name: Saumur
detail: Saumur was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Saunemin
detail: Saunemin was settled by colonists during the Exodus from Terra, and remained fiercely independent until eventually joining the Federated Suns over a century later.

name: Savannah
detail: The major manufacturer on Savannah is Technicron Manufacturing, which is one of the medium sized military hardware manufacturers in the Free Worlds League, producing both a smattering of BattleMechs as well as JumpShips and WarShips.

name: Savinsville
detail: Savinsville is best known for the behavior of its satellites. Every thirty three years Schlera, Iris and Pupil (the moons) line up in the sky in such a way that they resemble a human eye. Luthien Armor Works built a factory on this world, which led to the population expanding quickly.

name: Savonburg
detail: Savonburg is home to the Colleges of Savonburg, which educate millions of students every year. Recently, mysterious drop ships have been reported landing in the uninhabited continent of Solestra, with rumours abounding as to their purpose ranging from time travel experiments to alien invasion.

name: Sawyer
detail: Settled during the initial years of the formation of the Star League. Notable only for the small BattleMech arena circuit on its surface.

name: Sax
detail: An ancient water world dotted with thousands of island chains, Sax is the home of a Liao training facility as well as several specialized research campuses that rely on the planet's tectonic stability.

name: Scarborough
detail: Scarborough Licensing PLC is all that remains of Scarborough Manufacturing, a once massive manufacturing complex that was destroyed centuries ago in the First Succession War.

name: Scheat
detail: Scheat has basic metal ores in its crust and rich fertile soil, and is known for exporting iron, aluminium, lumber and textiles.

name: Schedar
detail: Schedar was settled for its mineral resources. These minerals are key ingredients in semiconductors, and the harsh desert environment minimizes the incoming settlers.

name: Schererville
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League due to it's easily accessible petroleum deposits.

name: Scheuerheck
detail: Scheurheck once rebelled against the Free Worlds League, but mercy granted by Marion Marik has ensured that the population of Schuerheck is now fiercely loyal.

name: Schiedam
detail: Settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League due to it's easily accessible gemstone deposits.

name: Schirmeck
detail: Schirmeck is a world with little industry, but is relatively self sufficient thanks to abundant agriculture and lumber.

name: Schmitt
detail: Schmitt was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Schrim
detail: Schrim was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Schuyler
detail: Dharma HyperSpace operates one of the last JumpShip facilities in the Inner Sphere in this system, with numerous other industries propped up by the vast mineral requirements.

name: Schwartz
detail: The capital city of Schwartztadt lies near to the Komache Fields, a vast empty plain suitable for pastoral farming.

name: Schwellenbach
detail: The capital of the Mallard Republic, Schwellenbach is a world wrapped in red tape. Nothing gets done here without extensive time in committee, leading to its nickname through the sector as the Waiting World, since all you do here is wait on bureaucracy.

name: Scituate
detail: The forested world of Scituate was originally settled by the St Ives Mercantile League thanks to it's many warp points.

name: Scudder
detail: Prior to the fall of the Star League, Scudder was a lightly-populated world rich in germanium. Multiple mining sites were scattered over the world's four large continents. The germanium mined on this world was used in the construction of K-F drives in dozens of shipyards.

name: Sebha
detail: Sebha was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Second Chance
detail: Second Chance is still littered with battle debris centuries after the First Succession War, where numerous drop ships and war ships were brought down over the surface.

name: Second Try
detail: After the initial colony landing site was destroyed in an earthquake, the colonists moved to a new one and renamed their planet Second Try.

name: Seginus
detail: Seginus is a planet in slow decline. Bad weather paired with a long in system transit time has led to trade with the planet declining over time, although the long travel times also keeps the planet peaceful as it dissuades most raiders.

name: Seiduts
detail: Seiduts is described as being a rocky world, sparsely populated, with forests and jungles around the equator.

name: Sekulmun
detail: Sekulmun is described as being a beautiful world, sparsely populated, with volcanoes around the equator.

name: Semenyih
detail: The dangerously high temperatures on Semenyih are just one of the dangers the miners here face.

name: Semichi
detail: The ice plains of Semichi are inhospitable to most life, but are home to a breed of bear similar to a terrestrial Kodiak.

name: Sendai
detail: Sendai was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sendalor
detail: Sendalor's inland forests are home to the Manx Treecat, a rare delicacy that is only found on this world.

name: Senftenberg
detail: Senftenberg's industrial base in the Cavez Valley was destroyed during the Second Succession War, which thankfully spared most of the populace.

name: Senorbi
detail: Senorbi was used centuries ago as a staging post during the Reunification War, which has led many treasure hunters to the surface to look for caches.

name: Sentarus
detail: Sentarus was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Serenity
detail: Serenity was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sertar
detail: Apart from a few frozen lakes and rivers, Sertar is dry. Basins of red dust exist where oceans should be.

name: Setubal
detail: The planet Setubal is a desert world with very hot equatorial zones. Human habitation is only possible in the polar regions with their tropical and subtropical climate. Settled for its abundant subterranean water supplies, Setubal features extensive cave systems which are used to grow edible fungi.

name: Seuta Bimyeong
detail: Seuta Bimyeong was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Seven Lands (Garotte 3130+)
detail: Seven Lands (Garotte 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sevon
detail: Sevon - is a lightly-populated and lightly industrialized world with a single moon. A mutual distrust of outsiders is common across the world, due to the devastation caused to their world during the Succession Wars.

name: Sevren
detail: The presence of radioactive materials within the crust of Sevren support the burgeoning industrial base, which offers power plants to numerous worlds across the Inner Sphere

name: Shady Palms
detail: Placed deep in the Deep Periphery astrogeographical feature known as the Orion Rift, the installation known colloquially as Shady Palms is located within the asteroid belt around the the yellow-white super giant star catalogued as SLSC F81a.0086.

name: Shahr Kord
detail: The forested moon of Shahr Kord was originally settled by the Rim Worlds Republic.

name: Shalaine
detail: Shalaine was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Shardayne
detail: Shardayne was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sharpe (Obeedah 3025+)
detail: Sharpe vanished from maps during the Third Succession War, but the Argo still contains it's location. I wonder what is there?

name: Sharqah
detail: Sharqah was once the base for an SLDF Division. After they left, the world's most notable feature was a series of religious retreats and pilgrimage sites in the world's craggy mountains.

name: Shasta
detail: Settled by colonists from South America during the Exodus from Terra. Shasta is home to large amounts of native wildlife such as the Skatha Ape, Agouti Rat and Lute Shrike.

name: Shaul Khala
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Shaul Khala was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Shaun (Burl 2822+)
detail: Shaun (Burl 2822+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Shaun
detail: The Capellans made two attempts to build an outpost on this lifeless rock, once in the Star League era and again after the First Succession War. The promised mineral wealth of the planet never materialized, and it was abandoned as too marginal to maintain.

name: Shaunavon
detail: The population of Shaunavon is mostly confined to domes and subterranean facilities. Deep fissures in the crust allow miners to reach rare earth minerals, and the planet's economy is built around their extraction.

name: Shawnee
detail: Iroquois Machinery Limited is the primary exporter of goods from Shawnee, a heavily industrialised world.

name: Sheliak
detail: Sheliak is a minor planet with few resources, and very little garrison.

name: Shensi
detail: Shensi is a Earth-like world, which is most notable for its extensive forestry and mineral reserves. It has three continents (Klondike, Mongot and Kungara), which are extensively forested.

name: Shenwan
detail: Shenwan's inland seas are home to the Manx Kipper, a rare delicacy that is only found on this world.

name: Sheratan
detail: Sheratan is described as being a beautiful world, sparsely populated, with forests and jungles around the equator. Sheratan joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Sheridan (FWL)
detail: Dense jungles of light purple fungal towers cover Sheridan, with kilometers of large plateaus with steep sides breaking through the glowing canopy.

name: Sherwood
detail: Sherwood is one of those worlds that was eminently suitable for human colonisation without the need for terraforming, with a flourishing ecology that features towering, tree-like plants that reach heights of more than 100 metres.

name: Shiba
detail: The hot, dry, high-gravity world of Shiba is a center for mining and manufacturing, and its two billion inhabitants live in an endless urban sprawl that surrounds the factories that drive the world's economy.

name: Shibukawa
detail: Shibukawa is the world where Cholobara grows, a fruit from which a potent and valuable but perishable aphrodisiac wine can be made.

name: Shiloh
detail: Shiloh is an unappealing planet, inhabitted almost entirely by a splinter religious group known as the Exituri. The Exituri shun interstellar politics and advanced technology, and so Shiloh has remained an unimportant and barely inhabitted world.

name: Shimoda
detail: Shimoda was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Shimonita
detail: Shimonita possesses a single large industrialised continent surrounded by islands. The surrounding ocean is constantly whipped into a frenzy by massive storm activity that perpetually forms in Shimonita's atmosphere.

name: Shimonoseki
detail: Transport pilots tell stories about the horrific winds over Shimonoseki which have wrecked numerous dropships.

name: Shimosuwa
detail: Shimosuwa was conquered by the Draconis Combine during the First Succession War, which resulted in massive civilian casualties and an end to the industrial base on the planet.

name: Shinonoi
detail: Shinonoi has a long, mild growing season, fertile land and ample native livestock, which continues to this day. Great mineral wealth was found during the Star League era which further boosted it's economy.

name: Shionoha
detail: Shionoha is a quiet, industrialised world that has slightly too much nitrogen in the atmosphere for human comfort, requiring either special medication or respirators for long periods outside.

name: Shipka
detail: Shipka was discovered by traders under the command of Captain Phillip Shipka out of St. Andre who were trying to reach Highspire. After exploring the system they discovered that the world was rich in natural resources and possessed abundant fresh water.

name: Shipton
detail: Shipton was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Shira
detail: Shira was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Shiri
detail: Shiri was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Shiro
detail: As one of the first colonised worlds, Shiro is a heavily industrialised world with major factories of Irian BattleMechs Unlimited and Grumman Amalgamated producing massive quantities of material.

name: Shirotori
detail: Brusk, Massona and Meijer are the trio of cities that make up the Triumverate government of Shirotori.

name: Shitara
detail: Shitara's inhospitable desert like surface was originally settled not for agricultural or manufacturing reasons, but to serve as a regional transportation hub. With access to many star systems, Shitara is now a wealthywaystation and refueling point for expeditions into the further reaches of the Inner Sphere.

name: Shoreham
detail: Shoreham has vast mudflats that criss cross it's continents.

name: Shubuta
detail: Sighisoara has vast fungal growths that criss cross it's continents, used for chemical and medicinal purposes.

name: Shuen Wan
detail: The planet Shuen Wan is the homeworld of the Kincha fruit, a delicacy that resists all attempts to grow it on other worlds.

name: Sialkot
detail: Sialkot was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sian
detail: Sian is the modern capital world of the Capellan Confederation, noted be the best defended planet of House Liao. It is the home of much of House Liao's major industries and political leadership.

name: Sichuan
detail: Sichuan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sidon
detail: Sidon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Siendou
detail: Siendou is a rocky, resource-rich world and an established constitutional theocracy. Adherants to the global faith of Siendou are prohibited from serving in a national military.

name: Sierpc
detail: Sierpc is a quiet, average world that has slightly too much ozone in the atmosphere for human comfort, requiring either special medication or respirators.

name: Sierra
detail: Vast tundras filled with mineral rich rock ensure the population of Sierra is at least well paid amidst the inhospitable environment.

name: Sighisoara
detail: Sighisoara has vast mud flats that criss cross it's continents, used for mining and recreational purposes.

name: Sigma Mare
detail: Despite being a small, cold and inhospitable world Sigma Mare is rather overpopulated. By the end of the Third Succession War Sigma Mare was known as a center of research for geophysical/terraforming research, something that helped make the planet liveable.

name: Sigurd
detail: Sigurd is the cold moon of a glowing gas giant, described as a striped sphere that fills a third of the sky. The surface of Sigurd is completely made up of an ice mantle several hundred meters thick, with liquid water below.

name: Sikkim
detail: Sikkim was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sileste
detail: Sileste was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Silkeborg
detail: Acid rain is a persistent problem on Silkeborg. The rain is so acidic that it poses a danger to human health, although it does carve the native rock into some interesting formations.

name: Silver
detail: Named for the large deposits of silver found on the surface, Silver is a wealthy mining colony.

name: Simancas
detail: Simancas was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Simferopol
detail: Acid rain is a persistent problem on Simferopol. The rain is so acidic that it poses a danger to human health, although it does carve the native rock into some interesting formations.

name: Simone
detail: Simone was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Simpson Desert
detail: Named after a dessert thanks to a typo by a clerk, Simpson Desert is actually a world filled with beautiful forests and rolling hills.

name: Sindalin
detail: A minor Capellan colony, Sindalin's frequent impact events from its asteroid-choked orbit eventually led Liao to abandon the world. The colony buildings were soon consumed by the planet's endless dust storms.

name: Sinope
detail: Sinope served as the headquarters world for the XV Corps of the Star League Defense Force before the end of the Star League.

name: Sirdar
detail: There are large underground reservoirs of liquid water, heated by geothermal vents. Occasionally this water erupts onto the surface and freezes in the cold vacuum, covering the planet with tiny ice crystals.

name: Sirius
detail: The moon of Sirius VI was colonised first, before the terraforming on the mineral rich oxygen poor main planet could take place. Sirius was recently a member of the Tikonov Free Republic until the end of the Fourth Succession War.

name: Skallevoll
detail: One of the original worlds of the Rasalhague Consortium, it was conquered by the Draconis Combine during it's war of conquest.

name: Skandia
detail: Often used as an administrative hub or tax haven over the centuries thanks to it's location, Skandia is an otherwise unexceptional world.

name: Skaslien
detail: Skaslien was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Skat
detail: Skat is a quiet, average world that has slightly too much ozone in the atmosphere for human comfort, requiring either special medication or respirators.

name: Skepptana
detail: Skepptana was the site of a major warship crash during the Amaris Civil War, leaving it's surface a war torn wreck. Many scavengers and pirates find their way here to pick up repaired weaponry or mechs.

name: Skiland
detail: Skiland was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Skokie
detail: An ice world rich in minerals, it's geothermal vents produce much of the power for the mining facilities.

name: Skondia
detail: Skondia possesses abundant deposits of rare metals and minerals. Skondia produces nickel-alloys, titanium, and steel, used in everything from forks to fusion reactors. Ownership has changed hands multiple times over the course of the Succession Wars.

name: Skvorec
detail: Settled after the age of war, the vast bulbous plant life on on Skvorec is not very tasty but is extremely mineral rich.

name: Skye
detail: The planet Skye is dominated by a single supercontinent that reaches into more than one hemisphere. Skye is a rarity, in that it is a habitable planet within a binary star system; when Skye was discovered by explorers it was an unspoiled world.

name: Skyfog
detail: A science colony which had over two million people at one point, Skyfog was abandoned in 2769 when the Amaris Coup ended the supply runs that the colonists needed to survive. The moon was rediscovered by Interstellar Expeditions in 3003.

name: Slaithwaite
detail: Slaithwaite has vast mud flats that criss cross it's continents, used for mining and recreational purposes.

name: Slewis
detail: The Slewis system was colonised by the Rim Worlds Republic by the end of the Age of War and became an fiercely independent world after the fall of the Star League.

name: Slocum
detail: Devastated during the Amaris Civil War, Slocum still remains hostile to life due the nuclear bombardment centuries ago

name: Small World
detail: Small World is an arctic world in the middle of a two thousand year long ice age. Settlements are limited to a narrow band around the planet's equator and the only exports of note are high grade thorium and uranium ore.

name: Smithon
detail: A former Star League era armory and fortification, Smithon is the home system of House Karosas. The old Capellan fortresses have been converted to civilian habitation, and enterprising scavengers scour the planet for any remaining LosTech.

name: Smolensk
detail: Early in Smolensk's history it was the site of the Smolensk Incident, where many colonists were killed by Terran Colonial Marines. It remains wary of Terra ever since.

name: Smolnik
detail: The howling winds of Smolnik are believed to contain the souls of the departed, according to folklore.

name: Smythe
detail: Smythe was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Snailzar
detail: Snailzar was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Snowdon
detail: Snowdon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sodertalje
detail: Settled after the age of war, the vast fungi growths on Sodertalje are not very tasty but are very nutritious.

name: Sodus
detail: Sodus has vast salt plains that criss cross it's continents, used for mining and recreational purposes.

name: Soilihull
detail: Soilihull was colonised early in the Exodus from Terra, and remains an important agricultural world for nearby systems.

name: Solaris VII
detail: Solaris VII is known across the galaxy for its 'Mech fights. Gamblers place exorbitant amounts of money on longshot bets, and fortunes are won and lost daily. Solaris City, in particular, hosts six major arenas and numerous MechWarrior stables.

name: Solor
detail: Solor was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Somerset
detail: Somerset I - more commonly known simply as Somerset - is the innermost planet in the system and has two moons named Bull and Hint. Somerset has been home to a small military academy during its history.

name: Songgang
detail: The Songgang system was colonised during or shortly before the Age of War by the United Hindu Collective.

name: Son Hoa
detail: Son Hoa has an interesting geographical feature: The Vanishing Sea. During the blistering summers, all the water in the sea evaporates. Once the seasons turn, the water condenses out of the atmosphere and returns to the seabed.

name: Sonnia
detail: Settled at the start of the First Succession War by refugees from the borders, Sonnia has grown into an economic powerhouse.

name: Sophie's World
detail: A center for the arts and learning, Sophie's Choice is an idyllic planet with vast fertile oasis dotted throughout it's desert like surface.

name: Sornath
detail: Sornath was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sorsk
detail: Sorsk was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sorunda
detail: Sorunda has a large population of Buddists. It also possesses three continents named Black Falls, Serenity, and Xeno.

name: Soul
detail: Soul is a generally inhospitable world. The unforgiving environment is a combination of the dimness of the system's star, as well as Soul's lack of an axial tilt. Soul is home to a Blankenburg Technologies assault mech factory.

name: Soverzene
detail: Kilometer wide rapids criss cross this otherwise stepped world, allowing the creation of vast hydroelectric plants.

name: Sparrevohn
detail: Home to Marley Munitions Works, Sparrevohn is specialised in the production of munitions

name: Sparta
detail: Sparta was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Spencer
detail: This former Taurian world is encircled by a vast shallow ocean, teeming with native and Terran aquatic life. During the abortive Taurian-Canopian War, the Magistracy invaded as a retaliation for attacks on their worlds.

name: Spica
detail: Spica has been fought over for centuries, leaving it's surface a war torn wreck. Many scavengers and pirates find their way here to pick up repaired weaponry or mechs.

name: Spirit
detail: Spirit was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Second Succession War.

name: Spittal
detail: Orignally a Draconis Combine world, Spittal is now part of the Free Resalhague Republic. Spittal is home to Benson and Bjorn which manufacures a variety of military vehicles.

name: Spitz
detail: A nearly lifeless world reminiscent of primordial Terra, Spitz is primarily of interest to exogeologists who study the early days of future life-bearing planets.

name: Srivatsa
detail: Srivatsa is a mining outpost for the Sanctuary Alliance as well as a manufacturing hub for the Alliance. The landscape of Srivatsa is subject to terrible dust storms regularly, preventing heavy colonization. Combined with the heavy industrialization of the planet, it is notable for having a badly polluted environment.

name: St. Andre
detail: St. Andre is a red desert planet located anti-spin of Terra, notable for its rich natural resources. St. Andre is noteworthy for the meeting of leaders in 2366 that formed the Capellan Confederation.

name: St. Andreas
detail: St. Timalin is a recently rediscovered planet in the St. Andreas system, orbiting a dim red primary. It is a dark world, with black flora that has evolved to survive on the dim light emitted by the red primary, which the colonists named St. Andreas.

name: St. Cyr
detail: St. Cyr was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: St. Gall
detail: St. Gall was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: St. Ives
detail: St. Ives is the capital of the newly formed St. Ives League. The military industries on the planet have been built in to the vast cavern networks present on the planet, forcing attackers to attempt to seize them in costly close quarters actions.

name: St. John
detail: St John is an oceanic world, consisting of a few large islands that are dotted around an ocean mostly free of ice, except at the poles. There are great tidal plains that appear during the lunar cycle, showcasing wreckage from ancient battlefields.

name: St. Loris
detail: St. Loris is an important agricultural center. In 3010 the 2nd St. Ives Lancers fought the Ceti Hussars there and much of the planet's vital wheat crop was destroyed, which caused a mighty famine. The crop has recovered, but the population has not.

name: St. Robert
detail: Dense jungles of light blue fungal towers cover St. Robert, with kilometers of large plateaus with steep sides breaking through the canopy.

name: Staffin
detail: Staffin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Stafford
detail: A large recruiting world for the Marian Hegemony, Stafford's high gravity produces extremely muscular troopers who excel in mountainous terrain.

name: Stanley
detail: A supercontinent with some small, shallow seas that are constantly steaming. Spires of sharp stone interrupt the otherwise flat terrain.

name: Stantsiya
detail: Settled by scientists during the first Exodus as a research station to examine the planet's rings, 'Stantsia' has evolved into a fully self sufficient colony.

name: Stanzach
detail: Stanzach took severe damage in the Fourth Succession War, and the recovery was stifled when it become part of the recently formed Free Rasalhague Republic. Regardless, it is still an important economic system for the FRR.

name: Stapelfeld
detail: Named for it's poor agriculture, Stapelfeld is a grubby little world with little going for it. And that's what the last mayor called it.

name: Star Cluster 1108 (RW)
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster 1108 (SW)
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster 643
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster 65
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster 752
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster 814
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster 889
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster A51
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster Briceno 1
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Star Cluster P12
detail: An unexplored star cluster outside the Inner Sphere.

name: Stardawn
detail: Stardawn was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Star's End (Novo Cressidas)
detail: A former mining system, Star's End has only one planetary body, Novo Cressidas, and several large asteroid belts that make navigation in the system extremely hazardous without intimate knowledge of the system.

name: Starshine
detail: Starshine was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Steeles
detail: An icy world consisting of tundra and a few frozen lakes. Towering columns of hexagonal black stone permeate the land, whilst constant snow storms ensure no right minded individual would wish to settle here.

name: Steelton
detail: Steelton was settled by a mixture of artists and craftsmen from Kufstein and Predlitz, technicians from St. John and engineers from New Bergen. This mix of settlers are responsible for some of this worlds magnificent architecture.

name: Steinhatchee
detail: The high energy star offers ample solar energy for this otherwise barren world, allowing crops to grow with poor soil.

name: Stein's Folly
detail: Private colonists setting out for a beautiful garden world were shocked to find the only habitable regions were in the highland peninsulas, thus naming the world after their founder, Stein's Folly.

name: Stellaris
detail: Stellaris was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sterling
detail: A small industrial world located near to the jump point for quick access, Sterling offers a multitude of products... and sins... for the right price.

name: Sterlington
detail: Most cities on Sterlington are located on high plateaus, above an ever turbulent sea of clouds. Whilst oxygen is thin here, it does provide ample opportunity for recreation and cloud diving.

name: Sternwerde
detail: During the final years of the Star League, Sternwerde was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison. Heavy cloud cover causes many issues for exporting from Sternwerde, but below the cloud is a moist but mild climate.

name: Sterope (New Taurus)
detail: Sterope, sometimes named New Taurus, is an industrial world located in the rimward Periphery. The planet is home to Sterope Defense Industries as well as corporate unit of Taurus Territorial Industries.

name: Stettin (FWL)
detail: Stettin (FWL) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Stettin (HL)
detail: Stettin is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League and trades goods internally within the League.

name: Stewart
detail: Stewart was settled by colonists from the British Isles, who engineered vast terraforming works on the surface. Stewart maintains its healthy environment to this day and is one of the richest worlds in the Free Worlds League.

name: Stirling
detail: Stirling was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Stockpoll
detail: Stockpoll was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Stonarboi
detail: Stonarboi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Storfors
detail: Storfors is the planet most like Terra in the Storfors system, but two other worlds are inhabited as well. J.B. BattleMechs Incorporated manufactures Mech parts here.

name: Stotzing
detail: Once a heavily populated world filled with factories, Strotzing was bombarded during the Second Succession War, leaving the population to subsist on agriculture for centuries amidst a tainted atmosphere.

name: Stralsund
detail: Stralsund is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League, trading goods amongst the other worlds in the League.

name: Strandfontein
detail: The Strandfontein system was colonized at some point during the reign of the Star League, and was host to a large SLDF garrison. Unfortunately the bases were raided during the Succession Wars, so no LosTech can be found here.

name: Stratford
detail: The world of Stratford has large rocky, polar continents with many fjords. These continents are cold and wet, yet still life thrives in this hard environment. The Stratford narwhal makes its breeding grounds near and within the many natural inlets.

name: Strawn
detail: A once beautiful world that was ravaged by the Combine in both the First and Second Succession wars, Strawn has never fully recovered.

name: Streator
detail: Once a heavily populated world filled with automated farms, Streator was bombarded by nuclear weapons during the First Succession War, decimating the population which has only now recovered to pre war levels.

name: Sturganos
detail: Sturganos was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sturgis
detail: Once a heavily populated world filled with factories, Sturgis was bombarded for two months by the Draconis Combine during the Second Succession War, leaving the population to subsist on agriculture for centuries amidst a tainted atmosphere.

name: Styk
detail: Four-fifths of the surface of the planet Styk is covered with various saltwater oceans; dotted around the surface are nine assorted continents of varying sizes. It is heavily industrialised, with Tao MechWorks being a major employer and exporter.

name: Styriania
detail: Styriania was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Styx
detail: Styx is a world of storms, flash floods, and mudslides, wild weather patterns caused by the gravitational pull of the planet's three moons. Nevertheless, the storms often reveal rich mineral deposits which make Styx extremely wealthy.

name: Sudeten
detail: Sudeten circles its brilliant sun at a distance of nearly three astronomical units. A mostly terran planet, it has three continents. Dargoth where the capital city Hammarr is located, Holcomb and Jarho Islands. Clan Jade Falcon has taken up residence on Sudeten and use it as their capital world in the Inner Sphere.

name: Suetonius
detail: One of the worlds conquered by the Marian Hegemony, Suetonius provides logistical support to nearby Legions.

name: Suianheer
detail: A border world against the Outworlds Alliance, munitions depots were created all across the icy world of Suianheer. Nowadays, the mining colonies occassionally stumble across LosTech and more.

name: Suk
detail: Suk II is a mining world rich in rare and valuable resources. It would be a pleasant world if it were not for poisonous algae that contaminate around half of the world's water and make water purification plants a requirement at all settlements.

name: Sulafat
detail: An beautiful world, it would be a breadbasket if not for the heavy metals poisoning the soil across the most habitable continent, a remnant of Lyran savagery during the First Succession War.

name: Sullivan
detail: During the Star League era, the LXVI Corps had its headquarters located on world, surrounded by mountains on a world covered in them. Sometime during the Succession Wars, the location was lost and it has been hunted for forever since.

name: Summer
detail: Summer has been an important mining world for the last several centuries. It possessed an SLDF garrison before the fall of the Star League and has since been garrisoned by the Lyran armed forces in order to protect the planet from Kuritan raids.

name: Summerstide
detail: Summerstide was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Summit
detail: Summit has a unique flat tax rate for it's citizens, which stems from it's role in the initial Outer Reaches Rebellion centuries ago. It does have a surprisingly equalising effects with high rates of contentment amongst the population.

name: Sumy
detail: Sumy was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sunchon
detail: Sunchon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sunnywood
detail: Sunnywood is a disingenuously-named barren rock world where an ambitious colony spent centuries dying. Many ruins dot the world as a testament to humanity's optimism.

name: Sun Prairie
detail: Sun Prairie, famous for it's name sake, is a vast steppe covered world which feeds the population on numerous surrounding worlds.

name: Surcin
detail: Famous for it's Kodiak Bearfish fished from its frozen seas, Surcin is an icy world with a plethora of native aquatic life. Once a major manufacturer of arctic survival wear, it now relies on mass aquatic life exports.

name: Susquehanna
detail: In 3023 Kurita troops were sent in to break up a Leif Erickson Day celebration sponsored by the Sons of Knute and the Chrysanthemum Cross-Cultural Appreciation Society, which led to the rebellion which resulted in them joining the FRR.

name: Susulatna
detail: When people hear of Susulatna, they think of Susulatna Sultanas, those juicy inch long delights that can be found at many neighbouring worlds. Apart from fruits, Susulatna has a pleasant climate for wealthier Commonwealth citizens to relax at.

name: Sutama
detail: Firmly situated amongst the Draconic Combine for centuries, Sutama produces a vast range of citrus fruits and pharmaceuticals for export. The tropical climate of Sutama makes it a vacationing hotspot for higher ranked Nobles of the Combine.

name: Suzano
detail: Famous for Ando Bass fished from its frozen seas, Suzano is an icy world with a plethora of native aquatic life. Once a major manufacturer of light vehicles, it has since suffered in the most recent Succession Wars.

name: Svalstad
detail: Svalstad was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Svarstaad
detail: Rolling green hills and forests surround the main city of Port Svarstaad, the central city of the planet where most major lumber based industries and exporters are located.

name: Svelvik
detail: A founder of the short-lived Principality of Rasalhague, prior to the Principality being conquered by the Draconis Combine in the early to mid Twenty-fourth century, Svelvik has once again reclaimed it's heritage.

name: Sverdlovsk
detail: An independent world at first, Sverdlovsk was contacted by Shiro Kurita, the Director of the newly-created Alliance of Galedon with an offer to join. They declined. Sverdlovsk was thus the first world conquered by Kurita by military force.

name: Svinngarn
detail: Producers of the hardest, roughest swill on this side of the Lyran Commonwealth, this agricultural world has a reputation for hardy farmers in the tough climate.

name: Swales
detail: Swales was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Swartklip
detail: Do you like Swartklips? Well come on down to Swartklip, home of the universe's only Swartklips!

name: Sweet Water
detail: Sweet Water was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Sylvan
detail: The native life on Sylvan is lithe and quick, often darting away before colonists can catch even a glimpse of the wonderous creatures. The nature preserves on Sylvan are renown for their beauty.

name: Sylvester
detail: The low gravity ice world of Sylvester is a popular destination for many thrill seekers, with it's population devoted almost entirely to a service based economy.

name: Symington
detail: An unremarkable system, noted only for the mining facilities built to withstand the high gravity and rocky terrain, as well as being located only a weeks travel from the jump point.

name: Symsonia
detail: Symsonia is unique for it's architecture. Many buildings are designed using local stonework and metals which create a citywide symphony when a fohn wind blows between them.

name: Synsstad
detail: Synsstad was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Syrma
detail: Syrma is a water-rich world with a host of natural resources. Considered a dream world for development when it was found by explorers, Syrma remains a highly industrialised world even now.

name: Syrstart
detail: Once the site of numerous SLDF caches, they were bombarded from orbit when the SLDF left - leaving the world in ruins. Numerous plagues have not done the population much good over recent years and Syrstart remains the weakest of the worlds in the Isles, with little to nothing of note or importance.

name: Szepes
detail: Szepes was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Szombathely
detail: Szombathely was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Tabayama
detail: Tabayama is the capital world of the Galedon Military District, and many citizens are employed in running the government. There is also a market in venison exports, due to deer thriving on the surface - hunting is mandatory to save the croplands.

name: Tabit (Tyrfing 2350's+)
detail: Tabit (Tyrfing 2350's+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Taga
detail: Taga was founded and settled by the St. Ives Mercantile League in the 23rd Century, but fell under Capellan rule soon after. This world, famed for it's export of Kaidok survival wear, is often known for it's rebellious tendencies.

name: Tainjin
detail: The ruins of Tainjin BattleWorks still fill the Kodi Valley today, picked over by salvagers of centuries past. Without industry, Tainjin is now just a harsh mining world.

name: Takata (New Start 3130+)
detail: Takata (New Start 3130+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Talcott
detail: Talcott has the significant percentage of the defense manufacturers that supply the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns. New Avalon, Crofton, Kathil, Panpour, Salem and Talcott supply move than half of all the equipment used by the AFFS.

name: Talisker
detail: Talisker was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Talitha
detail: Prior to the Fall of the Star League, Talitha served as the headquarters of the 8th Army of the SLDF and had sway over all the Free Worlds League. Devastation from recent wars have left Talitha struggling to provide for it's own citizens.

name: Tallassee
detail: Tallassee was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Tallin
detail: Tallin was founded and settled by the St. Ives Mercantile League in the 23rd Century, but fell under Capellan rule soon after. This world, famed for it's Kodiak bear pelts and clothing industry, is often known for it's rebellious tendencies.

name: Tallmadge
detail: Tallmadge is a large breadbasket of a world with a large local manufacturing base for personnel weaponry and small armoured vehicles. There is a large monument to a Valkyrie riding Mechwarrior, left over from the First Succession Wars.

name: Tall Trees
detail: Tall Trees is infamous as the site of the New Tierra del Fuego II plague, a virulent plague which hit the island and killed everyone living there. Rumour has it that the plague was actually created in a Capellan genetic research lab. Tall Trees joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Tamar
detail: Tamar has long been a self-sufficent world, notable only for the War College of Tamar. After being conquered by Clan Wolf during the Clan Invasion, Tamar has become the capital world for the Wolves.

name: Tamarind
detail: Tamarind is known across the Inner Sphere for the quality of its artwork. Many artists start on Tamarind and charge a premium for their artworks. This was the cause to many raids and combat engagements that took place on the world.

name: Tamsalu
detail: A few islands are dotted around an ocean covered by ice everywhere except near the equator. There are wide, black, rocky beaches. The plants are tall purple stalks covered in black tentacles, each with a single circular leaf at the top.

name: Tancredi
detail: An extremely Earth like world with large mineral reserves, Tancredi is home to many manufacturers such as Precision Weaponry as well as the Tancredi War College.

name: Tangerz (Mayadi 2822+)
detail: Tangerz (Mayadi 2822+) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Tangipahoa
detail: Dense forests of tall, white stalks cover Tangipahoa. The remains of an ancient, massive impact crater can be seen all the way from orbit - the ruins of a catastrophe from the First Succession War.

name: Tangua
detail: A sandy desert lit by a bright blue sun. The local plant life takes the shape of small green bubbles. The apex predators inject their prey with digestive enzymes and appear to be part of a kind of a fungal superorganism.

name: Tanh Linh
detail: A hot volcanic world, the Fifth Sword of Light uses this world as a training ground for laser based combat in hot or low gravity environments.

name: Tania Australis
detail: Mu (μ) Ursa Major, Tania Australis, is a red star in the right hind paw of the Greater Bear. Settled long after it's sister world, Tania Borealis, Tania Australis is a fertile agricultural world known for it's rich pepper wines.

name: Tania Borealis
detail: Lambda (λ) Ursa Major, Tania Borealis, is a star in the right hind paw of the Greater Bear. One of five worlds to be a part of the Stewart Confederation before the Star League, Tania Borealis lost it's manufacturing capabilities centuries ago.

name: Tannil
detail: A desert world with sands rich in silicon, Tannil is home to numerous small electronics industries. The Second Arkab Legion, still at full strength as they sat out the Fourth Succession War, make this one of their patrol worlds.

name: Tansalir
detail: Tansalir is located in the anti-spinward region of the Deep Periphery between the Eagle Cloud Complex and the Cygnus Loop. The closest known inhabited systems to Tansalir are Fröislandis and Gurgaldar, although as with many Deep Periphery systems, close is a relative term - both systems being located more than 260 light years away from Tansalir.

name: Tantallon
detail: Tantallon was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Tantara
detail: Prior to the Fall of the Star League, Tantara was the headquarters world of the Star League Defense Forces LVII Corps (Star League) and 12th Jump Infantry Division. Rebellions were common amongst the population, a fact that remains until this day.

name: Tanz
detail: Tanz was a part of the Traders Domain province of the Outworlds Alliance during the Star League era, but was devastated in the Second Succession Wars, leading to it's abandonment.

name: Tapachula
detail: The exceedingly high gravity of Tapachula means that the mineral wealth on the surface is too dangerous to extract, and thus the world has been relegated to mostly agricultural products. The foods here grow chewy in the gravity.

name: Tapihue
detail: An unremarkable system that has been Lyran controlled for many centuries, noted only for the mining facilities built to withstand the high gravity and rocky terrain, as well as being located only a week's travel from the jump point.

name: Taran's World
detail: Taran's World was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but died out during the fighting in the Succession Wars.

name: Tarazed
detail: Tarazed city sits atop a large plateau above the extensive mudflats of the world. Mining operations are common here for easily accessible heavy ores and petroleum.

name: Tarkio
detail: Tarkio has many large and small islands centered around the south pole and between the equator and south pole. Easily mined metals are scarce, but boreholes allow access to the rich depths.

name: Tarnby
detail: Tarnby has five major landmasses, with the three largest centered around the polar areas. Geological activity is active across most of the surface, which brings easily mined materials in key spots.

name: Tarol
detail: Settled at some point prior to the end of the Age of War, Tarol IV was a member of the Magistracy of Canopus when an SLDF task force under the command of Captain-General Marion Marik was assigned to conquer the Magistracy of Canopus in 2577.

name: Tarragona
detail: This inhospitable world is subjected to fierce tidal stresses from the gas giant it orbits, with constant earthquakes and storms making colonization a deadly enterprise. Even so, some hardy people cling to the world, mining heavy metals and fissionable material.

name: Tatlawiksuk
detail: A hot inhospitable world, it is nevertheless a bountiful source of rare gems not found on other worlds.

name: Tatopani
detail: The Tatopani system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but was destroyed in the Second Succession War.

name: Tatsuno
detail: A vast desert covers three quarters of the planets surface, whilst the remaining quarter is left to an organic rich ocean with deep sea farms.

name: Tau Ceti (New Earth 2116+)
detail: Tau Ceti is famous as the destination of the first manned mission to another star system, when Captain Norm McKenna on the TAS Pathfinder jumped to Tau Ceti and back in 2108, leading to the founding of the first human colony, named New Earth.

name: Taumaturgo
detail: Taumaturgo was a part of the Traders Domain province of the Outworlds Alliance during the Star League era, but vanished during the First Succession War as the colony died out.

name: Taurus
detail: The political and cultural capital of the Taurian Concordat, and the technological heart of the Periphery, this system is defended by a dangerous asteroid belt that makes it nearly impossible to approach without local support.

name: Tawas
detail: Naturally forming geothermal holes pockmark the surface of Tawas, allowing easy access to drawing rich mineral wealth out of the deepest depths of the planet. Rumours of large shadow like creatures below are just that, rumours.

name: Taygeta
detail: An agricultural world wracked with storms, the capital city of Taygeta city still maintains some of the most nitrogen rich soils land in the entire Inner Sphere.

name: Tazaraki
detail: Tazaraki is a planet or system within the Federated Suns territory. Located in the Edgeward Combat Theatre of the Capellan March, Tazaraki is near Beenleigh and Jenet and was wiped out during the Third Succession War.

name: T Cephei (The Devil's Eye)
detail: T Cephei is a significant astronomical feature in the spinward Deep Periphery. Located about 690 light-years from Terra, the star is rimward of Tortuga Prime and approximately 100 light-years past Filtvelt. It is a massive Mira variable red giant, so large that its circumference is greater than that of Terra's inner system and would be comparable to that of a full moon from a distance of 1.5 light-years.

name: Tchamba
detail: A major refiner and manufactury for nigonium, Tchamba secures it's place at the heart of the Free Worlds League.

name: Techne's Revenge
detail: Techne's Revenge was a member of the Magistracy of Canopus when a Star League Defense Force task force under the command of Captain-General Marion Marik was assigned to conquer the Magistracy of Canopus in 2577.

name: Tecumseh
detail: Founded in the Star League era, this colony was a hive of artistry and poetry until the Succession Wars, where upon it's pristine forests were harvested for lumber and ironwood, and strip mining began.

name: Tedibyhr
detail: Tedibyhr was a Star League-era inhabited system in the Kathil Operational Area of the Capellan March within the Federated Suns, which was utterly destroyed by nuclear and fission weaponry during the First Succession War.

name: Tegaldanas
detail: A dry desert world orbit a K class star, Telgaldanas has two continents, seperated by an ocean sized canyon.

name: Tellman
detail: Tellman IV is an icy mining world within the Outworlds Alliance

name: Tellman's Mistake
detail: The colonists were overwhelmed by a small batlike predator which led Dr. Tellman to forsooth that they were all doomed, but the bite turned out to be rarely fatal with the survivors boasting of better immune and digestion systems.

name: Telos
detail: Telos IV has four continents: Dulles, Rustov, Fellin, and Haranshire. The capital city, Triumph, is located on Dulles. It has a large population that works in financial services as well as a satellite branch of Luthien Armour Works.

name: Tematagi
detail: A small industrial outpost surrounds the main colony on this barren world. Many recreational facilities exist and nearby pirates are known to use it as a rest stop.

name: Teng
detail: A small dry Earth-like planet with approximately half the gravity of Earth. The planet is covered by one enormous ocean. There are only two small continents, each no larger than the island of Borneo.

name: Tengil
detail: A small colony located on a hot ball of rock near to the B class star throughout most of the Succession Wars, it was destroyed by a solar flare.

name: Teniente
detail: Deep boreholes pockmark the surface of Teniente, drawing rich mineral wealth out of the deepest depths of the planet. Some miners say they can see creatures down there...

name: Tentativa
detail: Named as such for the first tentative steps of the colonists during the Star League era making their way onto a barren world, they nevertheless have managed to prosper and turn this world into a livable home.

name: Terra
detail: Terra is the home planet of humanity. Terra has been the capital of several interstellar nations and is the most industrialized planet in the Inner Sphere.

name: Terra Firma
