detail: Covered in huge forests and possessing abundant mineral resources, Terra Firma formed several trade agreements with its neighboring worlds. Bander BattleMechs have a facility here. Terra Firma joined the so-called Chaos March in the 3060s, sparking off a race to conquer the wayward independent worlds.

name: Tetersen
detail: Tetersen is a small atmospheric-less planetoid orbiting a large gas giant, which is inhabited by laboratories and hydroponics bays which research the impact of crop growing with a low gravity environment.

name: Tetschner
detail: Tetschner was settled during the Star League era, but was abandoned by the time of the Third Succession War.

name: Tetski
detail: Tetski was settled during the Star League era, and was a major industrial world until it was destroyed by chemical and biological agents during the Second Succession War.

name: Texlos
detail: With the highest population growth rate of the St. Ives worlds, Texlos is a pleasant garden-planet.Texlos serves as the main recruiting pool for the St. Ives Armored Cavalry regiments and also maintains a large and well equipped militia force.

name: Teylingen
detail: Previously a world containing numerous small automated mining colonies and a token population, it was destroyed during the Third Succession War.

name: Teyvareb
detail: A hot inhospitable world, it is nevertheless a bountiful source of rare materials not found on other worlds.

name: Thadora's Land
detail: Recently colonised by the Circinus Federation, this icy cold mining colony is a source of precious Germanium for the Federation.

name: Thannhausen
detail: An agricultural world wracked with storms, the capital city of Thannhausen Gate still maintains some of the most fertile land in the entire Inner Sphere.

name: Tharkad
detail: Tharkad is a icy and rugged planet, similar to the arctic wilderness of Terra. The planet consists of five major continents and three major island chains. The largest continent is Bremen and is home to Tharkad City, capital of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Thasos
detail: Most of the population of Thasos live an agricultural lifestyle maintained by technology of an equivalent to that found on Terra in the late eighteenth or early nineteenth century, a consequence of the heavy influence of the Omniss philosophy.

name: Thazi
detail: Thazi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was part of the Outworlds Alliance until it was abandoned entirely during the First Succession War.

name: The Edge
detail: The Edge was one of the worlds invaded by the Lyran Commonwealth during Operation GÖTTERDÄMMERUNG, the major Commonwealth offensive of the Fourth Succession War. The Edge is a significant target due to it's economic and political importance.

name: The Eyes in the Dark
detail: Named by Explorer Corps, The Eyes in the Dark is a binary star system where both stars are red giants, massive ancient stars, one of which is believed to be within five to ten million years time of core collapse, which would lead to a supernova.

name: Thermopolis
detail: Despite regular attack in the Succession Wars the Star League era Kallon Industries facilities still maintain the levels required for production of BattleMechs, such as the Wolverine.

name: The Rock
detail: The Rock consists largely of asteroids and other small bodies orbiting the system primary; a number of these asteroids and bodies are inhabited, although some lack the atmosphere required to be habitable.

name: Thessalonika
detail: Thessalonika is a relatively poor world in terms of natural resources. Limited to a few petroleum deposits and gemstone veins, the first settlers landed here for a different feature: broad grasslands.

name: Thestria
detail: Originally a frozen ball known only for precious metal deposits, a massive meteor strike pushed the planetoid into a closer orbit, rendering the planet habitable.

name: The Swan's Eye
detail: Named by Explorer Corps, The Swans Eye is a trinary star system where massive planetoids are forming to create an eye like feature on the star.

name: Theta Carinae Cluster
detail: A cluster of worlds located far from the Inner Sphere.

name: Thibodaux
detail: A heavily irrigated desert world, most of the agricultural work is automated. It produces many exports, considering it's small size.

name: Thimphu
detail: Thimphu is a simple agricultural world that was devastated in the Fourth Succession War when a JumpShip crashed into the main colony.

name: Thirty Weight
detail: Thirty Weight was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was part of the Marik Commonwealth until it was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Thorin
detail: Thorin is a Terra-like world, which has one moon (Thorin's Twin). It is considered a jewel of a world and is home to much metal and mineral wealth utilised by manufacturers such as Newhart Industries and Johnson-Aldis Weaponries.

name: Thorn
detail: Thorn is one of the worlds that form a part of the Deep Periphery nation known as the Hanseatic League.

name: Thraxa
detail: Thraxa is a semi-arctic world on the border between the Magistracy of Canopus and the Marian Hegemony. The northern landmass is tundra, a result of a deliberate conservation policy that keeps the tundra intact between cities and settlements.

name: Thuban
detail: Thuban is a vast open-environment world with a breathable atmosphere and wide, lava-encrusted plains around Scorpius Mons, the planet's largest highest volcano

name: Thule
detail: Thule is divided into three large continents. Vik with the capital 'Thule City', Akranes as the agricultural center, whilst Husavik is frozen wasteland with several research posts. Bergan Industries, a major Locust manufacturer, has facilities here.

name: Thun
detail: Thun is known for it's deep, dry canyons which are often subject to landslips and falls under the high gravity of the world.

name: Thurrock
detail: The site of a decisive battle between the SLDF and the Magistracy almost 500 years ago, Thurrock has long since recovered from that war and now thrives as a regional industrial and tourism center.

name: Tianamon
detail: Tianamon was part of the Sarna Commonality of the Cappelan Confederation, but was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War due to famine.

name: Tiber (FWL)
detail: Tiber is probably best known as the home of Earthwerks Incorporated. Recently the world has been rocked by violence as the labor unions on the world incited their members to riot

name: Tiflis
detail: An average agricultural world that produces large amounts of Terran timber. This timber is exported, but before it leaves the world it serves as an obstacle to the severe wind storms. The world is notable only for the Surb Gevorg Manufacturing plant.

name: Tigress
detail: A well-educated population and the highly industrialized economy make Tigress a significant asset for the controlling house. Large Star League era fusion generators power the cities and provide free power to industry across the world.

name: Tikonov
detail: One of the earliest systems colonised, Tikonov has seen more than it's share of conflict.  The numerous Earthwerks (and other) factories has seen it become a battlefield several times, and was most recently taken over by the Feds some 10 years ago.

name: Timbiqui
detail: Timbiqui is home to a major manufacturer, Timbiqui Spirits, which is known throughout the Inner Sphere primarily for its best-known brand of beer, Timbiqui Dark. A favored choice among mercenaries, Timbiqui Dark is even sold in the Deep Periphery.

name: Timbuktu
detail: A dry desert world orbit a K class star, Timbuktu has two continents, Hades and Saharius where the capital city Greene is located. The Timbuktu-based corporation Diplass BattleMechs was destroyed entirely during the Amaris Civil War.

name: Timehri
detail: An Earth-like planet with an unusually large axial tilt causing extreme seasonal changes. Both the northern and southern hemispheres experience complete darkness for several months at a time.

name: Timkovichi
detail: A cold, tundral world at the outer edge of its star's habitable zone. There are no oceans or continents, but the surface is littered with lakes and small seas. Coniferous forests cover much of the surface.

name: Tinaca
detail: Tinaca has one major continent, 'The Island' where the capital city Tandalola is located. It is home to a live fire training ground often utilised by the Sun Zhang MechWarrior Academy.

name: Tintavel
detail: In 2412, FWLM force invaded Tintavel. The battle escalated until both sides employed weapons of mass destruction, leading to over 300,000 casualties and abandonment of the planet. The tragedy caused all sides to meet and form the Ares convention.

name: Tirabad
detail: Tirabad was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Tiruchchirappalli
detail: Tiruchchirappalli was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Tiruppur
detail: An extremely hot planet. Mostly desert but with some small seas in the northern and southern hemispheres. The equatorial regions are too hot for most species, and so the only settlements are situated in the extreme polar regions.

name: Tishomingo
detail: A hot prison world with a nitrogen/oxygen atmosphere. This planet was once covered with lush rainforest, but was burnt away during the First Succession War.

name: Tiskilwa
detail: A large rocky planet with high gravity and a thin atmosphere. The atmosphere only extends about 1 mile above sea level, and many mountain tops are exposed to the vacuum of space. Habitable areas are in the deep valleys between mountain ranges.

name: Tiverton
detail: Tiverton is a lush water world, with archipelagos of volcanic islands strewn all around the surface. Fishing and algae farming are the backbone industries, but it's also known for being a haven for organized crime and piracy.

name: Toffen
detail: Toffen is an arid world with a meagre population largely made up of isolationist loners living on scattered farms.

name: Togura
detail: During the Star League era, Togura was rich in much-needed industrial metals and rare earths which turned it into a heavily industrialised world. Even now, numerous companies such as Stellar Trek and Osaka Heavy Metrics maintain shipyards in orbit.

name: Togwotee
detail: A small world with extremely low gravity, about the size of Earth's moon. The planet is home to the 'Jump-World Low Gravity Theme Park', which is situated inside a giant glass dome for the safety and breathing-comfort of its visitors.

name: Tohelet
detail: A small Earth-like planet with oceans and several large continents typified by open grassland regions. The planet serves as an agricultural colony, with large farms covering much of its surface.

name: Tok Do
detail: A vastly populated jungle world with many untapped resources. Alshain Weapons is headquartered on Tok Do and produces light BattleMechs for the Draconis Combine.

name: Toland
detail: Toland was settled by a mixture of artists and craftsmen fleeing from the First Succession War. Toland has three moons, expanses of jungle and natural resources that include rare minerals.

name: Tomalov
detail: Deep within the Hanseatic League, Tomalov exports many foodstuffs to other Hanseatic Worlds.

name: Tomans
detail: Tomans is home to the Lyran Biomaterials Complex, a vast research complex that researches and manufactures new materials.

name: Tongatapu
detail: Tongatapu is an arid world that is rich in high grade ores and material. It's surface is dotted with mines owned by Technicron Manufacturing which produce raw material which is then shipped to Tamarind, their JumpShip shipyard.

name: Tordenskjold
detail: Tordenskjold was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Torgvei
detail: Torgvei was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was wiped out during the First Succession War.

name: Tormentine
detail: An Earth-like planet with an unusually large axial tilt causing extreme seasonal changes. Both the northern and southern hemispheres experience harsh winters, with cold nights that can last for weeks or months at a time depending on latitude.

name: Torrence
detail: An icy world with vast underground caverns and unique fauna, Torrence is home to military manufacturer Veridian Dynamics and one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the Suns, Vinson Pharmaceuticals.

name: Tortuga Prime
detail: The Tortuga Prime system was settled by the remains of the 237th Light Cavalry Regiment in the closing stages of the Reunification War. It is the Capital of the bandit kingdom known as the Tortuga Dominions.

name: Toten
detail: Toten was settled during the Star League era due to it's asteroid field rich in germanium, a vital material for JumpShip construction. As such a vital target, it was destroyed utterly during the violence of the First Succession War.

name: Totness
detail: Totness was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Tottori
detail: Tottori was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was devastated and abandoned during the Second Succession War.

name: Tovetin (Tovetine)
detail: Tovetin (Tovetine) was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was destroyed entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Towne
detail: Towne is a slightly cooler Terran world which boasts good mineral and lumber wealth. The many active volcanoes and other geological activities continue to give the impression that the world is bigger than it actually is.

name: Transfer Facility 4
detail: The TF4 facility was a surface cargo waystation operated by Clan Smoke Jaguar during Operation REVIVAL and the years after the Truce of Tukayyid.

name: Transfer Station J239H2
detail: TJ239H2 (also Transfer Station J239H2 or Transfer J239H2) is an orbital cargo transfer facility stationed four days away from a K7V star. Located in the Deep Periphery near the Chainelane Isles and Wolf 82, TJ239H2 was operated by Clan Jade Falcon for use during Operation REVIVAL.

name: Trasjkis
detail: A small Earth-like planet with approximately half the gravity of Earth, Trasjkis is dotted with many small islands and a large continent covers the northern polar region. Much of the exports from Trasjkis are in the form of aquatic food and along with Reykavis serves as a breadbasket for the Palatinate.

name: Traussin
detail: Traussin was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Treeline (Winfield 2863+)
detail: Winfield was originally named Treeline, but was gifted to the commander of the Stealths, Colonel Raymond Winfield, by Archon Elizabeth Steiner after their destruction in the conquest of Sakhalin in 2863 and renamed "Winfield" in his honour.

name: Trell (Trellwan)
detail: A planetary year on Trellwan is only 45 standard days, while a planetary day is 30.5 standard days due to the planet's slow rotation. As a result, vulcanism and earthquakes are common and the climatic changes are quite abrupt and severe.

name: Trellisane
detail: Trellisane was settled by rabid democrats with the excitement to enact a direct democracy. It did not last until a novel solution was found only allowing a third of the population to vote on a rotating basis.

name: Trent
detail: An enormous super-earth planet with a breathable nitrogen/oxygen atmosphere but extremely high gravity. One large continent stretches from the north pole to the south pole. Forests of carnivorous plants cover much of the landmass.

name: Trentham
detail: An ocean world with few large landmasses but thousands of tiny islands. The islands of Northern Trentham are famous for their petrified forests. Nearby islands are used for training, weapons testing, and secretive research facilities.

name: Tresspass
detail: Tresspass was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but it was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War after substantial bombardment. At some point in the intervening centuries though it seems that someone resettled the damaged and polluted world, possibly seeking to set up an independent colony.

name: Triesting
detail: An industrialised world during the Star League, Triesting was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison. In the First Succession War the factories were erased from existence, leaving only scant remains which still exist today.

name: Trimaldix
detail: A lifeless planet with an economy centered around gambling. Aside from a few uranium mines, gambling is the only industry on the planet. Loose gaming laws are the only reason this backwater colony exists.

name: Trinidad
detail: Trinidad has three heavily populated continents: Arawak, Galibi, and Raleigh. The capital city, Warao, is located on Raleigh.

name: Tripoli
detail: A terrestrial planet with an extremely slow axial rotation. Forests of giant fungal organisms dominate much of the surface. In orbit are three heavily fortified moons.

name: Trolloc Prime
detail: An almost lifeless rock with no atmosphere, about the size of Earth's moon. A few uranium mines are the only signs of life here, and they're mostly automated. Rumours of Star League caches hidden under the surface keep the population busy though.

name: Trondheim (DC)
detail: A former Combine world that is now a key planet in the Free Rasalhague Republic.  Recent vulcanic activity has brought a plethora of mineral deposits to the surface, making this an important mining planet for the FRR.

name: Trondheim (JF)
detail: Trondheim is home to some of the JàrnFòlk's few heavy industries, concentrated around the capital city of Narvik, and is where all of the parts for their various starships are manufactured and shuttled to orbiting dry docks.

name: Trondheimal
detail: Primarily an iron and processed steel heavy goods manufacturing world, Trondheimal is a vital part of the Illyrian Palatinate economy. Habitable areas are restricted to the mountain sides, with colonies being buried into the mountains in order to mine and work the metals the world's economy relies on.

name: Truth
detail: Once a desert planet with vast irrigated flood plains, Truth was devastated in the Third Succession War. Most of the populated die of famine, leaving only a few token hardy survivors on the surface.

name: Trznadel Cluster
detail: The Trznadel Cluster is a quaternion system, containing numerous mineral rich planets, which are mined to power the Magistracy of Canopus's industrial base.

name: Tsamma
detail: Originally named Tsunami, Tsamma was settled as an agricultural world. The many turbulent oceans have a low salt content which make it easy to create potable water. This has made Tsamma the largest exporter of drinking water in fifty light years.

name: Tsarahavana
detail: An ocean world with a breathable nitrogen/oxygen atmosphere. Only a single island-continent rises above sea-level. While the ocean is teeming with complex life, only single-celled organisms have ventured onto the land.

name: Tsinan
detail: A small rocky planet in the Lagrange point of a gas giant. The planet has no atmosphere, but incredibly there is life here, living in large underground reservoirs of water.

name: Tsingtao
detail: A small, flat, muddy planet. There are no oceans, instead the surface is covered with a shallow layer of water. A single moon creates a strong tidal effect, making the entire planet a tidal mudflat - perfect for certain crops and brewing of beer.

name: Tsitsang
detail: Tsitsang's warm and temperate climate allows the colonists are able to enjoy three full growing seasons on each of the three continents on the planet, all of which were located on the equator.

name: Tsukude
detail: From orbit this tropical paradise looks idyllic, however the wildlife draws energy from nitrogen rather than oxygen, and are completely inedible. All food must be imported to Tsukude but the vast amounts of rare gases are a major export.

name: Tuamotu
detail: A small Earth-like planet with a thin nitrogen/oxygen atmosphere. A long, narrow continent follows the line of the equator, stretching half way around the planet. The most successful creatures on the planet are large protomammals.

name: Tuat
detail: Tuat was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned before the Third Succession War. It was once host to a large SLDF garrison, which means rumours of LosTech caches are rampant.

name: Tukayyid
detail: This picturesque world offers a multitude of different terrain, with many religious monasteries dotting it's surface. Pretty unremarkable and will be resigned to be forgotten in the history books...

name: Turin
detail: The valuable Turin beef is grown on the vast grasslands of the planet's single continent, although maintaining the alien-Terran hybrid is expensive. In recent years, the ranchers have begun branching out into horse breeding.

name: Turinge
detail: A terrestrial planet with an unusually large axial tilt causing extreme seasonal changes. The most advanced forms of life on the planet are marsupials.

name: Turkalia
detail: Turkalia was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was a major battleground in the First Succession War until it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Turko
detail: Turko was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Turov
detail: Turov was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Turtle Bay
detail: Turtle Bay is a world located near the Periphery border with the Draconis Combine.

name: Tuscarawas
detail: The fertile soils of Tuscarawas are home to many farms, as well as Interstellar Harvesters, an agricultural and industrial equipment producer.

name: Twycross
detail: Twycross is a weather-wild desert planet, where cataclysmic events and powerful wind storms are common. Due to these storms the population placed their cities and towns underground or made surface structures squat and flat.

name: Tybalt
detail: Tybalt is a world that suffers from frequent earthquakes. Eleven continents are on the world, but ten of them are so covered in mountains that large human settlement is impossible.

name: Tylarzka
detail: Tylarzka was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Tyrlon
detail: Tyrlon's two worlds are both inhabited. Arid Tyrlon 5 is an agricultural world, with farming in the flood-plains of its major river systems. Oceanic Tyrlon 6 has a toxic concentration of oxygen but is habitable on plateaus above the dense cloud layer. It is there that House Parata has its seat of power.

name: Tyrrhenia
detail: Tyrrhenia is home to numerous mining companies who desire access to the vast riches contained under the surface of this otherwise barren world. The Fourth Succession War has delayed further industrialisation.

name: Ubangi
detail: Ubangi was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Udibi
detail: A small agricultural world with a plethora of native life, Udibi has a growing pharmaceuticals sector. The tasty Gyru lizards also roam the many forests.

name: Ueda
detail: Ueda is a cold planet orbiting at the outer edge of its star's habitable zone, but it is kept relatively warm by its atmosphere, which is mostly composed of CO2. This is a damp, boggy world, prone to excessive rain and seasonal flooding.

name: Ugland
detail: Ugland was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Uhuru
detail: By the end of the Star League era Uhuru was a major industrial center, but the First Succession War devastated the planet. By the Second, those living on Uhuru were reduced to a bare subsistence level of existence from which they have not recovered.

name: Ukunela
detail: Ukunela was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Ulan Batar
detail: A habitable dwarf planet famous for its “stone forests”.

name: Ulan Bator
detail: Settled in 2271 thanks to it's steppe landscapes suitable for pastoral farming. In the years prior to the fall of the Star League, the SLDF built numerous small forts and hidden boltholes across the landscape of Ulan Bator.

name: Ullieri
detail: Ullieri was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Ulsan
detail: Ulsan was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Ulubis
detail: Ulubis was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War but was forgotten during the Second Succession War, though not for any important reason, most likely clerical error or pure neglect from the Outworlds government as it seems Ulubis somewhat retained its population.

name: Ulvskollen
detail: Ulvskollen was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Ulysses
detail: An agricultural world known for their oversized four leaf clovers and their gigantic alien honey bees. The Tsamma Crucis March Militia often recruited here.

name: Umgard
detail: Due to the tidal stresses of Umgard's two moons, the planet is torn by volcanoes and earthquakes, and the air is a near-toxic soup of foul-smelling gases. It's a jungle world, with forests teeming with life, but machinery tends to corrode quickly in the murky environment.

name: Umijiri
detail: A hotspot for Yakuza activity, Umijiri has recently been the key training ground of the Seventh and Eight Ghost regiments. These regiments are made up of former (and current) criminals and prisoners.

name: Umka
detail: Umka was settled for it's extremely rich aquaculture, but it wasn't until later that heavy ores were discovered. Kerr-McGuiness, a manufacturer of BattleMech armour, has a large facility here, producing thousands of tons of Mech armour annually.

name: Undra
detail: A small rocky planet in the Lagrange point of a gas giant. The planet has no atmosphere, but incredibly there is life here, living in large underground caverns filled with a mixture of atmospheric gasses.

name: Union of Samoyedic Colonies
detail: A star cluster containing numerous small colonies far from the Inner Sphere.

name: Unity
detail: An agricultural world with a substantial trading outpost. One corporation, Pesht Motors, has a small facility on the planet producing many small cars and tractors, but with the option to expand into larger units.

name: Unkador
detail: Unkador was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Unukalhai
detail: A tropical paradise known for its rainforests, beaches, and colorful wildlife. With little natural resources of it's own, it survives as an R&R stop off point for many ships.

name: Unzmarkt
detail: An arctic world with rocky terrain and majestic canyons, such as the Hester-Kester Fjord. Once the site of an ancient Castle Brian, it now houses a rugged but determined group of miners.

name: Upano
detail: A tropical paradise known for its rainforests, beaches, and colorful wildlife. A single continent stretches unbroken around the planet's equator, separating the northern and southern oceans. This continent is teeming with life, as are the oceans.

name: Uravan
detail: The arctic like planet is one of the training groups for the 2nd Ceti Hussars.

name: Úr Cruinne
detail: Úr Cruinne is a frozen wasteland, but geothermal vents create temperate zones in which the planet's few inhabitants live and mine the plentiful mineral resources.

name: Urich
detail: The Urich system was colonized either during or shortly before the Age of War. During the final years of the Star League, Urich was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Urjala
detail: Settled before the Reunification War, it look substantial damage during that war from Free Worlds forces. The rocky terrain allows for jump jet capable troops to ambush others in large canyons and ridges.

name: Utrecht
detail: The capital city of Utrecht is Naragajan, situated high on the Labbie Plateau, one of the flatest regions of this otherwise jagged and rocky planet.

name: Uzhgorod
detail: Situated close to the sun in this system, the local time on Uzhgorod only has 41 standard minutes per hour, said to be the shortest in the entire Lyran Commonwealth at the time.

name: Vaajakoski
detail: Vaajakoski was a system in the Kajikazawa Prefecture of the Benjamin Military District of the Draconis Combine until it was destroyed and abandoned during the Second Succession War.

name: Vackisujfalu
detail: An agroworld that is home to a regiment of the mercenary group known as the Dioscuri.

name: Vakarel
detail: Vakarel is an ice world with a turbulent atmosphere of perpetual blizzards called the "Star Veil". Native fauna includes the predatory Ugmar. There are rumours that Qaere Crystals are found in great quantity on Vakarel, but not officially confirmed.

name: Valabhi
detail: The Valabhi system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Valasha
detail: The Valasha system is a key entry point to the Outworlds Alliance. With its high energy star, multiple jumpships as well as cargo transfer and recharge stations could be found at both of Valasha's main jump points.

name: Valdives
detail: Valdives was originally colonized by those looking to exploit its vast geothermal energy, but the volcanos proved to be more trouble than it was worth. Lostech prospectors sometimes tell tales about the treasures under the ash.

name: Valencia
detail: Valencia is a beautiful oceanic planet with settlements dotted around the coastlines of the many islands that make up the world.  It exports agricultural and aquatic produce to nearby worlds and is notable for its extremely short 46 day long year thanks to an unusual eliptic orbit.

name: Valentina
detail: Subject to a decimation by Draconis forces during the Reunification War, the system serviced the Draconis Combine for centuries. This was the last system that the Minnesota Tribe was last sighted in before Comstar lost their trail.

name: Valerius
detail: Valerius is an habitable world that appears to have moderate mineral deposits. It's astrographical location is its more important trait.

name: Valexa
detail: Valexa was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and exports aquatic produce to nearby worlds. The Valexa Cappelan March Militia are headquartered here.

name: Valil'yevskiy
detail: Valil'yevskiy was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and exports agricultural and aquatic produce to nearby worlds.

name: Valladolid (Mudd's Hut 2864+)
detail: The Valladolid system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was annihilated by multiple nuclear strikes during the First Succession War and left uninhabitable.

name: Valloire
detail: Valloire was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and produces agricultural produce for nearby worlds. It's tropical climate is known for producing the best teas in the quadrant.

name: Valmiera
detail: Valmiera was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and produces agricultural produce for nearby worlds.

name: Valois
detail: The Valois system was settled during the Star League era, until it was abandoned during the Third Succession War. Centuries ago a BattleMech Division earned the name "The Alamo Division", sacrificing to save their target from nuclear annihilation.

name: Vandalia
detail: Vandalia was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and produces agricultural goods for nearby worlds, including delicacies such as owlbear and axebeak.

name: Van Diemen IV
detail: Van Diemen IV was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and is a picturesque world that produces agricultural produce for nearby worlds.

name: Vanern
detail: Vanern was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and produces agricultural produce for nearby worlds. The mumba fruit is unique to this world.

name: Vangburg
detail: The Vangburg system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was a member of the Outworlds Alliance until it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Vannes
detail: Once a Rim Worlds Republic system and later occupied, briefly, by Star League forces, Vannes is now home to a powerful group of raiders calling themselves the Vannite Pirate Kingdom. The kingdom is strengthened by its discovery of a still-operational Merkava tank factory from the RWR days and by the presence of a Star League Castle Brian, called Castle Vannes locally.

name: Vanra
detail: Once the site of a large battle during the First Succession War where superior tactics won out against numbers, the forested planet of Vanra is now home to the Orloff Military Academy.

name: Vantaa
detail: Vantaa was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War, and produces agricultural produce for nearby worlds, specifically fruit.

name: Vard
detail: Almost a billion people live in the cleverly engineered treetop cities of Vard, where descent to the lush jungle of ground level is only possible for short times and with armed protection from the wildlife.

name: Vargtass
detail: Vargtass was settled at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War but died out sometime between the Second and Third Succession Wars.

name: Várri
detail: The Várri system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was a member of the Rim Worlds Republic until it was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Vaucluse
detail: A small penal colony on a harsh world, Vaucluse holds many dangerous criminals from across the Commonwealth.

name: Vecchio
detail: The Vecchio system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was a member of the Federated Suns until it was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Veckholm
detail: A small penal colony on a harsh world, Veckholm holds many dangerous criminals from across the Commonwealth.

name: Vediovis
detail: The Sacellum, though it doesn't have the raw manufacturing capabilities of its neighbors, still produces plentiful heavy industry and most of it happens on Vediovis. Long a polluted planet, Vediovis is pockmarked with mines and factories everywhere.

name: Vega
detail: Vega is a world rich in minerals, metallic ores, and fresh water. It is home to numerous manufacturers and research complexes such as Cosby Myomer Research Firm

name: Velhas
detail: The Velhas system was colonized at some point during the Star League era after the end of the Reunification War. The Fourth Donegal Guards have a large training range amongst the mudflats and have often been sighted in the area.

name: Venaria
detail: The Venaria system was colonized either during or shortly before the Age of War. During the final years of the Star League, Venaria was the host to a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Vendrell
detail: Vendrell has two moons named Ying and Yang and is been home to manufacturing facilities operated by the noted defense manufacturer Mountain Wolf BattleMechs.

name: Ventabren
detail: The Ventabren system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra. During the Third Succession War, it suffered a Scorched Earth campaign which resulted in a hefty rebuilding effort after the war.

name: Verde
detail: The Verde system was colonised during the First Exodus from Terra. Whilst the planetside population is poor, the lucrative mining facilities on the asteroid belt provide heavy raw materials to Galtor Naval Yards in the Exeter System.

name: Verdigreis
detail: The Verdigreis system was colonized at some point prior to the end of the Age of War, and by the eve of the Reunification War was a member of the Taurian Concordat, but fell to the Federated Suns during the First Succession War.

name: Verdinge
detail: The Verdinge system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was a member of the Federated Suns until it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Vereeniging
detail: The Vereeniging system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War due to famine.

name: Verlo
detail: Constant earthquakes and volcanic eruptions shake the surface of Verlo, a highly volatile world. Rich mineral deposits exist here for those brave enough to endure the harsh climate.

name: Vermezzo
detail: The Vermezzo system settled during or shortly before the Age of War, and remained Lyran for centuries. It is known the Óleo Reserve, a very rich deposit of petroleum, notable for being the largest in the local region of space.

name: Versailles (Taussen 2822+)
detail: Settled during the Star League era, Versailles vanished from maps during the First Succession War, which suggests that the system had been abandoned or depopulated, though there is evidence that the system was removed from most maps by ComStar.

name: Vesta
detail: A harsh and unforgiving desert world, Vesta is the heart of the Sacellum's spirituality with rites and rituals being performed in the desert nigh-constantly and with all citizens of the Sacellum making a pilgrimage to Vesta's capital, Hearth City, at least once in their lives. Supposedly, the frescos and architecture in Hearth City rival or surpass anything in the Inner Sphere.

name: Vestallas
detail: Vestallas was known to hold the Capellan Confederation's treasure. Its underground vaults contained priceless works of art; precious stones; bars of gold, silver, and germanium; and hard currency from the Confederation and other Successor States.

name: Viborg
detail: Viborg itself is described as a "garden world", and the population preferred to import ores and steel from the abundant asteroid belts via the Penance mining habitat over mining the planet itself.

name: Vibrunum
detail: The Vibrunum system was settled during or shortly before the Age of War. The system mainly provides agricultural produce to nearby manufacturing worlds.

name: Vicente
detail: The Vicente system settled during or shortly before the Age of War. The system mainly provides agricultural produce to nearby manufacturing worlds.

name: Vicksland
detail: The Vicksland system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Victoria
detail: The administrative capital of its Capellan Confederation Commonality, Victoria is famous for its violently bad weather, underground cities, and beautiful domed parks. Many industries take advantage of the local natural resources.

name: Victralla
detail: The Victralla system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Vihtijarvi
detail: The Vihtijarvi system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. The system mainly provides agricultural produce to nearby manufacturing worlds.

name: Vikindu
detail: The Vikindu system was settled during or shortly before the Age of War and by the end of that era was a part of the Free Worlds League. The harsh desert climate prevents growth of most crops, requiring large amounts of imports for the population.

name: Villanueva
detail: Villanueva is a lightly-settled, extremely humid water planet. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in food production and processing, and live in small settlements around automated facilities.

name: Viluisk
detail: The Villuisk system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was part of the short lived Finmark Free Republic until it was abandoned entirely during the Second Succession War.

name: Vindemiatrix
detail: Vindemiatrix is best known for the Vindemiatrix Observatory, a university that focuses almost completely on stellar life cycles and planetology.

name: Vinstra
detail: The Vinstra system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and was part of the Outworlds Alliance until it was abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War.

name: Vintru
detail: The Vintru system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. Vintru was conquered by the Federated Suns during the Second Succession War and abandoned entirely during the Third Succession War

name: Vipaava
detail: One of the founding worlds of the Rasalhague Consortium, Vipaava enjoys a temperate climate and a healthy industry.

name: Virentofta
detail: The Virentofta system was colonised at some point prior to the end of the Reunification War by colonists of Scandinavian descent, who settled into the arctic conditions admirably well.

name: Viroflay
detail: The Viroflay system was settled during the Star League era, and was a known pirate haven with a large human trafficking operation, until it was destroyed in the Succession Wars.

name: Virtue
detail: The capital city of Redlight on Virtue is the headquarters of Virtue Cartographers Unlimited, the premier starmap makers in the Lyran Commonwealth, rivaling the expertise of even the ComStar Cartographic Corps.

name: Visby
detail: An oceanic planet filled with islands, Visby offers fresh aquatic life to nearby worlds.

name: Vixen
detail: Depopulated in the Succession Wars, a small consortium of Canopian corporations have resettled the world as a skiing and winter sports resort for wealthy patrons.

name: Voehn
detail: The Voehn system was settled during the Star League era, and was a minor colony on the periphery of the Outworlds Alliance, until the Third Succession War when it was abandoned along with many other worlds.

name: Voight
detail: An early colony in the Sanctuary Worlds, Voight actually pre-dates the founding of the Jacobson Haven and was a candidate for its capital once. However, Capone won out as the capital world, leaving Voight to stew in resentment ever since. Today, Voight is an electronics manufacturing center and is well defending by the Haven family militias.

name: Volders
detail: The Volders system was settled shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. During the Fourth Succession War a massive cache of Star League Mechs and weapons were discovered by Snords Irregulars.

name: Vonja
detail: The Vonja system was settled during the Star League era, and became a minor colony on the periphery of the Outworlds Alliance, until the Third Succession War when it was abandoned.

name: Vorarlberg
detail: The Vorarlberg system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and by the end of the Age of War was a part of the Lyran Commonwealth. It was heavily damaged during the Second Succession War, and is an contested world thanks to it's factories.

name: Vortalcoy
detail: The Vortalcoy system was either settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned after the main colony was destroyed during the First Succession War in a chemical weapons strike.

name: Vorzel
detail: The Vorzel system was settled at some point during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Protectorate of Donegal prior to the formation of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Vosloorus
detail: The Vosloorus system was settled at some point during the Age of War, and was a member of the Free Worlds League by the end of that era. Pharmaceuticals are researched produced in vast amounts here, thanks to the unique fungi growing on the planet.

name: Vulcan
detail: The Vulcan system was colonised by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. The arid and rocky climate of the world leaves it quite defensible.

name: Vulture's Nest
detail: The Vulture's Nest system was either settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned during the Second Succession War after pirates conquered and pillaged the system.

name: Waddesdon
detail: The Waddesdon system was settled before the Reunification War, and has remained part of the Draconis Combine for centuries. It's vast mudflats cover a large collection of Star League era vaults, many of which are still being found to this day.

name: Waimalu
detail: The Waimalu system was settled before the Age of War, and has remained part of the Federated Suns for centuries. It is a lagely agricultural world with the finest meats cut from the avian creatures that inhabit the second continent.

name: Waini Point
detail: The Waina Point system was either settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned during the Second Succession War after the capital city was destroyed in a nuclear attack.

name: Waipahu
detail: The Waipahu system was settled before the Age of War, and has remained part of the Federated Suns for centuries. It has a low tech but heavy industrial base which continues to churn out parts for ground forces, and a growing narcotics trade.

name: Waitur
detail: The Waitur system was either settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but was abandoned during the Third Succession War as famine struck.

name: Waldheim
detail: The Waldheim system was settled before or during the Reunification War. A high gravity world known for it's rugged nature, many ground forces train here to simulate mountainous battles.

name: Waldorff
detail: Waldorff is the second planet in the system and has a single moon named Nikola. The capital of Waldorff City is known for it's cavernous storm drains used for illegal racing, a dangerous pursuit in light of the savage storms that can hit the world.

name: Wallacia
detail: The Wallacia system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and had a training ground amongst the vast mudflats created for the Second Oriente Hussars.

name: Wallis
detail: Wallis is the sixth planet in the system and has a single moon. Wallis is home to factories belonging to at least one significant defense manufacturer, Ronin Incorporated. Vuzar, the seventh planet, is an icy retreat for wealthier citizens.

name: Wantorill
detail: The Wantorill system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but suffered famine during the Third Succession War, leaving it depopulated.

name: Wapakoneta
detail: Wapakoneta is an oceanic world, with the local economy largely based around exporting aquaculture-grown marine life, although the planet had many small, beautiful islands suitable for tourism.

name: Wappingers
detail: Large canyons and heavy seismic activity make mining activities dangerous on Wappingers - but also highly lucrative. High risk, high reward is often their motto.

name: Ward
detail: Ward is a warm water planet with one small continent. The utopian ideals of Ward's original settlers remain strong in its population of 1.5 billion, and the planet thrives based on their reputation for solid construction work.

name: Wark
detail: Located relatively close to the Deep Periphery systems known as Cambridge and Trinity, the Wark system primary is a type G0V star.

name: Warlock
detail: Warlock is the third planet in the system and has a single moon named Blackguard. Warlock is the home to at least one facility operated by Ceres Metals Industries while Blackguard is the site of a substantial naval repair base.

name: Warren
detail: An unremarkable agro world, it's capital city of Hutch contains a massive memorial hall dedicated to the Third Dragonlords regiment, of whom lost many members centuries ago in a tragic dropship accident.

name: Warrumbungle
detail: The Warrumbungle system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but the atmosphere was boiled away during the fighting in the Second Succession War, leaving it depopulated.

name: Wasat
detail: The Wasat system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and was a major industrial world for the Star League. The ruins of many Castle Brian's can be found across the planet, a source of LosTech.

name: Washburn
detail: The Washburn system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra. Washburn II is the second planet in the Washburn system and has three moons named Cephas, Elihu and Israel. Washburn has been home to a refit facility operated by Irian Technologies.

name: Watermael
detail: The Watermael system was settled during the Age of War and then became a member of the Free Worlds League. The 21st Royal Division of the SLDF fought on this world centuries ago, and rumours exist of Star League weapons caches hidden away here.

name: Waunakee
detail: Waunakee was liberated by the Federated Suns during the first majorcounter-offensive of the First Succession War against the Draconis Combine. Centuries later, the industrial base has still not recovered to Star League era levels.

name: Waxell
detail: The Waxell system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. Since the Third Succession War, it's factories and industrial base have been exporting large amounts of polymers to nearby worlds.

name: Waycross
detail: The Waycross system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but the atmosphere was boiled away during the fighting in the Second Succession War, leaving it depopulated.

name: Waypoint
detail: The Waypoint system was settled during the Star League era, but the population eked out a meager living until recently. They have recently signed a deal for a HPG with Comstar however.

name: Waystation 531
detail: Waypoint 531 consists of a red giant sun and "The Brothers", four large asteroids in varying orbits around the star. The THS Yosemite, a Terran Hegemony colony JumpShip, was lost here over five hundred years ago.

name: Wazan
detail: An oft traded world, Wazan is nevertheless full of surprises with it's deep mines amongst it's rocky terrain.

name: Weatogue
detail: The Weatogue system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. Ignored during the Succession Wars, Weatogue is an perma-frost agricultural world known for it's Ice Cold Beer.

name: Wedderborg
detail: The Wedderborg system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War and survived the first two Succession Wars, until it was struck by famine during the Third and abandoned.

name: Wedgefield
detail: The Wedgefield system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra, and is known for it's pastures and cloth industries.

name: Weekapaug
detail: The Weekapaug system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the St. Ives Mercantile League prior to the formation of the Capellan Confederation in the mid-twenty-fourth century.

name: Wei
detail: During the Fourth Succession War a repository of Star League chemical weaponry and nerve agents was discovered and unleashed on the population of this world, killing almost a billion citizens. Wei is still in recovery now.

name: Weingarten
detail: Weingarten is best known for its vast wine industry. The mild weather and long growing seasons make Weingarten ideal for growing crops, particularly grapes. Wine from the world is highly prized which leads to large profit margins for exporters.

name: Weippe
detail: Weippe is best known for it's fine grain sands and glassblowing industries, which are unique to the planet.

name: Weisau
detail: A binary star system, the fifth world is nicknamed "Brimstone" by the natives; it has a large satellite world called Fire. The temperature range at the polar capital of Port Erebus can vary over 70 degrees in one day.

name: Weiss
detail: Weiss is a prison planet. Not officially, if you ask Haven officials, but off the record it is a prison world, used for labor camps holding political dissidents and anyone branded a criminal by the Haven families. Life is hard and short on Weiss.

name: Weistheimer
detail: The Weistheimer system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the Reunification War, but has been abandoned and resettled numerous times over the centuries as mineral deposits are found and depleted.

name: Weitinger
detail: This grim and bleak ball of mud was only colonized for its central position in rimward Capellan space. The outpost was eventually abandoned in favor of refueling stations at the jump points, and the planet-side colony buildings sunk into the mud.

name: Weiz
detail: The Weiz system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the Reunification War. Weiz vanished from maps at some point after the end of the First Succession War after the atmosphere became too irradiated for the colonists.

name: Weldon
detail: The Weldon system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and is home to a galaxy famous author who often writes about the heroic tales of MechWarriors.

name: Weldry
detail: Weldry is a cold world with a thin atmosphere that's only breathable in the lowlands and valleys. The highlands are barren, windswept, uninhabited ice. The highest form of life is a vicious stinging insect that can form mile-wide swarms.

name: Werfer
detail: The Werfer system was settled during or shortly before the Age of War by the Taurian Concordat, but was abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Wernke (Talon)
detail: Wernke is the third planet in the Wernke system and has a single inhabited and heavily-industrialized moon named Talon, which oft confuses stellar cartographers and map makers alike.

name: Westerhand
detail: Westerhand is the second planet in the system and has three moons named Delsia, Ralston and Vannora. Known for it's Star League era mech repair facilities, which are renown throughout the Sian Commonality. Westerhand, though not as famous as Solaris VII or Noisiel, was also host to low-level BattleMech combat games from time to time.

name: Westerstede
detail: The Westerstede system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra and was a member of the Protectorate of Donegal prior to the founding of the Lyran Commonwealth.

name: Westfield
detail: The Westfield system was settled during the Star League era but was devastated during the First Succession War, leaving the planet a molten uninhabitable ruin.

name: Westover
detail: Westover is the fourth planet in the Westover system and has a single moon named Duban. Westover is been home to facilities belonging to numerous defense manufacturers, most notably Andurien AeroTech.

name: Westphalia
detail: The Westphalia system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the Reunification War, and conquered by the Federated Suns during the Second Succession War. The system was later abandoned in the fighting of the Third Succession War.

name: Wetumpka
detail: The Wetumpka system was settled before or during the Age of War and was a part of the Federated Suns by the end of the era. Wetumpka is known for it's massive rumbling waters from it's many rivers and waterfalls.

name: Wheel
detail: Named "Wheel" after the massive recharge station and habitat at its zenith jump point (featuring a wheel-shaped gravdeck around a needle-shaped core) that also serves as administrative center for the asteroid facilities in the system.

name: Whittington
detail: The Whittington system was settled during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. The planet is mostly barren, with small patches of fertile land surrounding the extensive volcanic activity.

name: Wildwood
detail: Wildwood is a lush and sparsely populated planet nearing the outer edge of the Magistracy of Canopus. In spite of a small population, Wildwood was the largest producer of wine and other agricultural products in the Magistracy.

name: Wilkes
detail: The Wilkes system was settled before or during the First Exodus from Terra, and has a thriving industrial base thanks to the thermal boreholes that descend deep into the planets mantle.

name: Willowick
detail: The Willowick system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra and became during the Age of War a member of the Federated Suns. It's large lakes and watersports are tourist hotspots for nearby worlds.

name: Willunga
detail: The Willunga system was originally a part of the Finmark Province by the Rim Worlds Republic, but joined the Lyran Commonwealth when the Star League fell.

name: Wiltshire
detail: The Wiltshire system was settled by the Rim Worlds Republic during the Star League era, but fell into Lyran hands during the fall of the Star League.

name: Windhoek
detail: The Windhoek system was colonised prior to the Age of War, but was abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Windsor
detail: The Windsor system was colonised during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. Grand palaces and country seats dot the pristine landscape of Windsor, known for it's aristocratic nature.

name: Winfield
detail: Winfield was originally named Treeline, but was gifted to the commander of the Stealths, Colonel Raymond Winfield, by Archon Elizabeth Steiner after their destruction in the conquest of Sakhalin in 2863 and renamed "Winfield" in his honour.

name: Wing
detail: Wing was settled not for the world itself, but because its four moons have extensive amounts of titanium, bauxite, and germanium. The Capital of Crow's Nest is situated high in the mountains, providing Line of Sight to facilities on the moons.

name: Wingzar
detail: The Wingzar system was colonised during the Star League era, but was destroyed during the Second Succession War.

name: Winter
detail: Once the site of a major Displass Technologies industrial hub, Winter was devastated during the Amaris Civil War. Many facilities were completely destroyed and now only a moderate industrial base remains.

name: Wisconsin
detail: The Wisconsin system was colonized by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, and maintains strong links with neighbouring worlds.

name: Wismar
detail: Ruled by the Council of Merchants, Wismar is an agricultural world that provides food sources for the trade hubs across the Hanseatic League. There are also rumours of a black market in narcotics thanks to the hallucinogenic plants native to Wismar.

name: Wittington
detail: The Wittington system was annexed by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era, then conquered by the Federated Suns during the Second Succesion War before being eventually destroyed during the Third Succession War.

name: Wokha
detail: The Wokha system was settled at some time during the Star League era, but the colony died out sometime during the First Succession War.

name: Wolcott
detail: The Wolcott system was colonised at some point during or prior to the Age of War, with the capital of Farmingbury being the muddy jewel of the entire system. The Succession Wars have succeeded in causing Wolcott to maintain a low profile.

name: Wolof
detail: The Wolof system was settled by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. It is known for it's quiet coastal villages and it's vast fishing population.

name: Wonju
detail: The Wonju system was annexed by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era, but was destroyed in the fighting during the First Succesion War.

name: Woodbine
detail: The Woodbine system was colonized by the Federated Suns during the Age of War. A world known for it's vast planetwide forests and large mineral content, Woodbine's population is still hindered by the high gravity of their world.

name: Woodstock
detail: The Woodstock system was colonized in the second half of the twenty-second century. During the Amaris Civil War, chemical weapons rendered an entire continent uninhabitable. Still uninhabitable today, it is used for research purposes.

name: Woogi
detail: The Woogi system was colonised during the Star League era, but was destroyed during the Second Succession War.

name: Worrell
detail: The Worrell system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra, and is now ruled from New Samarkand.

name: Wotan
detail: The Wotan system is home to numerous industries such as Krauss-Lieman Incorporated and Wotan Mining Systems, making it a key industrial location. It also houses the remains of Hevrol Aero Base, a Star League era facility.

name: Wrentham
detail: Wrentham is a minor industrial world that is notable only for the volcanic activity caused by its proximity to its gas giant primary. Tidal forces flex and stress the crust of the world, but the extreme ocean tides have led to flourishing sea life.

name: Wright
detail: The Wright system was colonized by the Confederation during the Star League era after the Reunification War, and is now part of the Sian Commonality - containing most of the valuable industry and developed worlds of the Confederation.

name: Wrociaw
detail: The Wrociaw system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra, and is known for it's heavy tank track production facilities.

name: Wroxeter
detail: The Wroxeter system was colonized during or shortly before the Age of War, and is located near the Crucis March. Deep boreholes allow for mining petroleum and other fuels from deep within the mantle of the planet.

name: Wyatt
detail: Wyatt is a planet of deserts and strange rock formations, perfect for defensive purposes. Bowie Industries maintains manufacturing facilities on the planet, producing mech and dropship parts.

name: Wynn's Roost
detail: The Wynn's Roost system was colonised in the Star League era, and survived to become capital of the Trader's Domain, a short lived micro-state. Eventually it succumbed to pirate attacks and was abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Wypoute
detail: The Wypoute system was colonised in the Star League era, but was destroyed during the Third Succession War.

name: Xanthe
detail: The Xanthe system was colonized by the Capellan Confederation during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. The moon of Xanthe III is still littered with debris from an ancient battle long ago.

name: Xanthe III
detail: This minor agricultural world once had an inhabited moon, but during the late Star League era, a terrorist attack sent an orbital fueling station crashing into the moon, rendering it uninhabitable.

name: Xenia
detail: The Xenia system was colonized during the Age of War, and is situated within the Crucis March. Renown for it's lumber production, this system acts as a central trading hub for nearby worlds.

name: Xhosa
detail: A icy planet with a large population, Xhosa is known for it's Aerospace Academy. The nearby Aerospace industry is however somewhat depressed by war.

name: Xieng Khouang
detail: The Xieng Khouang system was settled at some point prior to the Age of War, and often relies on mercenaries for protection.

name: Xinyang
detail: Xinyang is the capital world of the Xinyang Prefecture. If Xinyang had anything other than a large amount of fresh water, it could be an industrial powerhouse. Unfortunately the water is the only resource the planet really offers.

name: Yamarovka
detail: The Yamarovka system was settled at some point during the beginning of the Terran Hegemony in 2319. Yamarovka is noted for its overcast and monsoon type seasonal wealth. It's two principle cities are Yama and New Circe.

name: Yamoussoukra
detail: The Yamoussoukra system was colonised in the Star League era, but was wiped out during the First Succession War.

name: Yanchep
detail: The Yanchep system was colonised by the Free Worlds League during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War, but opposing planetary governments constantly seeks it's independence.

name: Yangtze
detail: Massive dams were constructed across Yangtze during the Star League era to turn the desert into an agricultural paradise, but were sabotaged during the Succession Wars leading to over a billion deaths.  Only smaller agricultural areas remain.

name: Yarborough
detail: The Republican Senate has chambers on Yarborough which they retire to once a year, ostensibly to connect with the common man. In reality, the Senate uses Yarborough as a vacation home and rarely gets any work done while in recess there. The locals love it though, as there is an entire economy around the Senate's yearly visit.

name: Yardley
detail: The Yardley system was settled at some point prior to the end of the Reunification War. The three moons surrounding Yardley cause planetwide storms due to tidal effects.

name: Yed Posterior
detail: The Yed Posterior system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. Previous a major manufacturing hub, all Mechworks facilities were destroyed during the Second Succession War and have not been rebuilt.

name: Yed Prior
detail: The Yed Prior system was settled during or shortly after the First Exodus from Terra. It is also home to the famous Mitchellson University of Arts and Crafts.

name: Yeguas
detail: Yeguas has spent most of the Succession Wars as a quiet agricultural world famous for raising horses and growing food. Massive agricultural concerns own most of the third largest continent, producing large amounts of exportable crops.

name: Yetholm
detail: A frozen iceball, Yetholm is notable for nothing. If it wasn't being used as a surveilance outpost, it'd largely go totally unnoticed by the universe at large. Even as-is, it is remarkable only for its extreme unremarkableness.

name: Yidtall
detail: The Yidtall system was colonised in the Star League era, but was wiped out during the First Succession War.

name: Ylemelke
detail: The Ylemelke system was colonised in the Star League era, but was wiped out during the First Succession War.

name: Yongd
detail: The Yongd system was colonised in the Star League era, but was wiped out during the Third Succession War.

name: Yorii
detail: Yorii was a major trading hub throughout most of the peacetime years, whilst maintaining a sizeable industrial complex too. Neo-Tokyo, the capital city, often has citizens of dual-nationalities within it's boundaries.

name: York (LC)
detail: The colony of York was founded by Scots-Irish refugees fleeing from the war between the Stewart Confederation and the Free Worlds League in 2305.

name: Ype-Jhu
detail: The Ype-Jhu system was colonised in the Star League era, but was abandoned during the First Succession War after heavy fighting.

name: Yufu
detail: The Yufu system was colonised in the Star League era, but was abandoned during the First Succession War after heavy fighting.

name: Yumesta
detail: The Yumesta system was settled by the Draconis Combine during the Star League era. Along with other cultural plazas, it is the site of the Regis Art Gallery, a large complex built solely for housing royal artifacts.

name: Yunnah
detail: Despite its considerable mineral wealth, Yunnah remained nearly uninhabited as late as 3025, when the Capellan government established advanced repair and medical facilities here.

name: Yuris
detail: Originally a Star League staging ground, Yuris has a long and bloody history of urban conflict with various resistance groups. Despite this, in the lush rural regions, many industries prosper.

name: Zacatecoluca
detail: The Zacatecoluca system was colonised in the Star League era, but was abandoned during the First Succession War after heavy fighting.

name: Zalaf
detail: The Zalaf system was settled or annexed by the Draconis Combine at some point during the Reunification War. Majesty Metals have a small Aerotech construction facility on the planet.

name: Zalt
detail: The Zalt system was colonised in the Star League era, but was abandoned during the Second Succession War after heavy bombardment.

name: Zalzangor
detail: The Zalzangor system was colonised in the Star League era, but was abandoned during the First Succession War after heavy fighting.

name: Zambezi
detail: The Zambezi system was colonised in the Star League era, but was wiped out during the Third Succession War.

name: Zanbasa
detail: The Zanbasa system was colonised in the Star League era, but was wiped out during the First Succession War.

name: Zanderij
detail: The Zanderij system was colonized by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. The medical research undertaken here is enhanced by the hallucinogenic fruit found growing across the planet.

name: Zangul
detail: Zangul is a cold water-world with chains of rocky islands and sprawling archipelagos. Most of the population lives on a single island, which is entirely covered with the slowly-decaying hulk of the original Capellan spaceport.

name: Zaniah
detail: Though Zaniah has some light commercial industry and is known for its exported civilian vehicles, it is best known for the Mechwarrior sanctuary named St. Marinus House, which is located deep in one of its deserts.

name: Zanzibar
detail: Zanzibar was originally settled by the Taurian Concordat, but was absorbed during a Liao expansion centuries ago. It has a strong black market where almost anything can be traded.

name: Zaprudy
detail: The Zaprudy system was colonized by the Lyran Commonwealth during the Star League era at some point after the end of the Reunification War. Known for it's massive tar and mudflats, many scavengers often comb them for Lostech or other remains.

name: Zara (FWL)
detail: The Zara system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Zathras
detail: Zathras was a Magistracy system that broke away and declared its independence. The new state styles itself an 'Empire', and has made aggressive moves towards the newly-independent Aquagea.

name: Zaurak
detail: A relatively small world with one major city, Zaurak is known for it's agricultural prowess in the face of extensive massive planetary weather shifts.

name: Zavijava
detail: The Zavijava system was colonized during the First Exodus from Terra. Extensive volcanism began in the early 26th Century which caused a major climate shift as temperatures cooled.

name: Zawiercie
detail: The Zawiercie system was colonised in the Star League era, but was abandoned during the First Succession War due to utter devastation.

name: Zdice
detail: Settled in the early years of the Star League, Zdice is known for it's prestigious universities. Beautiful rings encircle the planet, providing a boost to tourism.

name: Zebebelgenubi
detail: Deposits of silicon and precious gemstones ensure Zebebelgenubi has a bright future as a major manufacturer and research complex. Rumours abound of Lostech caches hidden in the mountains, but few have been found.

name: Zebeneschamali
detail: The mountainous icy terrain of Zebenescamali houses billions of citizens, who enjoy the security offered by the wealth from the mining resources of the planet.  The low gravity also makes winter sports particularly favourable for tourism.

name: Zebrenaski
detail: The Zebrenaski system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Zebuluraskai
detail: The Zebuluraskai system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Second Succession War.

name: Zefri
detail: The Zelmag system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned shortly thereafter due to plague.

name: Zelmag
detail: The Zelmag system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Zelski
detail: The Zelski system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Zempoatlepetl
detail: The Zempoatlepetl system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Zertarum
detail: The Zertarum system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Zetang
detail: The Zetang system was colonised in the Star League era, but abandoned during the Third Succession War.

name: Zhaomaon (Cluff's Stand 3130+)
detail: Cluff's Stand is named for the revolutionary leader who seized power when the Capellans abandoned the world. It is dominated by a single, sprawling megacity, New Durban, and fed by massive coastal algae farms.

name: Zhongshan
detail: Colonised during the Star League, Zhongshan hosted a Star League Defense Force garrison for many years. Treasure hunters often search the highlands in search of rumours of hidden caches.

name: Ziliang
detail: A harsh Capellan world, Ziliang had two industries: Mining and prisons. The mining facilities were run by prisoners, who often died in the dangerous environment. After the Federated Suns took over, labour was a much more hospitable affair.

name: Zinal
detail: Zinal was founded during the Star League era, but cataclysmic earthquakes destroyed the colony and swallowed it whole. It has been abandoned since.

name: Zindao
detail: Zindao was destroyed during the Second Succession War, and is home to very few settlers ekeing out a miserable existence.

name: Zion
detail: An oft fought over border world, Zion is known for it's arid climates and Star League ruins.

name: Zlatousi
detail: The Zlatousi system joined the Outworlds Alliance at some point during the Age of War. It's volcanic past provides extremely fertile soils for agricultural needs.

name: Zoetermeer
detail: Colonised at some point after the Reunification Era, Zoetermeer II is the second planet in the Zolfo system and has a single moon named Zegwaard.

name: Zolfo
detail: Originally a dry dusty world barely able to feed itself, recent discoveries by BP Interstellar of massive deposits of petroleum, coal and other minerals have reinvigorated investment in the entire planet.

name: Zollikofen
detail: Zollikofen is the first planet of eleven in the Zollikofen system. The surface of Zollikofen is home to at least one industrial manufacturer, Acme Widgets, and a host of mining concerns.

name: Zorn's Keep
detail: The Zorn's Keep system was settled during the Succession Wars and became significant enough for Inner Sphere nations to record its position. It is unremarkable, except for a small mining presence.

name: Zortman
detail: The Zortman system was settled during the First Exodus from Terra, and subsequently joined the Free Worlds League. The Center for Technology Research is renown across many systems.

name: Zosma
detail: Zosma is a rocky, arid world with a thin atmosphere; subject to brutal levels of year-round heat from the system primary star and possessing nutrient poor soil, there are few species of native flora on the planet.

name: Zuhbehr
detail: Zuhbehr was devastated during the Third Succession War and abandoned shortly thereafter.

name: Zumbo
detail: Zumbo was devastated during the Third Succession War and abandoned shortly thereafter.

name: Zurich
detail: Zurich was one of Maximilian Liao's favorite worlds, receiving favourable trade agreements and tax breaks. Though it lacks economic resources and position, the presence of Star League era BattleMechs increased the tourist trade to the world.

name: Zvolen
detail: The Zvolen system was settled at some point before the mid-twenty-fourth century and joined the Lyran Commonwealth during the Age of War. During the final years of the Star League, Zvolen was the site of a Star League Defense Force garrison.

name: Zwenkau
detail: Fighting on Zwenkau was part of the initial skirmishes that resulted in the commencement of the Second Succession War. It's factories still produce a substantial amount of armaments.

name: Zwillman
detail: Zwillman is a popular world, famous for its broad shallow seas and tropical climate, and serves as one of the main recreation planets in the Sanctuary Worlds. Any pleasure you desire can be had here, for the right price or with the right friends.

name: Zwipadze
detail: Settled during the Star League, the fourth planet in the Zwipadze system is known for it's pharmaceutical and narcotics trade.
